Reviews.Content: We came for a conference and we pleasantly surprised. The room was nice and I really enjoyed the balcony. It was nice to have a separate shower, it made it easier to get my son in and out. I enjoyed the location as I could walk to the outdoor shopping area and enjoy a meal at one of my favorite restaurants, Yard House. The food they provided for the conference was definitely better than expected. My son really enjoyed the lazy river and the water slide, he could have stayed there all day if I’d let him. It is a very big hotel and depending on your location you may have to walk a bit (we were quite a ways from our conference so I definitely got my exercise for the day). I tried to book at the spa but they were very full and couldn’t work around my time. If you are planning on going there I would book in advance. We staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, fun for family”
Reviews.Author: larryschwartz
Reviews.Content: We chose this location because we wanted a nice place that my four year old son would also enjoy. It was a good choice. The customeer service was awesome. We spent several days just floating on the lazy river and my little guy loved the water slide. Dining was great too. All of the kids meals were included since we were resort guests and all of the restaurants took great care of us. We were able to eat well and still make sure that my son was happy. The rooms were clean and they quickly took care of any requests like towels and other standard stuff. We would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but prepare to WALK”
Reviews.Author: Bizzygal1111
Reviews.Content: Attended a large conf Oct 2011- the room was nice and the bathroom was huge with plenty of countertop. The conf center must have been 1/2 mile (one way) back and forth to my room, which is not ideal when you'r dressed up for business meetings, etc. Good shopping and great food. Adorable ducks beg for scraps at the outdoor pondside patio :) I liked it, many others did not.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: Dealsnphotos
Reviews.Content: This is as good as it gets when it comes to friendly and helpful staff. Its a beautiful resort whit all the things you could need. I was there a while,so I took advantage of the free guest laundry. The scenery was great and the pools fantastic. I had a little trouble working out a time to get the room cleaned, but nothing major. It's in a good location, with restaurants and shopping. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: earladybon
Reviews.Content: Came here for a business conference but had some time to enjoy the facilities. The resort is just beautiful with tremendous thought as to layout, landscaping,facilities and just a real joy to the eyes. The lazy river pool is pure fun and relaxing. The hotel is very family friendly with kids having a blast in the pools and at a child center. The staff everywhere seemed to be especially trained in human kindness. They were never in your face but always seem to appear when you needed assistance. The food was fabulous. We had an especially good time with Umberto and Ana from food service. Restaurants were plentiful and service/staff were great. The rooms were clean, the beds wonderful, the room very airy with a great view of the mountains. Bathrooms were very large with modern amenities. This facility was the best! Although I was here for a conference I never felt less than an invited welcomed guest and treated like a queen. Dont hesitate to come alone, with a family or for business. This facility was the best I've seen in a long time!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and peaceful - and baby friendly!”
Reviews.Author: LillyDeViaje
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights while I attended a conference. The conference and lobby facilities were gorgeous. The on-site restaurants and entertainment were great (although the restaurants did seem a bit overpriced). The lazy river, pools, and outdoor lounging areas were spectacular. We loved the desert botanical gardens, and the convenience of the rental car office on-site. Staff were exceedingly warm, welcoming, and helpful. The room was very clean and comfortable. It was baby friendly as well, offering a crib in the room (that was more solid and more comfortable for my son than a standard pack-n-play type item), a free rubber ball to play with in the pool upon check-in, and high chairs at the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “One of my all time favorite Marriott Properties”
Reviews.Author: dtanpcs
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. It has an amazing lazy river pool. I upgraded to a wonderful suite with a huge deck and a bathroom that is bigger than most rooms in regular hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent conference venue”
Reviews.Author: wisgirl01
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 nights for a national conference, and it was spectacular! The rooms were impeccably clean, with a large room and huge bathroom, nice quality amenities, and the staff was very friendly. I also liked that my room had a balcony overlooking the desert botanical garden. It was a nice escape for some fresh air after a long day of meetings. The conference rooms were conveniently located, and the grouds were amazng. I wish I had time to enjoy the pool and golf course, both were beautiful and very inviting. Would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “A "10" plus”
Reviews.Author: Louiexo
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a four day stay at the Desert Ridge for a conference, and I was blown away. Everything was top-notch. The room I had was on the top floor and overlooked the desert botanical garden and golf club. The view was breathtaking from my balcony, and the room was very quiet (even though the hotel was fully booked). The pool areas and outdoor lounges were great, the service fantastic, and even the singers in the bar areas were good! I organized a little golf outing for the conference, which the club staff was fantastic about facilitating. And the (Arnold Palmer) course was fantastic! Everything about my stay was flawless, including the meals we enjoyed at Roy's and the Meritage. I wholeheartedly recommend the Desert Ridge for anyone looking for a perfect vacation spot or conference locale.

Reviews.Title: “How do you say fabulous?”
Reviews.Author: momonbusiness
Reviews.Content: If you like sun, desert, lounging by the pool and watching the stars at night, this resort is for you. I was there for a conference. The facilities were excellent - when everyone wasn't sneaking outside to enjoy the pool area. There are hot tubs and relaxing areas for the grown UPS, a lazy river for the kids and restaurants for all tastes. Roy's Hawaiian Fusion is especially good. The golf is also excellent with reasonable prices and quality rentals. While I wish it wasn't so far from downtown, there's really no reason to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: jjasper78
Reviews.Content: Just attended the SHSMD conference at the Marriot Desert Ridge and it was a fantastic hotel! Staff were there to direct you and serve you everywhere! And they were so friendly! They really seemed to love their jobs! And the hotel was beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but lots of amenities”
Reviews.Author: cuberican
Reviews.Content: Had a conference at the hotel. It's typical of a JW in that it's high end and has a lot of amenities. It is massive though, so not everything is at your fingertips. Lots of walking between rooms and various activities. Enjoyed a massage at Revive Spa. I recommend having lunch at the Spa Cafe. It's healthy and reasonable, compared to other places. Roy's is always a good choice for a very nice meal. The Concierge did a great job of helping us arrange dinners off property. We had a wonderful meal at Ocean Prime, which is across the road, but a $6 cab ride, because you wouldn't want to walk over in the heat. I also had to rend a car for the day, but that was super easy because Hertz has a location on site. Because this was for business, I did not go to the pool, but others reported that the pool was really nice. And some even brought their kids and said the water park was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful retreat with lots of activities”
Reviews.Author: Veni-vidi-vicidotcom
Reviews.Content: I won a stay at this beautiful resort and did a lot of activies in the area. The workout facilities were great and of course Marriott is very true to their brand. Very high quality

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: polaraubie
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the spacious room and the generous bathroom, with big tub and separate shower, and lanai overlooking the very well-kept grounds. Terrific pool and areas for walking around the grounds. Convenient shopping a short drive away. Fine service. Roy's offers a terrific selection of drinks and bites at happy hour and serves up a fine dinner. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: viaje4fun
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at a JW Marriott and we will definitely be back! We felt like we were in the Carribean or Hawaii. Sumptous lobby, fabulous pools, wonderful, customer service oriented staff. Several restaurants, decent size rooms, huge bathrooms with both tubs and showers. My son wants to skip our next Carribean trip and return here instead! Look online for good deals, we found one that included the lovely breakfast buffet. Note that we went during low season so the resort was not crowded and we received a room upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Great summer fun”
Reviews.Author: craftnut
Reviews.Content: Loved this place! Came here for a summer deal, wanted great pool and great food. Despite the 117 degree day, the lazy river was perfect! Drinks were expensive, but the pina colada was the best I've ever had. We upgraded to the Cloud Club--so worth it! Included afternoon bruschetta, appetizers, cocktails, dessert and after dinner drinks and full breakfast (even omelets cooked to order). Next time we would skip dinner in the restaurant since we filled up on the delicious appetizers. Also enjoyed great jazz music in the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort overflowing...literally”
Reviews.Author: pikiniki93
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a family of 5 in an Executive Suite with one bedroom. The room was spacious and very well appointed. The resort is lovely and large with a number of pools, world class golf along with a wonderful spa. The location is a bit isolated but there is a large shopping center right next to the resort and the 101 freeway is within a 5 min drive. My only real complaint was the number of people in the lazy river and surrounding area. This was a BIG issue because in AZ in the summer you NEED to have a way to cool off if you are outside. It was quite ridiculous. For a resort this large and for the price, the lazy river should have been 4 times its size. You literally were touching the people next to you if you decided to cool off and get in the water. Sitting in the surrounding lounge area wasn't any better. Chairs and towels were lined up right next to each other; absolutely uncomfortable. Although the food service staff was working hard, it took nearly an hour to bring us 4 drinks. Many more wait staff was needed. We would have given 5 stars for this property had it been based on the resort's INDOOR experience alone.

Reviews.Title: “Well kept considering it's age, but too many kids”
Reviews.Author: business_traveler008
Reviews.Content: We are big Marriott users, so I was happy to find that this resort must have been the model for the San Antonio resort -- grand, flowing, many services, and fun but elegant decor. Considering that this is an older property, it's well maintained and had been refreshed recently. The stay was good...except for all the children. They were everywhere! It didn't help that it was a holiday weekend, and that parents seem to turn off their radar of bad behavior, but I was bothered by all their noise, running around, causing lines, and general disorder. If you don't have kids and are looking for a peaceful vacation, this might not be the place for you...or at least consider the time of year and who else might be looking for a getaway too.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible way to spend a long weekend”
Reviews.Author: luvs2travel0812
Reviews.Content: Met highschool friends here for a 'girls weekend'. The hotel was wonderful. My room and bathroom were huge and tastefully decorated. The bathrooms have separate bathtubs and showers and the shower has alot of room to move around and great waterpressure. I loved having a balcony overlooking the golf course...gorgeous view. We spent alot of our time at the pools and the water temperature was perfect, there were plenty of chairs and towels (I loved the complimentary pitchers of ice water which was a great touch). The service around the pool was also great. We had wonderful quesadillas for lunch one day, and the staff even came around and refilled water pitchers when they were empty. We also loved the happy hour at the outdoor restaurant. All appetizers and drinks were $5 and they were phenominal. I would highly recommend the lobster potstickers. Also, on the weekends, they have a very talented musician who played during happy hour and we really enjoyed sipping drinks, listening to him. There are only a couple areas that I wasn't as impressed about but they are VERY minor. First, this resort has 4 pools and alot of families as well as non families (including business travelers). This trip was a girl's weekend where we were all getting away from our families, so it was tough trying to relax with kids running around screaming. It would have been nice if one of the pools could have been an 'adults only' pool for all the non families. Second, although each room has a mini fridge (very mini), there is no microwave. That would have been really helpful since we ended up with alot of leftovers from eating out.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, great location, nice staff and amenities. Bunnies, too!”
Reviews.Author: Uraway
Reviews.Content: This property is without a doubt the best use of your Marriott points. My wife and I stayed here for a long weekend in fall. The two courses are great; the location is an easy in and out, and there's even convenient shopping nearby. We really enjoyed the pool layout, with numerous private areas. Walking the grounds at dusk is a treat, when all the bunnies come out to dine on the lawn. A lot of fun and relaxation. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of fun for everyone”
Reviews.Author: abqcarvan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Labor Day weekend - 2 adults and 3 teens. The rooms were large and comfortable, very nice bathrooms with a separate shower and tub, and a balcony. The pool area is very nice, kept very clean. There are several pools, a lazy river and a (very) small water slide. Lots of restaurants and a starbucks, all pretty expensive. The hotel is structured to keep you and your money there - it's a long walk to the parking lot and valet parking is pricey. Tons of activities for kids and families. There is a large shopping center close by with many restaurants, though. There is a central block of rooms built up around the lobby area and two wings that stretch to the sides. Our rooms were on the fifth floor of the lobby and it was loud - live music every evening and voices really carried up. Also, lots of drunk twenty-somethings - oh well, at least they weren't driving.

Reviews.Title: “Cloud Club was a great experience”
Reviews.Author: Ilovelamp27
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at JW Camelback and this year, lured by the Cloud Club brochure we decided to try out the JW Desert Ridge. Let me say that we fully enjoyed the JW Desert Ridge, but the experience was VERY different than Camelback. Camelback is very Southwestern/Desert and very intimate, while JW is a huge hotel.... That being said....the Cloud Club was great (Alison knew my name after just checking me in) and the lounge is very nice with nice selection of foods and beverages. The only disappointment was that it promised an omelet station and there was one only one of the 4 mornings we were there. Being big fans, that was a disappointment. The access to the adults only spa pool at Revive spa was very nice- large pool and very quiet. It helped us get away from the hoards of families that were there. I will say the spa pool needs some new towels...they were pitiful. Room was okay- nothing special. Again, oddly the room needed some new plush towels. Toiletries wereJW standard and desperately need a trendy update, but this has nothing to do with the hotel itself. Overall, it was good, and the Cloud Club experience made it very good, but I think we missed the intimacy and true Southwestern experience of Camelback. Would recomend this for families or those traveling with a group over couples. (Lazy river and kids activities abounded!)

Reviews.Title: “Disturbing Maintenance Issues”
Reviews.Author: Laurie A
Reviews.Content: Our bathroom sink faucet came OFF the sink during use, causing a rush of high pressure water running on the bathroom floor, which quickly flooded into the room and out into the hallway. When the hotel maintenance person arrived he was not equipped with what he needed to resolve the problem, so he LEFT the room while the water continued to flood the room. After he finally stopped the water flow and replaced the faucet, he provided us with bathroom rugs to correct the situation for the remainder of the night. (YES – bathroom rugs!) Within minutes these rugs were soaked with water, and outright gross to step on with bare feet. Unfortunately my purse and and overnight bag were in the bathroom during this incident, causing damage to my personal things. I spent over an hour pouring and squeezing out water from my things and laying my clothes and shoes out on the patio to dry. We never received a follow-up call from the Front desk on the incident. We should have been moved to another room or at minimum received a follow-up call asking if we needed anything. No phone call. The most disturbing part is that that room will be rented AGAIN with that lose sink faucet and carpet that will most definitely smell like mildew.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Arizona resort”
Reviews.Author: Stowawaygirl
Reviews.Content: Very swanky resort with all resort amenities. Great spa, wonderful staff, great food. Fifteen miles north of most Phoenix attractions, but with AWESOME pools, why leave?

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch J.W. Marriott - Don't know why we waited so long to visit!”
Reviews.Author: luvmms
Reviews.Content: This place is First Class all the way! From the moment we got there to the moment we departed. You never really have to leave the J.W. since they pretty much have everything on the property, from great dining choices, spa. golf and just a really fun pool, especially for kids. Although it was 100+ degrees outside, it was a really nice visit @ Desert Ridge. I would suggest that you valet your car, I can't imagine walking from the parking lot in this heat and it is quite a distance. The room was spacious, including the bathroom. We had a great view of the driving range and this huge pond. It was quiet and we were able to enjoy the sunrise and sunset. This resort is huge, but easy to navigate it through, by using the lobby as your middle point. It is pretty spectacular and well worth the price. Service is OUTSTANDING! We arrived after midnight and the valet was still working and got our luggage really quickly and it was brought to our room promptly after check-in. When we departed, we were able to take care of check-out, retrieval of our car and having them get our luggage. We are already planning our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Be back soon!”
Reviews.Author: chcurtin
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd trip to this hotel. My family has enjoyed our stay there every single time. When walking in you'll find great open lobby overlooking outside. Staff there are wonderful! My only complaint would be that it is swimming pool/lazy river is open to other hotel guests...we had group of 20 somethings partying it up with smoking and drinking heavily around young kids. It took awhile for the security to come and escort them out...they were not hotel guests. Otherwise, this is a great family hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great service in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: bobbygHove
Reviews.Content: OK Hotel is in a fantastic location with great pool and lazy river. It was only a shame I could not use it as I had no time!. The rooms are clean and large enough for a family to stay. The bed was fresh and really comfortable. But best of all was the service by the attentive staff. This was way beyond with what I have experienced as a seasoned US traveller (both business and pleasure). They really could not do enought for you. Am now considering coming back with my family next yeat for a weeks vaccation.....then lazy river here I come....btw, great golf course on site,,,,,if you could stand the 106% to play in...lol.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Los Gatos, CA - Northern California - Bay Area
Reviews.Title: “Lazy River was great!”
Reviews.Author: afgam
Reviews.Content: The big hit of the hotel for our family visit was the Lazy River. The other pools were nice, but not as fun as the lazy river. There's a slide for the children. The pool-side service was good. I was hoping for more supervision for children horsing around the pool area. Food was available at the entrance. There's also a gym and daycare facility located nearby. The gym was small and the machines worked. Clean headsets, but somehow the air-conditioner was not working. Started to getting too warm. The daycare facility is small, but organized. Remember, it does cost extra for this service. Ok. Back to to the hotel accommodations. The room that we stayed was facing the Lazy River. The day transformed into a a wonderful resort experience. It seemed like I was on a Disney Cruise. There were so many families. There was also a daily/weekend activities itinerary. Good for the children. We went to a couple of the events. We ate at two of the restaurants and experienced good food. I just remember the goat - arugula salad at the Italian restaurant. I did not realize that it was in a secluded place. Back to the rooms, the bathroom was 3/4 the size of the room itself. There was a balcony that one would have to share with the neighbors next door. It's semi-private not private. The laundry room was on the same floor near the elevators. There's a shopping center nearby which makes it easy if you need to shop. There's a movie cinema in the same complex. Golf was amazing. Only if it was 20 degrees cooler.

Reviews.Title: “Family Fling and Swing Was An Awesome Deal!”
Reviews.Author: Chodo
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel and setting with fantastic pools -- all 4 of them. Kids loved the Lazy River and water slide. Food at Blue Sage was delicious. Kids Eat Free is a Great Deal. The hotel personnel were helpful, professional and friendly. We also enjoyed the Taco Bar open at Saturday at the pools. Big hit for a staycation.

Reviews.Title: “Check out the packages for the best deals”
Reviews.Author: billsinaz
Reviews.Content: With all the options for staycations here in PHX, it wasn't easy choosing the right resort. Two years ago we stayed here over Labor Day and the place was packed. We came back again this year, after going to a different place last year, and it didn't disappoint. We booked under the Fling and Swing package that included Kids Meals, Resort Fee a Resort Credit and Golfing (though we didn't use). The crowds were down, so the experience was up. Easy to find chairs by the Lazy River. No problem with seating for dinner at Tuscany and breakfast at Blue Sage. We ended up spending $300 for one night, a bunch of poolside drinks (Kokopelli Pina Coladas were a hit) and breakfast and dinner for 4. The Fling and Swing package covered kids meals and resort fees. Rooms were roomy, comfortable and clean. The only downside was the price of pool drinks. $12 for a frozen drink and $6.50 for a beer seems excessive.

Reviews.Title: “Canyon Villas at Desert Ridge”
Reviews.Author: wdesalvo
Reviews.Content: We decided to take a staycation and renta a 2 bedroom Condo at Desert Ridge. The Condo was superb, the property beutiful and we had full access the the Hotel services and facilities. Great place to relax and get away.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: TucsonBumblebee
Reviews.Content: We went for the water park . The lazy river was great but the slide was for toddlers. Not big enough to make it worth while. The rest of the pools were great!! It was hard to find chairs in the shade if you get to the pool after 10. It is cleaner and newer than the Arizona Grand. The rooms are so much better. I asked for a frig in my room and by the time we got there it was already there. There were lots of families there. We would absolutely go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would Definately Return”
Reviews.Author: roadtriper1
Reviews.Content: J W Marriott Desert Ridge is an excellent place for a vacation. We stayed here for four nights in August and enjoyed our stay very much. The hotel property is immaculate inside and out and the service was excellent. The morning breakfast buffet at the Blue Sage restaurant was awesome. It had pretty much everything you could want for breakfast. The dinner there was excellent too. We would have liked to have dined at Meritage Steakhouse, but it was closed the night we went there. Instead, we dined at Restorante Tuscany which was good, but not as great as we thought it could have been for the price. The pool area is beautiful, relaxing, and a welcoming escape from the Phoenix heat. The grounds are very well maintained and include a scenic dessert garden which is a great place for a walk and pictures. I didn't find this hotel overly priced at all. Prices were, for the most part, very reasonable. Your best bet for dining would be to purchase a dining package. This is one of the best run and nicest resorts I have stayed at and would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Managed Property”
Reviews.Author: pbones
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with several other families on a "stay-cation" The resort is very nice with great pools both at their time share property and at the main hotel. The rooms at the time share side of the property where we stayed were very well furnished with all the equipment you need to make your own meals, blend your own Margaritas, and enjoy. I would give the service a grade of a B due to the fact that there did not appear to be sufficient staff at the pool or at the pool bar/grill.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it.”
Reviews.Author: paisleygirl58
Reviews.Content: the jw was an amazing resort to stay in while in phoenix.Large shopping centre was across the street but as it was so hot in jujly we took a cab from the hotel and the fare was only $5.00. In the afternoons we would grab and inner tube and float on what they called the lazy river. While we were swept along on our tubes we heard soft beautiful music.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT property!”
Reviews.Author: ntwkstudent
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business for 3 days, and I will definitively be coming back in 2 months, however this time around I'm bring the family as this place is amazing! If you have small kids and are looking for a great resort, then look no further. This place has a full gym, spa, 3 pools with waterfall and 2 golf courses set upon a beautiful location. This property is well taken care of and the staff is very friendly! You wont be disappointed! My corp rate was $135 night with no $35 resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Baseball and Bliss”
Reviews.Author: leftydana
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights while attending several spring training baseball games. It was a great place to come home to between games. The property is absolutely beautiful. The lobby, pool area with "lazy river," and our room were all very nice. We were very comfortable. Best memory: Sitting outside on the patio listening to music and having a cocktail before dinner. Perfect. We also had spa treatments one morning before heading to a game, and the spa was very nice, too. Tip: Don't bother with any of the restaurants. They're very expensive and not that great. We ate at Roy's, the Italian place, and had breakfast by the pool. There are plenty of other places to eat nearby, and you will definitely need a car.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing. Simply One of the Best Vacations Ever”
Reviews.Author: AZ4Moi
Reviews.Content: Relaxing. It was the simple relaxation and fun of the lazy river and water slide which makes this one of my favorite vacations. Couple this with stunning landscaping and attentive staff, my group of friends and I will be back for another staycation next year! The landscaping is so gorgeous my vacation pictures look like we traveled and actually a couple will be put on canvas and hung up. Our room was very nice - certainly up to Marriott standards and had a mini fridge. The cool thing with our bathroom was it had both a bathtub (great for the kids) and a stand alone shower. I heard from the guys who went golfing the course was beautiful and they had a good time. The Taco Bar near the lazy river entrance had pretty good street style tacos for reasonable price and I mean reasonable as in prices found outside the hotel. Breakfast buffet at the Blue Sage was expansive covering everything from fruit, to hot meals and cereal to toast/bagels. Overall, gorgeous property, attentive staff, good food, good golf, enjoyable pools, up to date and clean rooms. Only mumble I heard was some people in our group did not like the pillows -- I liked them though. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: DiveTravelerPhoenix
Reviews.Content: We decided to spend our annual staycation here with several couples and had a wonderful time. Some of the ladies used the spa and got massages - the spa is just fabulous and I highly recommend it. The main pool area was very active and fun. If you are looking for quite, go to the spa pool (must pay a fee) because there were many children at the pool, but we were fine with that. The food served at the pool was great. There was a fabulous taco bar that made the entire pool are smell great, too. There are several pools to choose from including a lazy river which was crowded, but we thought that made it fun. They don't staff well, though, as our pool waitress had a very large area to cover and we waited 20-30 minutes for drinks, but the drinks are really good. The rooms were beautiful and have all toiletries including hairdryers. The whole layout of the resort, the inner lobby, loads of beautiful palm trees all made for a great atmosphere. We went to Roy's for dinner, which is overpriced with very slow service (again, appeared to be way understaffed in the kitchen) but food was good (see my review). I give the experience an A- only because of Roy's. We will return, we will just choose another restaurant for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great conference location”
Reviews.Author: DLH06247
Reviews.Content: From the moment you enter the grounds, you can see the attention to detail. Landscape was very well kept. The staff was very friendly and attentive the moment I walked in the door. I arrived in the early morning of the first day of a 5 day conference. Despite knowing that check-in was in the afternoon, I inquired as to when a room would be available. The smiling desk clerk informed me she had rooms available and would check me in right away. My room was clean and well-appointed (love those Marriott beds!) and even had a small balcony overlooking the grounds. There were several restaurants on site. I would highly recommend Tuscany, but would not go back to Roy's. Starbucks was conveniently located between the hotel and convention areas. Lots of "nooks" outside to grab an iced coffee and escape the hub-bub of the conference. The Lazy River was a hit with all ages.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort Hotel”
Reviews.Author: esd3104
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a Spa weekend with some girlfriends. The Resort is just georgous, with lovely outside dining areas with firepits. Our room was very nice and up to date and clean, with a spacious balcony. All the service was very good and we ate in two of the restaurants which were both excellent as well. The Spa has a lovely pool of it's own with a nice selection of treatments, and the main resort pool is big and there is also a Lazy River with rings to float around in. Overall a beautiful resort with great amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Property and Staff - Will DEFINITELY be back”
Reviews.Author: MRMED8R
Reviews.Content: I am a longtime Marriott guest. When I travel, I like to know that the property would at least meet certain expectations, important when traveling for business and considering the value for what you are paying. This property exceeds any expectation that I had and has become my new Phoenix/SCottsdale go-to for ANY stays, business or pleasure. This particular trip was a quick get away for my wife and me. We needed to spend just a little down time in a relaxing atmosphere. While this is a resort - Golf, Spa, HUGE pool complex - there was still plenty of opportunities to relax and not be bothered by other people living their lives. It also is one of the few properties where they have a concierge lounge which they call the Cloud Club. It is an up charge, but well worth it - virtually 24 hours access, plenty of snacks that go WAY beyond crackers and cheese, a "dinner" snack that could easily pass for a meal and breakfast including omelets cooked to order. The Club staff is beyond accommodating and the particular chef that we had there, Lem, was entertaining and would create anything that we wanted and that he had available - on or off menu. They really tried to make you feel welcome and comfortable. What was truly nice was that there were no children allowed under 21 in the Club. I know, that sounds terrible, but the last property we stayed at with such a property (NOT a Marriott) allowed children and it was a nightmare - the parents had no control and were rude about it. The staff did absolutely nothing to prevent or even deal with the situation. But let me move forward. . . . The restaurants are all fabulous, and include a Roy's. I know, it is a chain, but Roy Yamaguci still has a hand in things and the food here is as if you went to one of the anchor locations. The lounge area can accommodate many, many people, and there is entertainment I believe every night. I mentioned the pool complex - it is huge. It has a restaurant/bar with a complete menu and just not a bunch of fried food. The pools themselves are sprawling all over the property and include a "lazy river" for those wanted to just drift. The spa/exercise facility is large and friendly (and comes with the Cloud Club package). The equipment is well maintained and they have free weights as well. The only draw back is it is a short walk outside and at an end of the sprawling property but hey - you're going to work out so a little walk is good for you , no? I would suspect that this property sees a fair amount of convention and business travel due to the size of the ballrooms and number of restaurants, lounge areas and places to "hide", so I would caution people to check to see if a convention is booked and what % of the bookings are used for that purpose. On the other hand, if I was looking to book a convention or gathering, this would absolutely be a top choice if not the top choice in the Scottsdale / Phoenix area. I would also "caution" that while I was never approached, this is somewhat attached to a Marriott Vacation Club. I did not know this when booking but again, it made no difference and I would not avoid the property because of this.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Resort For Family Get-Away”
Reviews.Author: 1julieg
Reviews.Content: We purchased the Family Fling & Swing Package which includes: $50 Resort Credit daily, Free Golf (certain time restrictions apply; see website), Free internet, Free kids meals 12 and under( at Blue Sage for breakfast/lunch/dinner, and dinner at Tuscany's as long as adult meals are ordered), Free appetizer or dessert, Free self parking, Free Resort Fee, 10% off retail purchases. We stayed two nights, Friday & Saturday, which we thought were going to be very busy and overcrowded. But, thankfully, though it was busy, we didn't feel like we were suffocating. All hotel staff were very friendly and courteous. We were pleased with our hotel room. As mentioned in earlier reviews, the bathroom is massive and comes with a nice deep tub. The water pressure wasn't spectacular and the hot/cold shower knobs were very touchy. To get the "right temperature", we had to "play" with the knobs, so as to not get the water too hot or cold, which was tedious. The rooms give you two double or one king bed. We needed the doubles, which were somewhat comfortable, but the pillows are too small and either too soft or two hard. Next time, we will be bringing our own pillows. We enjoyed using the two comfy cozy bathrobes available to use during our stay. If you plan on using the fridge within the rooms, don't bother! There's absolutely no room! We brought our own ice chest with food for breakfast and lunch then had dinner at the resort. We enjoyed the $50 daily resort credit and used it towards dinners at Blue Sage and Tuscany Restaurants. The kids ate for free both nights, which was included in the package deal. So, for our dinner, we pretty much just paid for the tip. As far as dinner, Blue Sage wasn't very good. Service was extremely slow and not very attentive. Once our food came, we had to send a hamburger back that was cooked only to med. rare and not med well that we had ordered, then it took another 15 minutes to wait for it. With kids, you can only wait for food for so long and coloring gets old. Menu wasn't that great. The next night, dinner at Tuscany's was much better. We didn't have reservations, but didn't have to wait too long. Food was much better and service was more dependable. The pool area was really nice. I am big on cleanliness, and it was exactly what we got. No "dirty ring" around the waterslide, like we saw at the Phoenix Point Hilton Squaw Peak Resort. All the pools were clean as well. Pool staff were working non-stop, keeping the pool area tidy. They also were friendly and courteous. It was such a hot weekend and there were many water stations placed throughout the pool area that had suffiicient ice water pitchers and cups available to use. We never had any trouble finding shady spots to plop our towels and belongings (we only needed 1 chair, as we were always in the water). The kids loved the Lazy river and basketball pool. Near the basketball pool there was a live band...believe it was reggae (?)...sounded very tropical island, which was nice because it really made you feel like you were on vacation. For lunch our last day, we had those tacos at the taco bar that other contributors were talking about. Mmm Mmmm!!! Only $3 per taco and you can chose from chicken or beef, plus they had fresh taco fix'ins. The taco bar also sold hotdogs as well. The grounds are just beautiful. There are some close walking trails, which we didn't take advantage of this time, as it was too hot. But, I am sure there were some nice sights to see on the trails. Beautiful landscaping, waterfalls and flowers. Plenty of very nice outdoor furniture to relax on as well. This was worth paying for as the saying goes "you get what you pay for". This resort was inviting, clean, comfortable, relaxing, fun. We look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent large hotel and conference centre but beware of drinking water!”
Reviews.Author: malcolm5656
Reviews.Content: Desert Ridge is an excellent resort centre for accommodation, swimming, eating and conferences. There are two superb golf courses within walking distance of the lobby. The main problem I had was the drinking water that is served to you at every meal. The water throughout the resort is chemically softened and so the sodium content is extremely high. My ankles started swelling on my second day by which time I normally have recovered from the flight! When I asked about the water they did admit it was softemed even in the kitchens and the engineer said it was 100mg/l. This is at least 10 x the level in UK drinking water. This meant that I could not drink any water or anything made from water (tea/ coffee) in the main hotel. I had to buy suitable water from the local supermarket and load the coffee maker in my bedroom! This sodium level probably is tolerated by most normal people but it is a risk to the very young and also to adults with sodium intolerance like me as my ankles, hands and face swell. It also is a significant risk to people with hypertension and cardiac failure and also those with renal impairment and so beware!

Reviews.Title: “Great For Conventions”
Reviews.Author: LoriJM
Reviews.Content: the rooms are spacious and the air worked wonderfully in the rooms. The only problem was that the halls and common spaces were very warm. ( I am sure it's a common problem everywhere in July in Phoenix.) The meeting spaces were great with plenty of water on hand.

Reviews.Title: “The Pools are the big draw”
Reviews.Author: xxxtraveltoday
Reviews.Content: JW Marriott Desert Ridge is BIG. It's a 5 star property on the edge of the desert. The biggest draw is the pools. The lazy river has a good current and lots of tubes for guests to use. No wonder its filled with families. But since this resort has many pools, you can always find a quiet peaceful pool to relax. The service is top notch. It's a convention size resort with lots going on each day. Our room faced a pool lined with mature palm trees. This place is manicured. Roy's Restaurant is Hawaiian fusion and should not be missed. It was the best meal we had in AZ.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely grounds with plenty of fun pools for all”
Reviews.Author: DunesMom
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 (2 kids ages 5&8) has stayed here twice, both as part of a conference for my husband. The grounds are big and lovely, complete with a desert plant garden and reflecting ponds. But the best part is the many pools. The family favorite is the lazy river pool with a small waterside. There is also a long, curvy, narrow dipping pool/lounge deck, and a sports pool, as week as a massive fun pool with a giant waterfall deck and sitting ledges. Ice and water pitchers are available poolside for free, but you do have to get them yourself. There is a poolside grill as well as roaming waitstaff for drinks and lunch, but service can be slow. The biggest downsides to the pool area are the hike to get to the bathrooms and the lack of lifeguards. When we visited in 2009, lifeguards were stationed at the lazy river and the big pool, but no more. One attendant was stationed at the top of the waterside, but the meek young girlsndid not have any sense of authority for safety, and we found some raucous teens endangering us more than once. A return to safety attendants would be a good move for this resort. However, I pulled out my "don't mess with this Mama face" and that worked. There is a lovely desert botanical garden on site, which provided habitat to lizards, birds, and bunnies. A great little hike to start our morning. There is also a lovely grass lawn near the pools and restaurant terraces, so you can relax at happy hour while the kiddos play and run and look at the ducks on the pond, all within perfect sight. The rooms are clean and nice, the beds comfortable. Our room had a separate shower and tub, and a balcony with a view looking at a pond and the mountains, quite lovely. Roy's restaurant was very tasty, although pricey. Take advantage of their great happy hour specials if you can. The sushi is delish! We have enjoyed our stay both times, and hope to return here again.

Reviews.Title: “I will stay here again - has everything!”
Reviews.Author: GISGoddess
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott Desert Rigde was very comfortable the service was excellent! I am a Marriott Elite member and they offer free access to the Spa for Elite members. A visit tot he Spa is well worth it even if you don't choose a service. The spa has a separate calm and tranquil pool with ice cold beverages. It was very relaxing and comfortable at the spa. The main pool is very large and I never had to search for a chair. The issue was where to sit for a spectacular view - it was difficult to choose - all views were gorgeous. It is in a nice location for getting out for local dining and shopping. There is a huge wine store in the nearby shopping center where I found a favorite Hawaiian wine! Go for the luxury and stay for the comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: gbreetz
Reviews.Content: We only stayed a night and arrived late so the kids did not get the chance to do a lot. As such, we probably should have stayed somewhere a bit cheaper. That said, the accommodations where great, the kids enjoyed the pool, the Cloud Club was very relaxing. We ate dinner in the hotel restaurant, Roy's and had a very good meal. The only negative comments are: 1) we had asked for connecting rooms and they were unable to provide us with those 2) the extra pillow and towels we requested before we arrived were never delivered. So, not much to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel w Minimal Issues”
Reviews.Author: favelpeach
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the JW Marriott Desert Ridge July 22-24 with my husband and 3 year old to attend my husband's college graduation. The hotel was LOVELY, we booked a suite with a resort view and we were more than pleased with the room. The only issue I had is that I kept finding teeny spiders in the room (maybe because of the region?), even in our bed! That gave me the heeby-jeebies really good because I do NOT enjoy insects of any kind. Plus, I had my kid with me and I didn't know if they bit. I certainly didn't want to take them home in my luggage. A really nice lady at the front desk told me over the phone that the exterminator would be in our room probably within the hour, and I said this was fine, that we'd be at the pool. When we returned to our room a couple of hours later, I figured the exterminator had been there. My husband and daughter were napping when I got a phone call saying the exterminator was on his way up. That just would not do because where was I supposed to stash my sleeping 3 year old for the next couple of hours? Everyone knows you do NOT wake a sleeping child. : ) So the exterminator did not end up coming after all. Other than that, the hotel was fantastic wtih a great staff, very generous food portions (we ordered room service for breakfast each day, and once for lunch), and lots of activities. We were delighted to return to the hotel after graduation and find a live band playing in the lobby! Looked like alot of fun, though we were too tired to join in. Word of caution, WEAR SWIM SHOES AT THE POOL. The ground is blistering hot out there, and it would have been WAY too hot for my daughter to walk on, so I am glad I took a few steps first and found this out for myself. I would suggest that the hotel posts something about that or mentions it when guests check in that they will want to protect their feet. I am from Houston, Texas and it's plenty hot, but I've NEVER experienced that before. So just beware. This review would have a much different tone if my kid had blistered her feet on the asphalt. Across from the resort is an awesome shopping district that includes a theatre for beating the heat and of course the all important Target store! Also, the Museum of Musical Instruments is down the street and VERY interesting. I reccomend this hotel, except for the spiders. If you aren't a huge wuss like me, shouldn't be a problem. ; )

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: insuranceman2428
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the JW marriott and had a great time. My wife and my 7 year old daughter loved the lazy river. On the weekends they have a taco bar that is awesome. Try the steak or chicken tacos that have been marinating for a few days--they grill them right in front of you. The room/hotel/grounds were immaculate. My only complaint was the resort fees which I had no idea about until I was getting ready to check out

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: FreeUpgradeHunter
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the nicer ones we have stayed in around the Phoenix area. The rooms are clean and well appointed. The hotel ground are immaculate surrounded by golf courses. Note if you golf it's usually cheaper booking through Golf now website. Restaurant is nice, usual overpriced but good food. If you have a car there are many places to eat across the road by the shopping area. Pools are great, there is a splash area, pool and lazy river, the lazy river is open until 10pm, however the jets which move you around are switched off in the evening, so you sit in your tube not moving. All of the staff are very pleasant and helpful, room service was quick and orders were all filled correctly. Stayed here several times, business and personal, never any issues.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Content: The resort is absolutely beautiful, we went for our 40th anniversary and it was wonderful. The pools are well kept, the lazy river does become a bit crowded on weekends but not during the week but the other pools are hardly ever crowded, several restaurants on the property. We stayed on the Cloud Level, so we used their services for breakfast & lunch and evening snacks, which was perfect. All in all we would definitely return to this Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “THE CAPITOL OF RIFF RAFF.”
Reviews.Author: luxe888
Reviews.Content: Read my entire review if you want to avoid checking out at 3AM like we did. YES! WE LEFT AT 3AM BECAUSE IT WAS SO BAD! I really don't have a long complicated drawn out story to tell. The bottom line is; this place is a place overrun by filthy riff raff drunks. For a lack of a better word...the clientele here is very low class. I pulled up to the hotel at NOON and there was already a bunch shirtless people standing around the front lobby with 6 packs of coors light. Nice..awesome. The pools had maybe 4000 chairs and 10 umbrellas. The entire resort is supposed to be smoke free but people are smoking at the pools, in the rooms...I was walking into a cloud of smoke almost every turn..and this is a GIANT place. If you want free second hand smoke...this is your place. Complained to hotel...and was actually told that people are allowed to smoke on their balconies. WOW! I called back to double check and the manager assured me that she was mistaken and the resort is "supposed" to be smoke free. RIGHT........ We got a suite for us and our baby because we wanted a nicer room and experience. Well it's such a joke. Because...all of a sudden at 9pm...a HUGE group of people BURST into their STANDARD SIZED rooms (i say that in caps b/c standard rooms here are dirt cheap and so 8 people are splitting the room so it's only $25 a person...yup you get the picture of who stays here) throwing beer bottles around, rowdy as can be, playing beer pong...doing body shots...you name it...they were doing it. I think at one point, one of them threw each other on to the wall during a "friendly" fight because I thought something for sure was going to explode through my walls. I almost threw up when one of them went out for a smoke break on the balcony and said "oh dang i can't wait to eat more sausages tomorrow." WTF??!!? Called front desk...hotel sent security to calm them down... Fast track... 2AM...awoken by the sound of beer bottles breaking on the OTHER side of our room. Another group of drunks swearing, obscenity, F bombs every other word, girls challenging to fight the guys...guys threatening to throw each other over the balcony! My baby was startled to death and and cryng hysterically because they were screaming next door throwing chairs around going in and out of the room and balcony nonstop. IT WAS LIKE A SCENE AT A BRAWL AT A $39/NIGHT MOTEL IN THE MIDDLE OF NO WHEREVILL. It was so disturbing and we had to pack up at 2 in the morning...baby crib, all our luggage, wet bathing suits (have you tried to pack up at 2am after you're awoken by drinks? it's not fun) etc so we can escape from this HELLISH place filled with NASTY PEOPLE! We went to check out at the front desk (by this time it was 3am)...I was furious already thinking we were the only who would be awake at this god awful hour. Nope. There were people walking around the hotel lobby shirtless, INSANELY INTOXICATED, PRACTICALLY WALKING INTO THE WALLS AND YET stillllllllll chugging their coor lights. I was shocked...and yet the front desk staff didn't even bat an eyelash..because THIS IS THE NORM OF THE CROWDS HERE. The pools are open 24/7...which you might think is great..but it's probably the biggest red flag because 24/7 pools means loud obnoxious drunks at all hours. STAY AWAY. DISGUSTING!!! I WOULDN'T COME BACK IF THEY COMPED ME THE REST OF MY LIFE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Broken Promises”
Reviews.Author: menc10
Reviews.Content: Stay away from teh JW Marriott Deseret Ridge if you want quality service and friendly staff. I have had 2 events at this resort and both times the management broke promises that were made to me and my company. I have stayed at all the major resorts in PHX and this resort has the worst service. Avoid at all costs this place. Unless you like broken promises!

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy!”
Reviews.Author: TruBlkKngt
Reviews.Content: My family decided to stay local and spend some time and money at a local Arizona resort. We chose the Marrior JW Ridge based on good reviews. (Initially we were going to stay at the Arizona Grand, but based on some of their reviews we decided our kids (3 yrs and 5yrs) were probably too small to enjoy the water park at Arizona Grand.) Also, the JW Marriott had a rate of $149 with a $50 resort credit, plus kids under 12 eat free. We were VERY HAPPY with our choice. The hotel was very modern, clean and relaxing. And the staff was very friendly and helpful. Especially Emily at the front desk. I have been telling everyone at work about our stay, and I would gladly stay there again next year. Thank you for making our "staycation" enjoyable!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, be prepared to walk”
Reviews.Author: BradOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the J.W. Marriott Desert Ridge for a convention. The hotel is very nice and the surrounding area is beautiful. The hotel is very spread out, so be prepared to walk quite a ways to get to various locations, including the pools and meeting spaces. The rooms are very nice, with very large bathrooms that include a separate glass shower and bathtub. The location, however is the only negative. There are plenty of on-site restaurants, but they are pricey. There is a nice outdoor shopping mall across the street, but it is about a 10-15 minute walk (not recommended in the summer heat). You can take a car for $5 one-way, which is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Pools, Great Resort! We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: mat1634
Reviews.Content: We stay here every every year. And every year it seems to be getting more and more popular. That's not a good thing in my mind. The first time we stayed was in 2006, and the place was basically empty. Maybe I shouldn't give it such a good review, and then people wouldn't want to invade on our 'personal' vacation! In all truth, this place is amazing. Huge, never-ending pools; great restaurants onsite; The Spa is unbelievable... I could go on...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: canaran
Reviews.Content: The date given is wrong but, my wife an I can never stop singing praises regarding this fabulous hotel. We were there at a Direct Buy Conference, I believe in 2007. From the moment we got down from our airport limosine, from the bus-boy to the receptionist, we were treated like royalty. Every one addressed us by our last names, with the right prefix of course! They were at our beck and call for the whole length of our stay. Wether it was lunch, dinner or at the bar the service was excellent the food was great. The rooms were clean and great and comfortable.The treatment at the spa was fabulous. Infact, We loved this place more than the Ritz Carlton in Chicago. The Ritz by the way made the top 25 restaurants in the world! We recommend this hotel to anybody who wishes to enjoy a memorable vacation. Ben Canaran

Reviews.Title: “Not for couples...”
Reviews.Author: Hellcat66
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights at the end of a 2 week road trip as we were flying back from Phoenix airport. On the plus side - the hotel was clean, luxurious and the service was very good everywhere from the restaurants to the pool to reception. The rooms were lovely; spacious and clean - we picked a Signature view room which was overlooking a lake. On the downside - the hotel was packed the weekend we stayed mainly with families with small children and teenagers. It was hard to find a sunbed in the shade and there is no separate adults pool or relaxing area. Again, in the evening, there were no adults only area so it felt like we were sat in a creche! One evening it rained and was so busy in the bar and restaurants, the only place we could sit and have a drink was in the hotel corridor. At night we were kept awake by babies crying and teenagers shouting to each other on the balconies. We also found the restaurants quite expensive and it felt like we were subsiding all the kids who eat free there! Great hotel for families but not for couples or those who don't like crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort in the Desert!”
Reviews.Author: cmlmls
Reviews.Content: I went to this resort for a conference and wish I could have stayed longer. The rooms were beautiful, spacious, clean, comfortable, and quiet. You had to pay for internet in the room, but could get free wi-fi in the lobby. The bathrooms came standard with a large bath and a stand up shower, separate. I stayed in two rooms, in different sections of the hotel and they were both nice, clean, and quiet. There is free parking. There are a few swimming pools, one a lazy river, one for laps, one for games, even one with a waterfall. There were many restaurants and shops, even a Starbucks on the property. There was a spa as well, but did not take advantage. I also, believe there was a golf course. No meals are included in the price of the hotel, just the other features. There was a large shopping area with many other restaurants a 20 minute walk or a 5 minute drive away. I believe there was a free shuttle to the shopping. The hotel was spacious, clean, good for business, romantic, or family vacations. It was outside of Phoenix, so if plan on exploring the city, plan on driving or staying closer to downtown. It was about a 20-25 minute drive to the airport. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. They have water stations around the hotel to help keep you hydrated and even offer cookies at the front desk in the afternoon. The price is high, but you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Stay But Terrible Customer Service Post Visit”
Reviews.Author: LuvSHOes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort over Father's Day weekend, using the $149 locals rate special. The pools were super-crowded, with not an empty lounge chair to be found, but we attributed that to the "holiday" weekend. Our room was upgraded to a "lake" view room, thanks to my husband's Gold status, and we appreciated the view, as well as the cleanliness of the room. We ate breakfast at the Blue Sage on Sunday morning, taking advantage of the free $50 resort credit as well as the kids eat free part of the deal. The food was excellent, as was the service. Our little girls had a great time there especially. However, after we checked out and returned home, we realized our daughter's dreamcatcher was still hanging on the reading lamp on the bed. She was very upset, understandably, so we immediately called the resort's lost and found service, and was told someone would look for it as soon as housekeeping was able to enter the room, and would call us back. 24 hours later, no return call so we followed up and was told the same thing. Again, no return call, and now, 5 full days later, no one is able to tell us if the room was checked, and no return call has been received. We have already replaced our daughter's item but would still like confirmation that the room was checked, per our request. We are frequent travelers, with this chain and another well-known chain, and this literally has been the worst customer service we've experienced.

Reviews.Title: “So much fun, we just booked again for later this summer”
Reviews.Author: noodle08
Reviews.Content: My family took advantage of the fling & swing summer package which for one rate included the resort fee, kids eat free, unlimited golf, and more. We had a nice room with two beds overlooking a lake. The reception clerk was super about getting a room that would be easy to get to with our small children and yet quiet. They also allowed us to check in early as they had rooms available which was great to be able to utilize the pools for more time. They provided a crib and a small fridge for milk when we requested these. Everyone we met was so accomodating with our small children and we didn't meet a single employee that was not friendly and helpful. We loved the pools. The 5 year old loved the lazy river and the quieter "ribbon" pool. The toddler loved the water feature next to the ribbon pool which is about two inches of water running across the concrete. She thought it was fun to splash in and get wet without being in a pool. You can eat in the outdoor bar/restaurant right next to this area and watch little ones that can't swim play in the water feature without you having to be in the water. The large pool with water falls was lively with a band playing. Food in Blue Sage was good although expensive. The children eat free element of our rate made the prices easier to handle. The breakfest buffet was good and we had a burger/beer combo that was good. Dinner at Roys is a favorite of ours (though not included in the children eat free promotion) and they are wonderful with children. I don't take our kids to nicer restaurants very often as they range from 9 months to 5 years old, but Roys is perfect for families if you time the visit right. We went at 5:45 so we could be out fairly early. They provide crayons, and even dvd players with dvds to choose from for the kids. The kids drinks come in plastic pineapples and their dessert has each child's name written in chocolate on the plate. Knowing that the kids meal is large, they allowed us to split it for our two older children, but they still brought each child their own sundae at no additional charge (even the 9 month old got one). There is a large grassy area that at dusk seems 20 degrees cooler than the rest of Phoenix. It was fun to sit and watch the children run around, make friends, and play tag with other hotel guests (children) while we relaxed with a glass of wine. We loved our stay and I just booked it for another "staycation" later this summer. Our bags aren't even unpacked.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Grand Canyon !(?)”
Reviews.Author: TheClintons
Reviews.Content: My wife and I attended a conference held in this Hotel in May, 2011 and we took our daughter (9) with us to share the joy. I could write a long review on how nice the Hotel is (the building, the nicely manicured garden, the pools and the lazy river, etc) However, I think my daughter' summary tells it all: After the conference we toured Arizona for a few days (Grand Canyon, Sedona and Monument Valley) which was great. When we returned to Hungary we asked our daughter which of these amazing natural wonders she liked most. Without hesitation she replied: The J.W. Marriott. What more should I say?

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Spa !”
Reviews.Author: sactigermom
Reviews.Content: Family trip for NCAA National Championship Game. Fabulous resort, rooms were very clean and comfortable. Ten on site dining options, from $$ - $$$$, Tuscany was our favorite. The Vista lounge was a fun and lively place to meet friends for drinks, opens to outdoors with fire pits with plenty of seating.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: LeeCaldwell
Reviews.Content: We stayed here five nights, four days over Memorial Day Weekend. It was fabulous. The staff was very helpful and kind, the facilities were gorgeous. We did day trips up to the Grand Canyon and to Sedona, very easily within a few hour. The pools were really nice and there are restaurants on site...although a bit pricey, we used it for breakfast. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. Loved it, and we'd go back at the drop of a hat.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: grandmom32
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect! We arrived @ 9:00 AM and were checked into our room immediately. The room was beautiful and spotless; we requested a refrigerator (no charge) and had it within minutes. Breakfast buffet was awesome - especially the fresh strawberries. The grounds were breathtaking; the lazy river and pool were wonderful. We'd return in a NY minute!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection Guaranteed!”
Reviews.Author: Nowork
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a long weekend without the kids. It was perfect from end to end. The staff was extremely accomodating. The food was scrumptious. The weather was undeniabley beautiful and the spa was heaven. I had a treatment every day that was relaxing and rehabilitating. The spa pool is the way to go if you don't want to be around kids. The hotel was packed with families too who looked like they were having a blast. We are considering going back with our kids. Would return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrMikeC
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel for the family. Stayed over the Thanksgiving holiday, plenty of shopping and great resturants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in everything”
Reviews.Author: Stricks
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort. Great Spa. My wife and I enjoyed using the Spa pool more than the large hotel pool. Quieter and more comfortable. Rooms were very nice and comfortable. Food was excellent. Bar service was excellent. entertainment in the evenings was also very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: catbird40319
Reviews.Content: Expensive but a great place for the whole family. I was there Memorial day weekend. Quite busy but everyone seemed to be having a good time. All employees were friendly and as good as I have seen. Restaurants were also expensive but of very high quality. If you are looking for a cheap thrill, this is not the place. A beautiful place in the desert. State and federal employees can get a room price with id card.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally well run resort”
Reviews.Author: msn58
Reviews.Content: This is a large resort hotel and conference center on the northern fringes of Phoenix. This makes it remote, and if you don't have a car you are somewhat limited for dining and recreation choices. There is a mall nearby (easy 1/2 mile walk) that has shops and restaurants. The hotel property is gorgeous, and very well maintained. Staff are exceptionally helpful and friendly. The pools and landscaping are worth spending time enjoying. I particularly enjoyed the desert botanic garden on the NW side of the property. Spa facilities are very nice, and include a private outdoor relaxation area adjacent to the locker room with steam room, whirlpool and sauna. Hotel guests can use this for a fee, although it apparently is discounted or free if you are there with a group/conference. There is a Roy's restaurant on site and it features a fabulous (and popular) happy hour, with $5 cocktails and appetizers. I also ate meals from some of the other restaurants and ordered a room service pizza which was excellent and delivered in 20 minutes. My room was spacious, comfortable and quite. I had a first floor room that opened onto a small patio with tables and chairs outside. All rooms have either a patio or balcony. The bathroom was large, and had both a walk-in shower and a tub. This would have been a 5 star review except for it's value -- I thought it was expensive for what you get; it's nice but not luxurious. But if your next conference is located here, you will be treated well and be comfortable. Tip: internet access is $13/day in your room, but free wi-fi is available in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Not As I Remembered”
Reviews.Author: ladybug5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 3 night stay at the JW Marriott Desert Ridge Spa Phoenix. There were some things really nice and other things were not as good as before. PROS; We stayed in a Jr. Suite. The room is quite large with a sitting area and 32 inch Widescreen TV, bedroom area, bar area with sink microwave, fridge and counter and a large bath. NEGATIVES; the room had new carpet and the smell of carpet glue was so strong that we had to sleep with the sliding doors open to the fresh air and the air conditioning running all night. BLUE SAGE DINING ROOM ; Pros; the food was quite good. Negatives: the service was very slow even when there were very few customers and eating outside there was a definate bird issue when the dishes were not removed quickly. POOLS; The pools are quite beautiful and there were plenty of lounge chairs. The pool service was also quite good. NEGATIVES; the pools did not seem as clear as our last visit. There were quite a few babies in the pools that did not always have the correct diapers swim wear on.

Reviews.Title: “Great - up until the bill was slipped under the door”
Reviews.Author: V Traveler
Reviews.Content: The good: This is a great hotel. Check-in was fast and efficient, I was upgraded to a junior suite, and the bathroom, bed and pillows were all great. Very nice décor. Excellent housekeeping. Roy’s downstairs has great food, and it was fun seeing the rabbits and ducks wandering around while eating. Pools are nice, and perfect for kids/families. Service was excellent overall. The bad: Nickel and diming. Internet was $12.95/day plus 3 different taxes. But wait, a day isn’t 24 hours. It is until noon. So if you need internet at 11am, you are paying $12.95+ for internet which will expire in an hour. Sleazy! Why can Courtyard by Marriott provide free internet, but the much-more-expensive JW Marriott charge for it? Annoying. Anyway, when I received my bill I was prepared for the internet charges, but there were other surprise charges. Self-parking is $10/day. Plus 3 taxes. They didn’t tell me at check-in about this, and there are no signs in the parking lot indicating that there is a charge. Surprise! And then I also paid $53+ to receive two packages. I had called a month before and been told by the front desk that there was no charge to receive packages. Yet, for the packages which had arrived slightly before my arrival, I paid $53 for them to hold them and then deliver them to me. Despite being told the wrong information by the hotel, they refused to credit back this charge. So overall, although I was extremely pleased with the hotel for my entire stay, I was left with a really bad taste once I received the bill. I would therefore likely not stay there again. What a dumb way to lose repeat business!

Reviews.Title: “Nice property but odd place for a resort”
Reviews.Author: xy223yz
Reviews.Content: This is a full service high end resort. The grounds are well maintained, clean and expansive. The hotel rooms are nice size, modern and clean. It lives up to the JW brand. One complaint is that I cannot understand why Marriott feels the need to charge for parking at their JW properties. This location isn't pressed for space and there is no other reason to park at the hotel other than if you are staying at the hotel. So it comes down as a pure revenue play for Marroitt. This complaint isn't unique to this property, a number of the JWs do the same thing. All in all, a nice property. However, I'm not sure of the draw. I was here for a conference. But the property is not in the foothills or mountains. Obviously it isn't on the water. No real recreation other than the golf course. So I'm not sure I would seek out the property for non-business purposes.

Reviews.Title: “If you have to work in a hotel room..... THIS is the place!”
Reviews.Author: Ebrickman
Reviews.Content: As I write this, I am currently staying at the hotel on business. I am so very impressed!!! The desk in my room is oval shaped and abundant. The chair actually adjusts for height. The room is sunny and light and warm; beautifully decorated with a mixture of warm light colors and textures. Even the carpet is beautiful! It is very large, with both a loveseat and chair. Hotel staff is quietly courteous. I was able to do a long teleconference without interruption. While working, I ordered both breakfast and lunch via room service and both orders were handled with perfection, although I do wish they would use Tazo brand tea which is most commonly used by Starbucks hotels and is so much better than what they use here. One last compliment: The mattress is similiar to what I have at home, and the bedding is top of line ---- I was able to have a wonderful night's sleep, which helped my workday. Bravo! The hotel itself is gorgeous. I would return here in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: argDANCER96
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel 3 times in the last 5 years and I have nothing but great things to say about this place! The atmosphere of the resort is amazing and the hotel is very beautiful. The relaxing lazy river is a favorite of ours as well as the other pools. At night, there are usually live musicians playing outside where you can sit and relax, order some drinks and dessert, chat with friends and just wind down. We've stayed at the Villas several times as well which are equally as nice! The pools there are also very relaxing and enjoyable. Employess are all very nice and helpful. I know that my family and I WILL be coming back in the future!

Reviews.Title: “just average for 5 star”
Reviews.Author: drwSeoul
Reviews.Content: Most JW Marriott can provide its guest more than here. If you play golf, your satisfaction would be greater. Fitness and Pool is quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty average for a 5-star Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: travelD
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure how to rate this hotel. Is it nice? Sure! But it's rated as a 5-star hotel on many websites and as a 5-star resort I give it only three stars. I'd give it four stars if it wasn't advertised as being more luxurious than it actually is. While the hotel seems grand and the grounds expansive, the attention to details that make a big resort seem to care for the individual are mostly missing- especially after sundown. There are areas you can see from the hotel- but they're not lit, or there's no access, or the firepits aren't lit at night. It's a big place, and I get the feeling that crowd management is a priority. For instance, poolside dining/cocktails end at around 5. The pools AND jacuzzi shut down at 8pm. and most of the beautiful grounds are literally locked off after that time. The end result is that folks are herded into the dining rooms, main veranda and lobby. While these latter two sites are spacious you definitely are going to be sharing the evening with scores of your closest friends! The Revive Spa had beautiful facilities- not the nicest but very good. Sadly, it was literally run like an assembly line. The treatment providers synchronized their watches and exactly on the hour came out for ALL of us ladies (about 20). My masseuse seemed very rushed, and didn't tailor my massage the way I had requested. The rooms are very nice, though housekeeping skipped us one day (due to the place being full, I imagine). Toiletries are nice but not outstanding. No turndown service. Very nice rollaways if you happen to need one and room service was likewise wonderful. Again, it's a nice place. Hard to find fault- but if you're looking for a truly luxurious experience I would pass on the Desert Ridge.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Five Star Resort - A Desert Gem!!”
Reviews.Author: ThreeABoys
Reviews.Content: We recently took a 9-day family vacation to Phoenix and stayed at the JW Marriott Desert Ridge. It was spring break and we were a bit nervous about crowds. We were ecstatic that our stay was an absolutely FANTASTIC experience. The resort is first class in every way! The grounds are immaculate and beautiful. The restaurants are fabulous and we never had a problem getting seated. Breakfast at the Blue Sage was a treat - don't miss it! The pools were crowded but we never felt that other people were on top of us. The tennis center is absolutely fantastic and the folks that work there are truly service oriented! The staff was bright and cheery and very welcoming. The golf courses are beautiful and very playable for golfers at all levels - even our kids went out for a few holes! The rooms were well maintained and up to date - flat screen TV's and more. The Spa was first class - go for the hot rock message!! Keeping it real, the front desk did struggle to juggle the crowds. We requested a connecting room as we have teenagers and a 10 year old. We were arriving on a late flight from New York and we wanted to make sure everything was set upon check-in. A few days before I called to see if the request had been granted. I was told it was and that our rooms had been assigned. We arrived around midnight and they had given our connectors away. I was not happy as we had to separate the family on night one. Early the next morning I received a call from the front desk that they had found connecting rooms for us. What a relief! Unfortunately they moved us from a room with a view of the pools (which we paid an upgrade for) to rooms overlooking the parking lot. Again I was not happy. When I asked how this happened they told me "take it our leave it. that's all we have". Exactly in those words. I was so unhappy I called the other big resorts and was all set to check out the first day after I checked in! I decided to talk to the manager to see if anything else could be done. Thankfully, after some more juggling, we were put in a WONDERFUL room overlooking one of the isla's and golf course. The concierge was very, very knowledgable and helpful. We went off property for a few dinners and the recommendations were superb! The value for money without compromising quality was truly superb! Pay the resort fee - it is totally worth it and frees you up from fees that would otherwise annoy you at check out. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone traveling to Phoenix! Well done JW!!

Reviews.Title: “A True Oasis in the Desert!... Amazing Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: CoolBlueSteel
Reviews.Content: This property is by far the best I've stayed at in a long time. This resort should be categorized as a five-star property. The rooms are elegant, well kept, clean and very nicely furnished. The common areas are amazingly beautiful and well maintained. The pools... OH! the pools!... truly amazing.
