Fun for the entire family... from the lazy river for the kids... to the larger more adult pools for the grown ups. Open areas for children to run and have activities. As if that weren't enough, the hotel staff is amazing. They go out of their way to help and assist you. Very attentive and accommodating. A true hidden gem in the desert! Will certainly be back...

Reviews.Title: “JAZZ and the JW Marriott - Good Combination”
Reviews.Author: defs76
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this beautiful resort during the Jazz in the Desert production. Special kudos to Nikki (front desk) and Dallas (bellhop); they both were friendly and helpful. The housekeeping service failed to leave lotion and shampoo but a phone call solved the problem. Food is pricy but delicious. The resort fee was $25 (expensive) and there is no wifi available anywhere; so you are out-of-luck if you need access to your computer unless you pay the resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Family Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: samiamincali
Reviews.Content: If you have kids, this is the place for you to go when visiting the Phoenix area! From the moment we checked in until the moment we left, our experience was just perfect at the JW Marriott Desert Ridge. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is a little hike from the airport compared to some of the other hotels that seemed comparable on the internet, but then again we never heard the roaring engines of planes flying overhead, nor traffic noise, so that was awesome. The resort has several really great on-site restaurant options to choose from, and a Starbuck's in the lobby. Also, a very nice outdoor mall is within walking distance, and the paved paseos through the resort lead you right to it. There are some wonderful restaurants and a Cold Stone Ice Cream shop there if you want a change from the hotel food, which is delicious, by the way. For the kids, there were planned Nickelodeon-themed activities daily and each evening, some with and some without a fee. There was also a "family escape" where you could leave your kids in the capable hands of teenaged supervisors-there, the kids could play video games, play with the computer & I-pads, watch movies, play frisbee, all in a safe, enclosed area...There were grassy areas available for families to play catch or tag, as well. But by far the best time was provided by the numerous pools, the water slide, and the lazy river. So much fun to swim and dunk and float-we did this all day long for 2 of the days we were there. The water was super-clean and the perfect temp to refresh you when the heat got to be too much. It was crowded when we were there, but we always found lounge chairs or a spot on the grassy knoll by the pool. Beach towels are provided by the staff, so you needn't pack those for your trip. The gym on-site was certainly adequate, clean and had plenty of equipment, but if you get up early enough, a nice morning run through and around the resort is a good option, as well. If you like tennis or golf, they have courts and courses for you. The rooms are great-the beds comfy and the bathrooms were actually quite luxurious. Never heard our neighbors or any ambient noise from outside our room. We had plans of driving to the Grand Canyon but decided not to go (it's a 4 hour drive) since we were having such a good time at the resort. Next time we will split our trip and stay somewhere closer to the GC, and finish our trip back at the Desert Ridge. One day activity I would recommend is a place called Crackerjax, a family fun park that has bumper boats, go-carts, batting cages, bungy dome, mini golf, an arcade....Fun for the whole family. It's about a 15 minute drive from the hotel. If you need to rent a car at some point during your trip, there is a Hertz facility on-site. This was convenient because we did not rent at the airport (very expensive at the Phoenix Sky Harbor for some reason) and we only wanted the car for a couple days. This worked perfectly for us, and we turned in our car at the airport for no extra fee, saving us money on transportation to the airport. Parking was free, though, so if you do have a car for your trip, it won't cost you to park at the hotel. (I think the website said there was a per day charge). All in all, it was a great family vacation, and all for a very reasonable price including our flights. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Average Service Level, Uncomfortable Furniture and Ants”
Reviews.Author: theLuckiestGuy
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 1 br suite with adjoining Room (so a 2br suite) for 5 nights.. this is one of those Arizona factory hotels. If you're used to disney cruises and make an average living, you will love this place. The public areas are impressive with all sorts of amenities like starbucks and an in-house kinkos.. But if you're used to real luxury hotels then this place is going to leave you decidedly flat. It really is a three star sort of place and priced closer to 4 star. Uncomfortable furniture in the suite living room. There were ants crawling on the computer desk. I had to keep killing despite housekeeping calls. They only changed the sheets every few days "to save the environment" More likely trying to save money. They wanted to charge extra for access to a half-assed "cloud club" (marriot's version of the Ritz Club level. It just felt cheap and cheesy. Your kids will love hanging with other kids but the hotel public areas, pool and lazy river, but it's all cheap unhealthy food with lots of high fructose corn syrup in everything.. no chance to feel vibrant or good hanging out with a bunch of taco eating fat folks at the pool. Kids toddling in leaky, full diapers.. just gross. The pool is open to neighboring property owners (for a fee) so get there early if you're a guest looking for a good spot. I'm probably just spoiled by better hotels. All the good hotels in PHX (ie. boulders, four seasons) are located wayyyy out of town, so I knew this was going to be a comromise going in. I'm just surprised how disapointing the stay was knowing that up-front. Honorable mention to the hotel's service staff who were pleasant. I don't want to throw them under the bus.. but the the operation was just a fail from my perspective and I'd advise you to expect a business three star with resort amenities.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A GREAT HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: DairyRanchGirl
Reviews.Content: This is the BEST JW Marriott I've stayed at. We stayed over 4th of July weekend last year! GREAT activities, events, eateries and contests! The ROOM were gorgeous. I believe they just finished a $200 million dollar renovation! My KIDS LIKE THIS HOTEL BETTER THAN 5 STAR hotels we have stayed at in Hawaii on the beach. I think that says a lot for a kid to want to stay in No. Phoenix w/o a beach ;) The lazy river was great because it was HOT in July! There were dance parties for the kids. Nickelodean activities at the pool--sliminator & crafts. Character breakfast with Sponge Bob & Dora. Dive in movies. Watermelon eating contests. Cake decorating contests. Bbq buffet that was DELICIOUS. And the restaurant ROY'S :P YUM-O The resort has so much to offer you don't have to LEAVE :) But if you do leave there is an awesome outdoor mall across the street w/ Marshall's & other stores & movie theatre. This is a GREAT MEGA hotel :)))) FRIENDLY workers too!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but too many kids!”
Reviews.Author: CatahoulaRi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, the restaurants are great, but there are too many kids (from a mid-20's perspective). Cleanliness: Not much to say. It was clean! Restaurants: Roy's had delicious food and great service. I had a birthday dinner here, and the extra little touches made me feel special. Meritage was also good, but I will admit I've had better steak dinners. The dessert was delicious, though. Blue Sage: had the breakfast buffet and a late lunch and I overate both times. Very good! Vista Lounge: had a decent appetizer there, but the service was non-existent. Expect a long wait just to get the bill. Pool area: The area near the lazy river has the most obnoxious music playing. Once again, it was geared towards kids. I didn't lay out anywhere else, so it may have been better in other areas. Hotel grounds: Absolutely beautiful. Driving up to the front of the hotel at night with the lights and palm trees was amazing. The cacti and other greenery were so well kept. And there are little bunnies running around everywhere! Spa: One word: Tranquil. The services are fabulous, and I love the little touches such as the shampoo, conditioner, and body wash in all of the showers, and the separate spa area for men and women. The pool area has relaxing spa music playing and phones aren't allowed out there. It is also an adult only pool! The hotel was wonderful, and I had a great time staying there. The only thing that would prevent me from choosing this Marriott again is that it seemed very much geared towards families. It may have been that it was during baseball's spring training, or schools' spring breaks, but it was not ideal for a getaway for two young adults. Note: If you qualify as an elite member, and are staying longer than a night or two, sign up for their program to get free internet, free self-park, discounts at restaurants and golfing, and other offers. It costs a bit, but if you're there long enough it'll be cheaper that way.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, friendly service, comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: anniede1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed during the last week in March. Everyone at the resort was friendly and went out of their way to make sure we were happy with everything. All of the restaurants had good food, and the bed and room were comfortable and very clean. I would recommend this resort to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic resort for business or pleasure.”
Reviews.Author: Hudders10
Reviews.Content: So it was March this year and I was travelling to Phoenix on business from the UK. I was Working in Desert Ridge so location was great. I will try to keep this brief and point out some areas for consideration if you are visiting Phoenix for the first time. Firstly, you must hire a car as I only saw 1 bus in the whole week I was there and nothing is walkable. The hotel was about a 35 minute drive to the north of downtown and the airport. The hotel is huge but never feels overcrowded. As I had travelled from the UK I suffered from waking up at around 5am after my first night - no worries. I was straight down the gym (accessed by key card) onto the treadmill and then beat of all into the lazy river for a swim around watching the rabbits and sunrise. Then into the hot ub at around 6.30am, fabulous! Then, breakfast al fresco at the hotel - full buffet with everything you can imagine. I was especially fond of the counter full of fresh berries (2 plates full per day). As I arrived on a Saturday - on Sunday we jumped in the car and headed north to Anyhem Outlet mall (30 minute drive). To cut to the chase, well worth a visit (Nike / Ralph Lauren and so on), but you are just as likely to get a bargain at Macy's at Paradise Mall (I picked up a RL Hoodie and RL Lambswool v neck for $55 in total. Needless to say, food is fantastic, recommend the Cheesecake Factory. One evening after work we headed downtown to catch a Phoenix Suns game (NBA) - again would recommend you can book tickets from the UK (around £25). We parked at the venue for $15 and ate at Coopers Town - Alice Coopers' place opposite the US Airways Center - go for the 'Big Unit' a 22 inch hot dog! Sorry this has gone off the Marriot topic but I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Desert Oasis”
Reviews.Author: LegalEagle82
Reviews.Content: My Mom, sister and I stayed at the JW Marriott for 3 nights (March 24 - March 27) and could not stop raving about what a fantastic hotel it is. Check-in was a breeze, and our room was updated and very clean. We requested a roll away bed and a refrigerator, both of which were brought very promptly (and at no extra charge.) Each staff member we encountered (in the halls, the lobby, valet, around the pool) went out of their way to say "hi" and ask if we were enjoying our stay. Service at each of the restaurants was also great. The spa was top-notch, as was the Spa Bistro and the spa pool. Dell gave me one of the best, most relaxing facials of my life! All of the restaurants at the hotel were delicious. We ate at the Italian restaurant on Thursday night, Roy's on Friday and the steak house on Saturday and enjoyed every single meal. Drinks on the patio of the Vista Lounge, sitting by a firepit, while listening to live music was one of the highlights! The pool area is very nice and the service around the pool is prompt and efficient. Don't miss the lazy river! This resort is definitely worth the price, and is great for those who are looking for some R & R. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect relaxation location!”
Reviews.Author: luannryan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I picked the JW Marriott Desert Ridge for our 30th Anniversary as a get away from the cold. We spent two prior days renting a car and touring Sedona and the Grand Canyon so we now wanted to finish four nights just relaxing. There is a Hertz on property, so we returned our car here. This property is wonderful. It is a huge resort which offers something for everyone. There are several pools with plenty of lounge chairs, this was peak season. The Marriott issued wrist bands each day when entering the pool to keep this for guests only. It was crowded but we never had a problem finding a spot, there is ample shade areas as well. The grounds are kept immaculate! There are several ponds and sitting areas, at night they have bond fires going all over. We ate at the pool side restaurant a few times during the day, very good, delicious smoothies. We enjoyed Tuscany, the Italian restaurant along with Roy's Hawaiian fusion for dinner, both very good. Our last night we ate at the Steakhouse, Meritage. A little pricey but delicious, best "Cowboy Steak" we've both had. There is also a large shopping area/restaurants across from the Marriott complex which is a short ten minute walk. Our room was perfect, very comfortable. The hotel property is beautiful inside and out, we would definitely recommend this and hope to return. Very friendly and helpful staff, fun place!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: HighCountryAZ
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 night stay at the JW Marriott Desert Ridge and feel that I need to share my opinion. I live in Northern Arizona and make frequent trips down to Phoenix and like to try out different hotels. This time I was with my two boys ages 13 and 11. I chose this hotel because of the location and reputation as a first class resort. My family and I were extremely disappointed with our stay. The JW Marriott is beautiful and well maintained but the service in the restaurants was just awful. I have to say that the service in the Lobby Bar/Patio was especially dreadful. Yes, this was Spring Break time and the resort was fairly busy. At no time, however, did the waiters make any effort to acknowledge our presence when we were waiting to order or check to see how our food was when it was finally delivered. I certainly expected more from a hotel of this caliber. Next time I will choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic people, food, location... No thought given to room location”
Reviews.Author: Tafurita85
Reviews.Content: Just checked out today. This was one of the nicest hotels I've visited. The food was simply delicious from all four restaurants I tried, staff was wonderful, and the rooms are modern and luxurious. The reason I am rating the room and value low is simply this. On my third and last evening at the JW Desert Ridge, I was awoken and shaken at midnight by extremely loud clanging outside my room. I looked over my balcony to see trucks unloading. It was so very loud and continued non stop until 1:45 AM. As I was traveling on business it really affected my last day due to the lack of sleep. For a property this expensive and this luxurious I found this completely unacceptable. I've had a quieter more peaceful night of sleep at a Days Inn. I would still recommend this hotel, but visitors should definitely ask that your room does not overlook the same area as the 3500 room block.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel......very poor service”
Reviews.Author: MomtoPDandL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Desert Ridge for 5 nights in March 2011 for an awards conference. The hotel was very beautiful however the service was not so good. When we arrived at the hotel our room was ready and waiting for us. I went to check in while my husband parked our rental car, before leaving the bags he asked the bell hop to take the bags to our room and his golf clubs to the golf course. When I checked in the bell hop brought all the bags including his golf clubs to our room, he had to carry his clubs himself to the golf course which is walking distance but not very conveniently located to the hotel. On our second day we showered in the morning and then needed to shower again before dinner, we only had two towel sets so I called for more towels as I got in the shower and my husband was going to bring them in to me when they arrived. He called back after I had gotten out of the shower and dried off with a hand towel and asked for more towels.....they never came and he also had to use a hand towel. That night when we returned from dinner I called and complained that we had already called twice for towels and they never came, they were finally delivered in about 45 minutes. There were several days that I went to the pool and came back after lunch and our room had not been cleaned yet. The spa on the other hand was great, I had a massage and a facial and loved them both. Excellent service in the spa.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Girls' Getaway”
Reviews.Author: 1971momof2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the JW Desert Ridge for a girls' getaway weekend. We wanted a place where we could have maximum time to catch up, a fabulous spa, and some hiking. We also wanted to be somewhere where we would not have to leave the property. We found almost everything we were looking for at the JW Desert Ridge. We got a spa package that allowed us to stay at a very reasonable price and included spa treatments, breakfast, and discounts in some of the shops. We had a bit of trouble with check-in, and had to spend some time correcting our bill -- the reason for the four stars for service. Otherwise, all of the staff was wonderful and accommodating. The spa was perfect. The poolside Spa Bistro served delicious and health-conscious meals, the spa staff was attentive, and the spa spaces were well-stocked and very clean. We were all very pleased with our treatments, from facials to massages, to mani/pedis. We enjoyed our meals at Roy's so much, we dined there a second night, as well! Dining outdoors the second night (accompanied by live music) made for a different experience. Breakfast at the Blue Sage was also great -- the breakfast buffet had a great variety and very good quality. The only disappointment was not necessarily the fault of the resort. We saw on the website that there were several walking trails available, and expected some scenic hiking available. The trails are all sidewalks through developing retail areas along relatively busy streets, except for a short half-mile through the resort that was unmarked -- we ended up on a maintenance road and the golf cart trail. We are planning to schedule a similar trip every few years, and would definitely consider coming back to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable getaway”
Reviews.Author: TMIMITW
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean, comfortable hotel. I spent a Saturday night mini-staycation here and found it to be tremendously quiet and peaceful. Almost too quiet, given that it was a weekend during the high winter season in Arizona. But that is a reflection on the economy more than on the hotel. As a result, we hardly saw another person during our stay, which added to our sense of getting away from it all. We even had a secluded hot tub to ourselves on Saturday night, which was pretty nice, though we had to walk a long way outdoors in the chilly desert air to get to it. My only knock on the place was the uneven service and the parking. On the plus side, after making my reservation (with Marriott Rewards points), "Elite Ambassadors" from the hotel contacted me via email to ask if I had any special requests. I didn't have any, but answered a question about any special reason for staying by saying it was a romantic getaway. They responded by saying they would be awaiting my arrival. When I checked in, however, I was politely thanked for being an elite Marriott Rewards member and handed a small gift bag that contained...two bottles of water. That was it. Now, I wasn't expecting anything special when I made my reservation, but the Ambassadors made it seem as though I would be singled out when I arrived. Nope. I got a card with the bag telling me that Marriott would wave the spa/resort fee, which is a rip-off in the first place, and I'd still have to pay $10 per car (we came in two cars) for parking. Since it's a secluded resort, it's not like I was coming to a city center where all parking costs money, and there was nowhere else to park, so this is essentially another way to extract money from guests. Another revenue maker was, as is the case with so many Marriott hotels, charging me as an Elite member for spotty internet service. Again on the plus side, when I asked for a late check out, the staff member on the phone extended check out by two hours quickly and politely. When I did check out by phone, another staff member thanked me for being an Elite member and was very courteous. The two young people running the large gift shop on the evening I arrived also went the extra mile to help me find some candles to make the stay more romantic. If the hotel can get all of its staff on the same page, they'll be fulling earning the high end resort image they're cultivating.

Reviews.Title: “over-rated underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: Van0510
Reviews.Content: We booked through Priceline and paid $140.00 per night. We have stayed at a J.W. Marriott in San Antonio so we are familiar with the hotel. The location in Phoenix was good because we planned to play golf near there. We weren't interested in the golf facilities at this resort. A pet peeve of mine is when a hotel nicks their customers for services that others don't charge for. The biggest irritant is the $12.95 charge for wireless services. Sure I could go down the street to a Starbucks and get it for free, but I shouldn't have to at this price point. The charge for parking is $10.00 per day. We had to ask for the coffee and paper cups to be replaced everyday. The towels were low quality, dingy and scarce. Again, at this price point I expect better. The hotel was basically empty until the day we left when a convention group began to arrive. I guess the economy isn't so bad that this hotel feels they need to step up the quaiity to attract the independent guests. The facilities were nice but because of the irritating charges for the smallest things, we won't stay at the J.W. Marriott again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for our Anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: Scott_in_Philly
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 nights at the JW Marriott Desert Ridge to celebrate our anniversary. We arrived on a Friday and left on a Wednesday. Due to some airport delays, we didn't make it to the hotel until about 7PM. After working that morning, traveling all day, and not eating much along the way, we were pretty drained when we arrived. We had originally planned to go outside the resort to eat dinner, but by the time we got there, we just wanted to collapse. We decided to just eat on-site at the hotel and ended up at Tuscany. This proved to be a great choice. The wife had a great pasta dish as I scarfed down a pizza. Admittedly, we were probably underdressed for this place, but the staff made us feel very welcome and were quite understanding of our travel experience. We didn't plan on eating here, but having done so, I would definitely recommend it if you are staying at the hotel. If it is warm enough, consider dining outside on the patio that overlooks the Isle of Capri. We ventured back to our room and crashed. I woke up the next morning to a beautiful sunrise over the mountains with a view of the Isle of Capri in front of me. We had booked a standard room using Marriott points, and were upgraded to a Signature View room. It definitely did have a very nice view. I ended up spending a lot of time out on the balcony, just reflecting and thinking about how fortunate I was. Other than a suite, I can't think of any other room I would have preferred in this hotel. It had just about the best view I could have hoped for. Many thanks to the Marriott staff for placing us here!! Although I did play golf every day that I was out there, we did spend a good amount of time just relaxing at the resort. Many afternoons were spent poolside. All of the pools there are heated and at quite a comfortable temperature. There are multiple options when it comes to the pools. There is a large pool with a fountain structure built in the middle of it. There is also more of a quiet pool for swimming laps nearby, as well as a small area for younger kids to sit in the water and play. A decent size hot tub is in the same area too. Unfortunately, the lazy river was closed while we were there. They did a good job of hiding it from the public though. If we didn't know it existed, we would never had known it was there. This is a good thing if you have younger kids, as I would imagine they would see it and be quite disappointed. Our favorite place to relax was the spa pool though. It is far removed from the main pool complex and there were no little kids running around here. Don't get me wrong, I love kids and know to expect lots of yelling and splashing at a place like this. Sometimes, it is nice to have the option to escape to peace and serenity though, and that is what we got at the spa pool. Since we are Marriott Rewards Gold members, we did not have to pay to use the facilities. It is included if you get a treatment at the spa, otherwise, I think you have to pay a minimal fee. As for dining, we did try out most of the dining outlets at the property, as well as venture off-site a good bit. For breakfast, we did try out Blue Sage one time. The food was good, but it wasn't anything spectacular. There is a Starbucks on site that provides a quicker option. Across the street from the hotel is the Desert Ridge Marketplace, and most notably an Einstein Bagel. Most of our breakfasts were here. It's great if you don't need a big breakfast buffet. We did have lunch once at the poolside restaurant, Just a Splash. It was your average resort poolside fare. Not bad, but not spectacular either. It is good if you are hanging at the pool and don't feel like getting up out of your seat though. A much better lunch option can be found at the Spa. There are some really tasty, and really healthy options on the menu. And the fruit smoothies there are awesome (not to mention cheaper, significantly better and much larger than the ones at the other pool). If you find yourself craving fast-food, there is an In-n-Out Burger across the street from the hotel (in the Desrt Ridge Marketplace). Aside from our dinner at Tuscany that first night, we ate outside of the resort for our dinners. There are a number of great restaurants in the area. Down the street from the hotel is the CityNorth shopping area. There are a few options there, including Ocean Prime, which offered great steak and seafood. About 15 minutes away is Kierland Commons. This is a very well built up area with multiple great dining options and lots of shopping for the wife! We often stayed at the hotel for Happy Hour and then ate later dinners. There is the Vista Lounge, which has live entertainment and great specials. Roy's also has an Aloha Hour from 4-6PM. $5 for huge frozen margaritas became a daily event, as did the $5 drinks and appetizers at Roy's. I am generally quite active on my vacations, but there is something to be said for just relaxing to the music with a frozen drink in hand! As we were there a bit before Christmas time, the resort was nicely decorated for the holidays. One of the coolest things was the massive gingerbread complex (not house) that they built over the prior month that magically popped up in the lobby overnight. The picture doesn't do it justice. It was too cool....just an example of how the hotel goes above and beyond here. If there is a fault to this hotel, it would be the resort fee that everyone complains about. It was $16 for us as Marriott Regard Gold members and $25 if you are not. They give you a list of things that it gets you, but none of it really applies. You get 10% off in the shops at the hotel, but not the main gift shop, which is where we bought gifts! It does include self-parking fees or a $10 discount off the valet parking, but that is about it. Yes, it does suck. But there isn't anything you can do about it, so get over it before you arrive and don't let it spoil your trip. All in all, we loved this place! I have been to many fine resorts all over the world. While this isn't the Four Seasons, it is a very nice 4 Star Resort. It is one of the best Marriott properties I have been to, maybe the best (and yes, I have been to the ones in Hawaii). If you are thinking about coming here, don't think about it any longer. Just come see for yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and elegant”
Reviews.Author: RFox68
Reviews.Content: This resort is beautiful and comfortable. The rooms were well done and comfortable. Our room had a balcony overlooking the terrace and a beautiful view of the mountains. I found the resort easy to maneuver as we were there for a personal conference. The terrace is great for hanging out and eating and having drinks at night with gas firepits and a music ensemble right next to a man made lake and fountains. Grab a lounge chair, order a glass of wine and gaze at the ducks enjoying their man made home. The staff was great and attentive. On the upper level you can sit outside with your favorite beverage from Starbucks and watch the rabbits lounge around in the desert setting.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, quiet rooms, lovely spa!”
Reviews.Author: whosaidso8
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel/resort for business and I love it! The rooms are gorgeous - comfortable beds, huge bathrooms, and quiet halls. For business meetings - the meeting rooms are grand, with strong A/V services. There is Starbucks onsite, so you don't have to spend lots of money on hotel coffee. Tip: the pools are shallow - no more than 4 feet deep. There is lots of outdoor spaces, and maps for walks/runs. I LOVE the spa. I had a massage, and it was one of the most relaxing massage I've ever had (I get massages monthly at home). The spa is clean and quite luxurious! There is a steam room, dry sauna, and indoor jacuzzi. The restaurant at the spa is delicious, with gluten free meals available. Stay here for business or pleasure. You will enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Class Act”
Reviews.Author: 2batravelfan
Reviews.Content: The employees are professional and well trained. The grounds are reallly special, including a desert botanical garden area you can stroll through. Although the hotel is set way back from the street, it is well situated across from a mall, theatre, restaurants, grocery, etc. You are 20-30 minutes from historic Old Town Scottsdale, and drive by numerous high end shopping possibilities on the way! Did I mention jewelry stores... A particular gem was Opus on Scottsdale Rd. Favorite restuarant stop was Tutti Santa for italian (wonderful veal dishes). The Spa at the resort was like an oasis. Again, the staff was friendly, professional and efficient. Purchase of any (55+ minute) spa service allows anyone to use their spa/fitness facility and classes. This is definitely a place to return.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Summer Getaway for Family”
Reviews.Author: slatesmama
Reviews.Content: We went to the Nick weekend at the JW Marriott. We went with two families with various aged children. They had something for everyone and the value was good. The breakfast that was included was AWESOME..the only thing is you get charged a 20% gratuity on the full regular amount of the breakfast...and you serve yourself....But other than that, we had a great time in the Family Escape and at the Lazy River. The shows were fun for kids of all ages and the slime was great. They had a lot of free activities for all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice desert experience”
Reviews.Author: JayHTexas
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Scottsdale. Ate at Roy's in resort, not overly impressed. Hotel is very large!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort with lots of amenities”
Reviews.Author: kiethc
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay with Marriott Rewards Points. This hotel is great and absolutely beautiful. The landscaping is unbelievable and they have multiple pools (including a lazy river). The staff is very helpful and we never had to wait for a cocktail. The hotel rooms were very clean and roomy. The restaurant quality is wonderful, but a bit pricey. Directly across the road from the resort is the Desert Ridge Shopping Center. You can find everything you need there including pharmacy, restaurants, barnes and noble, target....etc. I really enjoyed my stay and plan to return again to this wonderful resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for family oriented families”
Reviews.Author: AZRN
Reviews.Content: This hotel is huge which makes it difficult to get around. Even the walk to the room upstairs on the second floor was a bit of an ordeal. This is defintely a family oriented hotel rather than the spa expereince I was expecting. Sponge Bob greeted us in the hotel lobby and there were too many children for a relaxing experience. Service by the pool was very nice offering complimentary soft drinks or water while in the pool. The pools were crowed however and again kids all over the place. Rooms are ok, nice grounds, restaurants expensive, nothing special spa. Overall if you have young children this hotel may offer what you want but for those adults seeking a relaxing spa experience the Mariott Camelback or Boulders offers a much nicer expereince.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay-cation!”
Reviews.Author: partyoffour2010
Reviews.Content: Went with 4 other moms for a stay-cation. The resort is beautiful and the water park a ton of fun (even for adults) They have a lazy river, wave pool, swimming pools, and water slides. Also a spray pad and toddler pool. The drinks around the pool area are wonderful. The resort is great for families, couples, girls weekend, ect. We had a room with two queens and then the front room had a pull out. Only room complaint was the little fridge. Didn't keep our drinks and snacks cold. When a worker came to look at it he said it is really a cooler not a fridge so that was the coldest it was going to get. So pack ice for the sink. :) We ate dinner at the Mexican restaurant on the resort property and they had a golf cart to take us there and back which was great and fun. We got late check out and enjoyed their buffet breakfast. Everyone we came across was very nice and professional. My only complaint was that the water park closed at 4. Everyone around us was very upset, especially those with kids. No clue why it closed early but we would have loved to stay longer so either check in early and go straight to the pool area or go when you wake up until your late check out. We stashed our bags with the bellman after check out and went to the pool till it was time to head back to reality.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Experience”
Reviews.Author: Naitingale
Reviews.Content: I visited this resort with my husband who was there on business. I think this was the best hotel I've ever stayed at. The rooms were very clean and very beautiful. The bed and pillows were very comfortable (not too soft and not too firm). The bathroom was lovely with a shower stall and a soaking tub. Service was amazing with the hotel providing everything that you need. I thought it was odd though that I could get so many things for free but had to pay 2 dollars for a pain reliever. The hotel had about three different restaurants. We only ate at one -the Blue Sage, but we heard that Roy's Hawaiian was also very good. The hotel is located very close to a shopping mall and it was easy to call for a town car with a flat rate of $5 (very good deal). I could go shopping while my husband was working. Because it was summer and the weather was really dry and hot, there were not many tourists or guests at the hotel and I appreciated that. The pools were well taken care of and there is a lazy river. In short, this place is a great way to relax and enjoy without even leaving at all during your stay! The best part of our stay was the Revive Spa. I elected the Arizona Experience and it was amazing. The hot stone massage was done by a very gentle masseuse who was very in tune with what I needed. The facial left my face feeling extremely soft, revived, refreshed and renewed. My skin was glowing! The spa also has a private pool so that if you don't feel like mingling at the other pools, you can just be by yourself (maybe with a few other people). Later on, I was able to rent a car from the agency in the hotel and I drove out to Scottsdale to do some sight seeing and more shopping. It was so convenient to be able to pick up a car and drop off the keys whenever I wanted. I'd go back to this resort in a heartbeat. It was a wonderful experience all in all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service good facilities”
Reviews.Author: Maco1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel with my wife, 8 year old daughter and 10 month old baby. Staff were extremely polite and helpful the whole time, they could not do enough for us. Great facilities with numerous pools. Kids club is one of the best we have seen with the girls who work there very good with children. Lots of shops nearby ($5 taxi ride) including target, Marshalls and numerous others. Food is great at hotel and not that expensive compared to other hotels we have stayed in. Highly recommend. The music museum about 5 minutes away is also amazing especially if you have kids.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best JW's”
Reviews.Author: art1955
Reviews.Content: This was a wedding anniversary trip for my wife and I. A great choice since we had a fantastic time. We have stayed at 3 - 4 other JW's and Ritz properties and the Dessert Ridge is one of the best. As most of you know Marriot is known for their small guest rooms. They typically place a huge emphasis on the lobby and common areas. The standard guest rooms here are much, much larger than even the Ritz rooms we've stayed in the past. The bath rooms also are very large and plenty of room for two people. Bravo Marriot for breaking with past culture and expanding the size of these rooms. A few pointers: The Cloud Club is well worth the money. It's $100 a day per room or $75 a day if you are a Marriott Gold Elite member. This inlcudes the $25 per day Resort Fee and the $16 per day Self Park charge so essentially its $59 a day regular guest or $34 a day for Gold Elite members. It provides access to the spa area and the spa pool. This pool is pure paradise!! Very quiet and totally relaxation for adults only. Cloud Club has a great cooked to order breakfast with fresh fruit, pastries, bagels, etc.. Happy hour with nice selection of wine & beer, mixed drinks, soft drinks, bottled water, etc.. The food at night is very nice and all you need before dinner. Self Park- no big deal...just a 2 minute walk even in 100 degree heat. No sweat...sorry couldn't resist. Runners & Walkers- great location for both. Right out of resort onto Deer Valley Dr. cross Tatum Rd. go about 1/4 mile and will intersect with a shaded trail through a subdivision. Nice place to run or walk. Golf: The Faldo course is excellant. Irish links course in the dessert. Room location...not a big deal but the Blue Sage Restaurant has live music on the veranda each night. Our room was on the 5th floor directly over the music and it's audible even from the 5th floor. If your on east coast time and want to turn in at 9pm it might be a bit noisy. These rooms are directly over the lobby on the back of the hotel. Great views of the pool and mountains. The morning sun comes up over the mountains and it's spectular. Outstanding property...don't hesitate....you'll love it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort...loved Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: carribeandreams
Reviews.Content: I did not realize when I booked our weekend romantic spa get away package that it was Labor Day weekend! The resort was very crowded and they were hosting an event called, "Phoenix Cooks"...it was still great even with the crowd. We were greeted at check-in with a gift and had champagne and chocolate strawberries in the room. The resort has lovely views and the spa pool is quiet and relaxing ( I could have slept for days out there ). The spa was great and had a nice cafe that would deliver poolside. The Steak House had amazing food and for a java junkie like me it is always nice to have a Starbucks in the lobby. The room was just OK...nothing to write home about but I was pleased that even with the large crowd it was not noisy. The bed was comfy and bathroom was large. I would go back anytime...perhaps even with the children. This resort has something for families or couples looking to escape.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond in everything they do!!!”
Reviews.Author: michellerambo
Reviews.Content: I can't stress how impressed I was with the JW Marriott Desert Ridge. For such an up scale hotel I loved how down to earth and kind the staff was. EVERYONE we encountered was on task, professional and best of all they made me feel completely at home. My husband had to travel to Phoenix for business. I was fortunate enough to be able to come along. One night while staying there we had a banquet to attend and the pasta chef actually went out of his way to write down a recipe for me. Thank you Tom!!!! We look forward to returning to the Desert Ridge in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel room theft”
Reviews.Author: gentletourist
Reviews.Content: Stayed there over the Labor Day weekend for 2 nights as we were attending a wedding in Scottsdale. Barely 2 hrs after we had checked out, we realised that we had left a valuable watch in the room. We rushed back to the hotel and met the housekeeper in the room, who was beautifying herself in front of the bathroom mirror. Well, we did not find the watch and have reported it stolen with the Phoenix Police Dept . We had checked out of the hotel room for barely 2 hrs and the watch was on the small table in the room when we left that morning ..... this theft wasn't a break-in....does not take a genius to know that this theft was done by a dishonest hotel employee!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pittsburghparents
Reviews.Content: The main point, EXCELLENT SERVICE!. Every level of employee is friendly, greets you, offers to help and has common courtesy, lacking in many of today's hotels and restuarants. Beautiful grounds and pools. Rooms were clean. We needed extra towels and a mini fridge, arrived within minutes to the room! Needed a corkscrew, arrrived in 5 minutes! The hotel is greared towards the conference industry but families and couples can also find their niche. JW brand still stands for excellence and it shows.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed here for a conference and had a...”
Reviews.Author: photoman1982
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a conference and had a jr suite. The grounds are beautiful and meticulously cared for. There are four restaurants/lounges at the resort, as well as multiple pools. For the restaurant, the food was great but in all the restaurants with the exception of Tuscany, service was in serious need of revamping. Some of the waitresses seemed to act as though their beauty was cause enough for a tip. Management was very nice and comped that meal. The room was very elegant and spacious. I highly recommend using the hertz rental cars as you are 30 min from downtown Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: hbgirl
Reviews.Content: Truly one of the best hotels out there - the rooms are spacious, the grounds are perfectly maintained, the staff was pleasant. The only negative might be the resort is quite large and it takes a good 5-10 min to walk from the parking lot to the hotel rooms. But, the fitness center is top of the line and the buffet breakfast was superb. Sadly, I didn't get to enjoy the pool/lazy river, but it did look nice. But the best part of the hotel? It's quiet!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facilites, nearby desert ridge mall very convenient great for golf”
Reviews.Author: jonesSouthWalesUK
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this resort, convenient location, excellent facilities. great golf courseHas a scary encounter by coming across a snake on the golf course but escaped unscathedVery comfortable villa and able to use facilities of nearby hotel

Reviews.Title: “Updated rooms, tranquil lazy river, spotless facilities make for a nice getaway.”
Reviews.Author: Susanloveshotels
Reviews.Content: This was our second staycation at the Marriott Desert Ridge since moving to AZ. The rooms have been updated since our first stay, and they are very nicely done. If you go on a holiday weekend, be prepared for crowds at the pools. The staff is unflappable, no matter the crowds. If you like sleep, do be sure to ask for a room away form the pools, as they are open late, and our kids were kept awake by the noise from the partyers below.

Reviews.Title: “palace in the desert”
Reviews.Author: griswolds09
Reviews.Content: the moment you arrive and park your car in the self parking area, you get caught by this desert gem. it's front gardens, palmtrees and walkway to the lobby are already spreading a touch of pleasure and leasure. the lobby is jw style huge with fountains, flavoured water and luxurious interior. check in took awhile because they had to figure out our booking, but after a short while it was ok and we got a nice quiet room as requested. the resort area of this huge complex is one of a kind, themed around the 5elements: fire, water,earth, sky and golf. the various pools including a lazy river are the best out there and adjacent to a challenging Faldo course with plenty of bunkers. dive in movies are shown in the weekend. this resort has something for everyone. the signature pizza at the tuscany restaurant is unbeaten and the very best we've ever had! the food in blue sage marketplace was good however the choice was'nt plentyful. there is also a starbucks and some fancy restaurants we did'nt try. the usd.25 resort fee covers many items e.g. internet, fitness center,parking and food for kids 12 and under and we thought thats ok. the large desert ridge shopping plaza with a marshalls, a ross, an albertsons, cinema and many restaurants is just around the corner and almost in walking distance, depending on the heat. overall we felt like royals in this jw showcase and enjoyed every minute of our 4day stay. we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good start to tour of canyons”
Reviews.Author: HKA111
Reviews.Content: We stayed one afternoon/evening with our 3 children as we were departing with a family tour of the canyons the next morning. Comfortable rooms (we were in recently updated rooms and they were great. Very nice bathroom, clean, modern, comfortable). Spent an hour by the pool. It was crowded at the end of the day (hard to find a place to sit down) and pool area (it meanders around its Lazy River...kids were excited about that - free inner tubes to float along) could have been cleaner...lots of empty plastic cups and beer cans around. Someone mentioned that locals occasionally crash the pool and bring in their own drinks/etc...I guess that was what was going on. Dinner at Tuscan restaurant (quite good)....beautiful lobby/public areas. Great buffet breakfast the next morning. A very nice setting. Other people on our tour enjoyed evening tennis. I would definitely recommend this to anyone on business or leisure to stay in this resort-like setting.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect getaway...”
Reviews.Author: KLDrake
Reviews.Content: It was my partner's birthday so I decided to book a reservation here and a spa treatment as well. The staff was very friendly and helped me plan everything down to the chocolate covered strawberries on a plate that spelled out happy birthday in chocolate. The room was immaculate. Beautiful view of the front and a perfect bed. Best sleep I have had in a long time. We had a wonderful dinner in the Steakhouse followed by a perfect breakfast the next morning at the Blue Sage. The Blue Sage has the most amazing breakfast buffet anyone could ever imagine. After our breakfast we then went to the Spa center for a couples massage. Once again the staff was very welcoming and helpful. The massage was amazing. We then went and sat in the steam room for a bit before heading back up to the room. Our checkout was easy. Simply put this hotel is amazing. I recommend anyone going here for business or pleasure. I know we will definitely be back to celebrate some other thing.

Reviews.Title: “Quite the maze”
Reviews.Author: coganet
Reviews.Content: Okay I am still here at the hotel for a conference. I use the fitness center, which is open 24 hrs a day!!! However, the hotel is designed like an airport terminal with several wings off of a center arc. My wing is furthest from the fitness center -- no problem -- more warm up/cool down time. BUT, the only way to get there is through the main lobby. I don't know about you, but the last image I want my colleagues from around the country to see is me all hot and sweaty. No, I am not kidding, two employees said the only way to get to and from the fitness center is through the formal lobby. What were they thinking??? Otherwise, the room is beautiful -- I have a balcony that overlooks the roof of the conference center -- not pretty, but there are mountains in the background. The food is hotel food -- overpriced and uninspired. The service is outstanding. So if you are here, and see a sweaty woman in workout clothes waddling through the lobby, say hi.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: SpaJumper
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this place. The grounds were beautiful. Our room was very nice & clean. We spent all our pool time at the spa's adult only pool since the lazy river was packed with kids. It was sooooo relaxing and peaceful. We also worked out at the spa gym since it was empty a lot. Marriot Elite members get to use the spa facility for free. Just show them your room key. That little bonus is the reason I book JW Marriot resorts. Aside from the awesome resort, the location is AWESOME. Right across the street is a shopping complex with tons of restaurants, a major grocery store, and cafes. It's also close to the freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Wide range of experiences - ours was great!”
Reviews.Author: Vicky058
Reviews.Content: The wide range of experiences detailed here is amazing! After reading through many and relating to a few, I would like to add my 2 cents and strong positive support of the resort. True, the room was no great shakes, but the property was beautiful. True, it is large enough to warrant getting a map, but it wasn't so big that you couldn't get around without one. True, service at restaurants was spotty, but it was great to have so many choices on-site. And if the service was bad, or the food unmemorable, you could always go to the shopping center across the street that has a wide variety of restaurants to choose from. I highly recommend Mimi's Cafe for good food and good prices. A local's favorite, you may have to wait a while to be seated, but it's worth it -- great breakfast. I felt the resort staff was extremely nice and helpful, but restaurant/lounge staff attentiveness was spotty. We went to attend Spring training games (go Mariners!) but were outnumbered by families on Spring Break vacations. Personally, I have no problem with sharing "my resort" with families. On the one hand, it's our bad luck that we're paying premium airfare because it is a very popular travel time for vacationing families, but on the other hand, what a fabulous respite from rainy, dreary March in Seattle. Worth the price of the plane ticket. Our favorite things: for my husband, the fitness center and spa which he visited every morning. First class and never over-crowded. For me, taking long walks in the morning while he was doing his workout. I walked city streets into neighborhoods but the sidewalks were wide and are flat, safe and easily accessible. Did I mention what a fabulous respite this warm March weather was from our cold, wet Seattle March weather? You can't beat it. Other favorite things: drinks on the sofas/club chairs facing the grassy knoll (good sushi btw); Meritage Steak House - not necessarily the best steak I've ever had, but a nice atmosphere; people watching (we also were there during Fight Night and personally saw or heard of many celebrity sightings); warm weather - oh, I already mentioned that. Usually at this point I'd say "you'll really like it" but reading the past reviews, it's clear that people are looking for different things in their vacation stays, so this may not suit the bill for you. I will say, it was perfect and memorable for us. We'll return.

Reviews.Title: “JUST FOR KIDS.....OR MAYBE NOT!!”
Reviews.Author: rufit21
Reviews.Content: Well, my wife and I decide this year to take a family trip with the kids, age 9 and 7. We enjoyed Arizona last year and decided to stay there again. We chose this resort for the most part because of the pools and good reviews. This review is purely based on our experience and maybe some of you can relate: THE RESORT GROUNDS: Very beautiful and some what clean. The main entrance to the resort is somewhat plain, which was disappointing. I expected a visual grand entrance to heighten my arrival, but it never happened. Most of the visual appeasement comes from the pool and the surrounding areas of the restaurants. ROOMS: Nice, but nothing exciting. Our view was of the main entrance. See above post. However, our view at night was very beautiful with all the surrounding lights. RESTAURANTS: Where do I begin!!! Roy’s: Yes, Roy’s....Very slow. There were only two tables being occupied when my wife, kids, and I went. It took for ever for the food and the bill to come. Not to mention my waiter was inattentive and annoying as hell....."No worries." This is what he kept saying to us and other guests the whole night. Needless to say, my food was not hot and my wife and kids went back to the room because it took so long for the bill to come. As a matter of fact, I didn't even wait for the bill and left 15 minutes later. Nonetheless, I called the manager from my room and told him about our experience. $100.00 for a unmemorable meal. Go else where. Tuscany's: God awful!!! Take my Gnocchi’s back because the have no taste. My 7 and 10 year olds hated their meal. My wife boxed her's to go and later confessed that she didn't like it. The waiter was a lot better than the guy at Roy's. Blue Sage: Very good hotel food. Sadly, I recommend this restaurant over the others. FYI they were only open on Friday, Saturday, and Sunday for dinner. Breakfast buffet....AWESOME. Note, those who get the free breakfast buffet with there hotel price they still give you a bill at the end of your meal even though it's free. I don't know about you, but I'm not paying a waiter 20% of a $60.00 bill for pouring me coffee. Funny, last day there I guess they figured it out and nobody waited on us. I don't mind tipping, but I also don't like getting ripped off. LOCATION: Great!! Plenty of shopping and restaurants across the street. POOLS: Awesome!!!! Kids loved them, wife and I joined in. Be Warned!!! A few degenerate people. You would think that at a nice hotel like would attract classy people. For the six young males and females drinking Coors Lite out of the cans while sitting in a inner tube traveling around the lazy river, I pray for you. Your mouths were fowl. One day you'll understand when you have kids. Not to mention they left their beer cans littered under the bridge. GET A PLASTIC CUP, KIDS ARE AROUND!! OVERALL: It was more important for me to see my kids enjoy themselves, which they did. I won't be returning there anytime soon. Again, this was my experience. If anyone has any suggestions as far as nice resorts in the Arizona area feel free to let me know.

Reviews.Title: “The best!”
Reviews.Author: Tjcoving
Reviews.Content: Am beginning to become some what of a regular here so guess it's time to post a review. My stays here have just been fantastic. Staff are always so attentive & cater for my every need. If you are looking for a perfect location to escape for a few, I can heartily recommend Dessert Ridge. Looking forward return!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: desertdad67
Reviews.Content: This is a huge resort. It can be very confusing to find your room, as the corridors shoot off in all directions. There was renovations going on when we were there, but other than finding a dead end when we exited an elevator, you'd never know it. The rooms are beautiful, ours must have been recently remodeled. The beds were comfortable and the amenities in the room were nice. The pool area is a bit of a nightmare. There are a several smallish pools, one larger pool with no discernable water feature for kids. A fountain in the center of the large pool served as a perfect spot for kids to slip on slippery tile. There is a lazy river, somewhat small that has very limited seating surrounding it. Many people where camped out on the wet grass as they couldn't get a chair. Servers are plentiful and food/drinks are delivered quickly. Tried to get a reservation for dinner, earliest we could get was 8:30pm. There are several restaurants close by (desert ridge and city north).

Reviews.Title: “An Honest Review”
Reviews.Author: defore4735
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently came back from our second visit to the Desert Ridge. We visited the property when it was new and decided to visit Scottsdale in July, during the 4th holiday........what were we thinking? But......we were pleasantly surprised. The Desert Ridge is a beautiful property with excellent restaurants on property including Roy's, Blue Sage and Tuscany, and within a short drive (about 2 minutes) you have California Pizza Kitchen, Macaroni Grill, and many others. The property is a nice expansive property, but done right. They are going through a update to the rooms. We were in one of the newer updated rooms and the amenities were fine. We had two rooms (one king with pullout sofa and a double). We had no issues. Plenty of channels on the t.v. and plenty of room in the bath. The amenities of the hotel include golf and the more popular river pool. Needless to say, it is true it can get crowded around the pool. The water is cool in the morning, but warms up quickly during the day. They provide tubes for coasting down the river, along with the Nickelodeon adventure of poolside shows for the kids at the pool. The servers around the pool do their best to take care of customers, but it can be a bit of a wait for drinks or food. For the most part, we found everyone to be courteous and accomodative. Usually two people "cruise" the area, so if you get missed, someone is likely to come by. We spent time all over the pool. There is something for adults and families. The fitness room is fine, with treadmills, ellipticals, bike, and stairmasters with television. THere are free weights and other equipment. Nice facility close by the pool. Didn't use the spa, but I'm sure that's nice. I noticed one review as it related to the courtesy of the staff, I cannot disagree with that comment more. I found ALL staff members to be polite, courteous and professional, following the Ritz Carlton ways. You may be asking, is it worth it going in the summer........AZ is a dry heat. It hit 113 while we were therey, and while hot, there are ways to cool off. The rooms were comfortablely cool all the time (which was an issue on our prior trip).. THe Blue Sage restuarant was very good . We did the Nick package deal where kids under 12 eat free.........BEST DEAL GOING. The patio on the South side of the hotel was fun and cool, even at 5pm at night. Live music and nice drinks and plenty of places to sit. We traveled with teenagers and younger kids. Loved by all

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL - CROWDED”
Reviews.Author: Tranquillo
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the JW Desert Ridge in Phoenix. We usually stay at the JW Camelback but could not get in using Marriott Points. This resort was clean with lovely grounds,golf course, lots of restaurants, bar area, a nice spa, and lots and lots of kids. Perhaps because it was a holiday weekend, but it was so crowded, we had difficulty finding two pool chairs. The lazy river was beyond packed with kids and kids were fooling around with the water flow of the Lazy River and the lifeguards ignored them. They were also having a Nickelodian Event which they frequently do at this resort at the Lazy River. All I can say is that it was very crowded. They made everyone wear wristbands to prevent outsiders from coming in and using the Lazy River. The pool area was no different and was crowded as well. If you have kids, this is definitely the place. My husband and I were alone and would have preferred the quietness of the JW Camelback.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't get better!”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotters52
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my husband and his coworkers to a conference while I was pregnant and enjoyed every moment at this hotel! It was really a vacation for me. The grounds are beautiful - I spent most of my time in the lazy river and eating poolside. We would go the hottubs at night (feet in only for me!) It's across the street from a shopping center that has everything. We did some hiking at nearby Pinnacle Peak. Overall, a great place. Not a ton of bars/clubs nearby but there are enough to keep you occupied.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: Lindyloo1
Reviews.Content: I really find it hard to believe people don't like this hotel, it is absolutely wonderful. Service is marvellous and they can't do enough for you. The resort itself is absolutely beautiful and it is lovely to sit by one of their many luxurious pools and take in the amazing scenery whilst relaxing in the sun and being brought your cocktails. This is, in our opinion, one of Marriotts best JW hotels and we have been to many. They have a simply divine lounge with outside seating that isn't too noisy even if there is an event which is not that often. The lounge area extends outside and is a very large area with lovely comfortable seating where you can have your pre dinner drink around their attractive firepits. Should you be going we recommend Roys restaurant - it is Hawaiian cuisine and has simply delicious fish. There is also a restaurant called Tuscany which didn't suit us but I think it would be great for young children as they have pizza's and a variety of other smaller dishes suitable for children. Having said that there are always plenty of kids at Roy's as well. There is a beautiful fine dining restaurant called Meritage at the club house and although agreed it is expensive the food is very good indeed and worth paying for. This is really a lovely resort in a beautiful setting and we are not golfers, we have been two years now and intend to go again.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay. Absolutely loved it both times!”
Reviews.Author: suven
Reviews.Content: We were here in July 2004 as well as May 2010. We absolutely love this place. Good location, very clean, well maintained and lots to do. We love the pools and lazy river. The breakfast buffet was also exceptional. One evening, we dined at the Meritage and greatly enjoyed that as well. We paid quite a bit for our room back in 2004. This time, we received a phenomenol price through 1800hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as I would have expected for a JW Marriott”
Reviews.Author: FortyEightFan
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for business - my biggest requirements for hotels is that they are quite and clean - I can do without everything else. This JW Marriott was neither! I don't think they had dusted my room in at least a year. It was was of the dirtiest rooms I've stayed in for a long time. There was a band that played poolside - outside my room - until the late hours of the night. The pool area was OK, but as great as I imaged from the pictures. The Italian restaurant (forget the name) in the hotel was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Golf!”
Reviews.Author: Steiner84
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful and the entire staff was especially friendly and helpful from the moment we got to the resort. I travelled with a group of guys for a golf trip, and we all had an awesome time. The rooms were clean (minor exception to the balcony) and spacious with very comfortable beds. And the golf, oh the golf! We played 90 holes in 3 days on both courses and they were in great shape (a couple brown spots, but that's to be expected in a warm, dry place). Both courses were fun and challenging for everyone, and we had a mix of guys with handicaps from about 5 to 25! I look forward to my next trip to Phoenix and there's absolutely no question as to where I'll be staying!

Reviews.Title: “As Good as it Gets with a Family Resort...something for everyone”
Reviews.Author: Saysum
Reviews.Content: We recently took 4 families (6 kids ranging from 2mo-5y/o) to the JW Desert Ridge and came away with the time of our lives. Not only was this resort beautiful, but you cannot beat the value. Let me preface by saying that I have stayed all at types of all inclusives (including Mexico and the Carribeans), and the package that we got for the Desert Ridge was as close as you can get to an all inclusive here in the States. I found an incredible deal that included daily breakfast buffets ($22 value per person), daily found of golf for the guys ($130 value per person), plus daily 50 min spa treatment for the ladies (valued at over $130 per person). We got the whole package for about $250 per room daily. You can't beat that! Pros: Hotel: Beautiful layout. The grounds were immaculate. For those that say it is too big, go and check out the Mexican resorts...now that is big. Nothing looked run down, people always cleaning Pool: A hit with the kids. Lazy river and water slide was nice. Attentive wait staff around the pool as well. Room: We got the 2 bedroom connecting. It was perfect for 2 families (4 adults, 4 kids). The kitchenette was perfect. We loved the Murphy bed and extra full bath in the living room. Allowed the men to leave early for golf without disturbing the rest. Our room was 3406 and was easy walking distance to everything (including Golf course). Food: This was the biggest surprise. Food was terrific. Food was well priced for a big resort. Plus with the resort fee, kids eat free! We literally save $100s on that alone. There was always happy hour with decent priced drinks. We ate at the Blue Sage (terrific breakfast buffet), Tuscany (great ambience if you sit outside), and the Meritage Steakhouse. We had lots of picky eaters and all thought the food was great Service: This too was outstanding. Everyone was friendly. There was a housekeeper/engineer named Thomas who even went out of his way to get us free drink coupons. Everyone tried to cater to our big group. They even compensated us (gave us a credit) for a fire alarm that went off in the middle of the night. The "At Your Service" number was always able to help us with reservations and anything else we needed. Golf/Spa- Having this included in the package was awesome. I called well ahead and made tee times and spa reservations well in advanced. Golf clubs were taken from our car and was always ready for us at the cart each morning. The courses were in great condition. The practice range and greens were perfect. The staff was also very friendly and helpful. My recommendation would be to make an early tee time (<8am). The spa, per the women, was wonderful. The waiting room was nice and all treatments were enjoyed. Tip is automatically added to your bill. Cons: - Rooms weren't ready til exactly 4pm. A tad annoying - The carpets in most of the rooms were loose and worn down - Pool got really really crowded during the weekends. Hard to find chairs and lounges - Beds were really soft and worn down - Towels at the pool also appeared worn down and frayed - Buffet gratuity for party >8 was automatically 18%. Did not understand this - Would have liked to be able to rent a cabana at the main pool All in all, you could not ask for a better deal for a family vacation. I don't know how the resort made any money on us :) I don't know of any other resort that combines spa/golf/pool like this one did. I will definitely look for a similar deal next year and will return.

Reviews.Title: “airport hotel with a golf course”
Reviews.Author: sippinonginandjuice
Reviews.Content: very artificial, too big, and clearly set up for conferences. the golf course was nice. the food did nothing for me. just too many people. there are many more hotels i would prefer to go to in PHX/scottsdale.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of thief!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Blackites
Reviews.Content: I left diamond earrings on nightstand and they were stolen. So a thief works for the hotel. I realize it was my mistake in leaving them but the hotel needs to find out who is robbing guests. I filled a claim with hotel that was turned down. Big surprise! They said no unauthorized entries in room but had the incident date wrong. Hotel handled event poorly, no one called back after I reported theft. I had to make several phone calls and emails before I heard from hotel. I am sorry that I gave housekeeping generous tips before they robbed me! Also taken were other personal items such as soda, beer and snacks!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: family559
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel and many things for a family to do. Loved the pool area and the fire pits outside! Only complaint was our room was by the garbage area and the smell was bad when you opened the door into the hallway.

Reviews.Title: “The Kierland wins hands down”
Reviews.Author: jenledet
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay- I was not overly excited about our vacation when we had booked the deluxe room with guaranteed pool view and were given a standard room overlooking the parking lot. I immediately called the front desk and was told they did not put me in my "guaranteed" reserved room because they had overbooked--- after much disappointment we eventually were able to move rooms midstay- but that is a whole different story (we ended up roomless from 9 AM to 5 PM because the room we were moving to was never quite ready). The rooms are not that great. The first part of our stay we ended up in a king with a twin size sofa pull out for our family of 4 (kids 6 and 8). Our second room had 2 doubles. The king and pullout was better. The doubles are very small and my tall husband and I were fighting for space in the middle of night. I called for more pillows and was told they were out- doubles have 2 pillows on them-- 2 very lumpy small pillows. Kings have at least 6 pillows. I did not think the rooms were very clean-- not for 4 stars. The Kierland has much better rooms, beds and pillows. We went primarily for the pool. We went out at 8:00 in the morning and noticed about 85% of the chairs were already taken- oddly there were only about 15 people around. It is obvious that people get up very early and go down and save seats at the pools. They have a sign that says they will remove articles from seats that have been unattended for 30 minutes---- this never happens. We watched as people left their seats saved for up to three hours. They do not have any cabana rentals in the family pool areas. It was stressful to think about waking up early just so we have spots at the pool. This place is also very stingy with their towels. 1 towel per person and they check off your room number- if you ask for more you are charged. This is ridiculous considering the towels are half the size of the chairs and the chairas are in pretty bad shape and not very comfortable. Again, Kierland beats their pool. The lazy river at the Desert Ridge is average. They have many pools but they are all small and not very enticing to kids. Kierlands beach access, plentiful towels, comfy chairs, tables beside the chairs, service, etc.... had me regretting the pool I was sitting by at the Desert Ridge. Valet is $25 a day- Self park is $10 although the website says it is free- Seriously? $10 to park your car 2 miles away? Bathroom configuration is weird- In both rooms shower door would not open all the way because toilet is so close. Shower is a tight fit. Pina Colodas with toasted coconut along the rim were fantastic. Yes, they are $12 but I feel that price is about average for a good pina coloda. It is in a great location with a Target very closeby. They have plenty of nearby off site palces to eat and shop. This place is better than the Phoenician. We were cosidering moving hotels so we went to tour the Phoenician. It is very tired--- needs rejuvinating. Must be why it was the only 4 or 5 star place with rooms still available. Will only return if the Kierland, Gainey Ranch and Biltmore are not available.

Reviews.Title: “Charmless monster in a charmless city”
Reviews.Author: PalmBeach9
Reviews.Content: I don't like hotels where the first thing you get at check in, is a map. Monster hotel, takes forever to get from point A to point B, full of conventions. Has several pools, all crowded and noisy. The best part is the well maintained garden, The rooms are comfortable, although barely cleaned by the surly Bosnian staff. The food is mostly mediocre Mexican, no surprise here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: tunkiemo
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel for business, then moved brilliantly into vacation. The hotel was perfect for that, and the service of all people we encountered was terrific. Great happy hour, a couple nice restaurants, and executive suites worth the extra price. For adults traveling without children, hunt down the swimming pool area at the Revive spa. Gorgeous and hidden, with a wonderful bistro restaurant. It's an oasis. Grab a rental car and head to Sedona.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel With Wonderful Setting”
Reviews.Author: NJTraveler35_9
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at this hotel for business. I spent the vast majority of my time on the property. The staff is very friendly and they take good care of the guests. The pool area is beautiful and the food and drinks are not to expensive for a resort type atmosphere. The tennis courts and paths are well maintained and I jogged around the property several times and its well designed. Its a large hotel with a lot of rooms, but I never felt it was over crowded. The pool area had kids playing but its big enought as you don't feel over crowded with noise. I spent several days at the pool and relaxed with no disturbances. I would highly recommend this hotel to bring the kids to if you are on a business trip. It would also be a nice resort for a romantic get away as long as its not spring break time period. Its very close to the Desert Ridge Market Place which has numerous resturants and shops. It's an easy 10 min walk from the hotel. In summary, I give two thumbs up for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We've been back three times”
Reviews.Author: EandEmom
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip back to the Marriot Desert Ridge. Each time we have taken our children, now 14 and 7. We really enjoy the amenities this hotel has to offer. Our children love the heated lazy river and slide, my husband loves the golf courses, driving range and putting green and the spa is very nice. The spa is not the best I have been to but it certainly is nice and relaxing. Because we always go during our spring break, it coincides with "Fight Night" at the hotel. This brings in a lot of stars and "the rich and famous". The staff still attended to our every need even though we are none of the above! While we were there we noticed some renovations happening and were told the hotel was in the process of a $16 million dollar redo. The staff at the Blue Sage was wonderful. Yes, it was crowded on the weekends but they were all very friendly and willing to accomodate. We also ate at the Meritage Steak House. Our prime rib was fabulous but the rest of the meal was mediocre at best. I'd have to say one of my families favorite things to do here is sit out on the lawn and watch the bunnies play in the grass while we read. We really enjoyed it. We would sit out on the balconey more but they are not very private. Only trellis covered with a thin vine in between each.

Reviews.Title: “This is a beautiful, comfortable resort in Phoenix.”
Reviews.Author: travelady042
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, stylish resort but also kid-friendly. My 2 kids enjoyed the Nickeloden Activity Zone, thank goodness because at $30 per child for half a day, it's not cheap. There's a warm lazy river and inviting pools. Staff are attentive and friendly. Service was generally slow at the Blue Sage restaurant. We enjoyed dining at the Roy's restaurant in the hotel. Being provided with a pitcher of ice water and a shaded bench between courts were nice touches at the tennis pavilion. The streets around the hotel provided a good area (sidewalks, nice landscaping) in which to run. There is a spa, two golf courses, and a driving range, which we did not use. The resort is across the street from an upscale shopping area with movie theater, which is convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for 6 year olds up to 16.”
Reviews.Author: bandcv
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 nights with my wife and 2 daughters (7 and 10). What a perfect place for the family. We are a very active family and this was perfect for us. Tennis, golf, and hiking close by. Excercise in the AM and hit the pool about 11am. Lunch at the pool for the kids is $5 for a Cheeseburger, Chicken Tenders, or Quesadilla - great deal. My wife and I like to have some beers during the day and we brought our own cooler to the pool each day. Great Happy Hour from 4-6 every night with half price drinks and Sushi in main lobby area - did that daily. Complimentary laundry was nice. We used points for our stay, room rate was $400 a night. Great place to use points with the kids, not a place to use points without the kids. I would not pay $400 of my own money to stay. Instead find a condo unit to rent across the street at Marriott Canyon Villas that gives you full priviledges at the hotel pools. Probably get one for $1500-$3000 for a week depending on time of year. The Blue Sage is a satisfactory place to eat breakfast, lunch, dinner. I would pay the $25 resort fee per day (gives you access to tennis, golf driving range, and free meals for the kids at Sage each day per each full paid entree). Roys on site is over-rated.
