The hotel is showing its age and needs to be maintained better. Carpets are worn, scuff marks are noticeable on the walls of the hotel's corridors, etc. The "Lazy River" closed at 7 PM in the summer! I find this difficult to believe since there was a good three to four hours more of decent cooler weather. In Phoenix, people like to be outside in the earlier mornings and late evenings. The schedule for this pool should be better than this. I was at conference all day, wanted to take a dip and was told to get out after 15 minutes. Ridiculous! On a separate occasion, I ordered two frozen drinks at the bar close to the "Lazy River". The bartender did not even say hello or acknowledge my friend and I. We had to just give our drink orders. He charged us over $10 per drink which I think goes beyond gouging! He was rude and unfriendly. No tip for any of that! At the conference, a colleague of mine was served, not undercooked, but RAW chicken! We asked the staff member in charge to do something about it, but again, we received an unsatisfactory response. Is this the way to run a supposed "resort"? Then, there was the heavy sell job from the Marriott's Canyon Villas. As if I hadn't spent enough money in the place already! Are you kidding? I am tired of shelling out good money to be treated like this. I, for one, will not be returning to this hotel, and I will be avoiding JW Marriott hotels altogether.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: maddogSJ
Reviews.Content: Wonderful visit...a true resort with numerous amenities, quality service, and stunning location.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Mixed Feelings... Really Wanted to Like it ... But...”
Reviews.Author: dreampilot
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in mid July for six nights and seven days, four of those days attending a convention at the resort. We have a lot of mixed feelings and I have to say that if it wasn't for the great rate we got (nearly 70% off rack) because of our convention, we probably would rate this stay a lot lower. First the good... 1. Location: It is convenient to the Desert Ridge marketplace, a full service mall including a 20 screen movie theater and dozens of restaurants. The Resort runs a shuttle every 15 minutes or so to the mall. If you have a rental car - it's location is very convenient to Phoenix's highway system and downtown is only 20 minutes away. 2. Grounds/Atmosphere: well kept - and you can't beat the bunny brigade as we called it. In the late afternoons, dozens of rabbits plop on the green grass and stretch out - it's an almost surreal experience which is fun for young and old alike. There is a lot of grounds to explore... Although I have to say Orlando's JW Marriott's lazy river is much more fun, there are at least more pools to choose from. The slide would be more fun if it wasn't turned off so early 3. Rooms: Pretty typical for Marriott - which still has the best beds of most any hotel in it's tier. Bathrooms are nice and the flat screens come with full computer interface to hook up your laptops too. Patios in every room are a nice touch and big enough to host 4 friends relaxing. 4. Front Desk Staff, Concierge, housekeeping and Parking Staff were great folks and easy to talk to and represented the Marriott brand well Now the not so good... 1. Service: Outside of the folks mentioned in #4 above, We were extremely disappointed in the service by the other staff. We had better experiences with service at Motel 6 and other budget brands then some of the people we ran into here at this JW. The lounge and bar staff were completely rude, hard to get a hold of and just not very pleasant people to deal with. Our waiter at Roys and one of our waiters at the Blue Sage were the rare exception to the restaurant staff as well. If I ever stay here again - I would much rather take a shuttle to Desert Ridge Marketplace and eat over there than waste any more money at the Resort restaurants and their rude service.. 2. Speaking of staff - the lack of friendliness at the pools by staff was also very noticeable - and quite honestly for what we're paying (if it was normal rack) - we would expect a few more options poolside for drinks and snacks similar to how Orlando's JW resort runs. 3. If you like the all in one contained resort experience, I suppose you will like the entertainment options (2 golf courses, spa, etc) available - but we made more trips into Phoenix than the average guest because quite frankly, these resorts can get boring and drain your pocketbook dry. So maybe in all fairness this complaint isn't fair to direct at this JW specifically - but imo, if you plan to stay a few days here consider renting a car (AT THE AIRPORT - NOT THE RESORT - YOU"LL SAVE LOTS OF MONEY) and exploring the area more. I am not overly picky about service but the consistent attitude and not so hot service we received from the lounge, restaurant and other staff here reduced our rating a whole "star" alone. Anyway - We would recommend this resort if you get a great deal but if you're paying full rate - you'd be much better off perhaps at another one of the many, many resort properties in the area.

Reviews.Title: “No "Green" in the desert!”
Reviews.Author: melodyheard
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly, the resort itself is beautiful, the spa was nice, nothing spectacular and the breakfast was good. Overall this is a nice hotel, my main problem is that they are not environmentally friendly at all. Here are a few examples: -There are about 4 different elevators to get to the same location. This is a total waste of energy. - There is no option to reuse towles. - All five of the bathroom lights are controlled by one switch. You have to turn all of them on even if you only need one. - Daily print outs of hotel activities are left in each room! - There are a gazillion pools in the middle of the desert. Sure they are nice to lounge in but its a bit much. In this day and age I just dont think it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort”
Reviews.Author: travelguy20
Reviews.Content: This is a great resort with a very relaxed atmosphere. The rooms are large and comfortable and the pool area is excellent. Don't miss Roy's for a great dinner. Great stay- perfect for familes on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Wowie!”
Reviews.Author: newmexicomommy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a business conference and was blown away! We are now considering staying here for a vacation the next time we visit relatives in Phoenix. The hotel is absolutely beautiful, the conference facilities were great, the grounds are lovely, and the staff is extremely helpful and friendly. Really an amazing experience. I don't think there's a better place to stay in Phoenix, at least not in my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: megsv98
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip through BJ's wholesale Club..and boy did we save $$$. It cost us $120 a night, and we had a free night for our six day stay. Loved loved loved this resort. The rooms are spacious and clean. Awesome bedding and views. The pool area is excellent, we were on east coast time, so we were up at 7am at the pool daily and had it to ourselves or shared with one or two others till almost 9:30. There are three pools and the fun lazy river. The pool area was never overcrowded in my mind, and had plenty of people to serve drinks and food. We ate at Meritage, Blue Sage, and Just a Splash. We loved all of it. We thought the mixed drinks at the pool for $10.00 were a little pricey for our taste, but hey we didn't have to leave the pool or resort to get to it. We found that going across the street to the Desert Ridge Marketplace and other local restaurants was more fun and cost effective. Our faves: Jalapeno Inferno (Scottsdale Road-5min), Sweet Tomatoes(Desert Ridge Marketplace 1mile), and Islands (Desert Ridge Marketplace 1 mile). If you go to the movies and keep your stub Sweet Tomatoes will give you 15% off your bill. There are a ton of stores in the Marketplace to keep you busy. We also went to the Fashion Square in Scottsdale about 13 miles away. We headed to Williams, AZ about three hours away for the train ride to the Grand Canyon, we don't have children so this long long day trip didn't cause an issue for us. My husband played golf there and loved it as well. This time of year it's 67.00, and he played at TPC Scottsdale (5miles away) for $47.00. Very cheap for excellent courses. We would totally go back the place is awesome!!! My only issue is that parking is forever away, that's why I'd say 90% of the visitors use the valet service. We didn't use it...but oh well we got our exercise.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Desert Oasis: Do not miss in Phoenix!!!”
Reviews.Author: Justtravels988
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd visit to Desert Ridge. The hotel is stunning. The property is large, well-maintained, relaxed and sophisticated. It is contemporary in a growing region of Phoenix and is very impressive... it would be hard to be disappointed at this hotel. Stunning spa area and pool--fantastic restaurants (though I recommend you skip Roy's-- overpriced and overhyped). The grounds are beautiful. Firepits, relaxing furniture, open space, warm pools---a very relaxing resort. First class! I toured the Cloud Club on my last visit and will definitely book these accommodations on my next visit (food and beverage, lounge, etc). Beautiful lounge w/ breakfast, drinks, etc inclusive. The food and beverage is pricey--upgrade to cloud club for a little more---it's worth it. There are many fantastic resorts in Phoenix. The JW is more affordable, less pretentious and just as fantastic as its counterparts (Fairmont, Four Seasons, Phoenician, etc). Don't miss for a great Phoenix resort!

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic resort”
Reviews.Author: Roger E
Reviews.Content: For the last 10 years our March holiday has always been a Caribbean affair, taking in Antigua, Barbados, St Lucia, Canouan and Grenada which emerged as our favourite and resulted in 5 visits. The combination of almost guaranteed sunshine, sandy beaches, crystal clear seas and increasingly luxurious resort just had us coming back for more. But this year the combination of an early Easter and school holidays meant that redemption opportunities were nonexistent and discounted fares were very difficult to find. It was a friendwho said, "Have you ever thought of going to Phoenix, Arizona?" "No. Never," was my reply. Seriously I thought Phoenix was wilderness USA, nothing but cattle ranches and cactuses. Nevertheless the seed had been sown and as I searched the internet I uncovered a raft of luxury resorts in the area, all brimming with swimming pools, golf courses, spas and other facilities. In fact it became clear that we could find everything we had become used to in the Caribbean apart from the sea. And since we adopted the little one - we have spent an increasing amount of time around the pool anyway. Award availability was wide open in all classes on the BA flights from LHR so we booked 3 Club seats and finally settled on the JW Marriott Desert Ridge Resort and Spa. Others we considered where the Phoenician (maybe a little more up market and very expensive), Fairmont Scottsdale Princess (it got lots of poor reviews for service), and the Royal Palm Resort (lovely but very few facilities for a 10 day stay). The Marriott won because it had 5 swimming pools, 6 restaurants, Two 18 hole golf courses, a spa, a desert botanical garden, expansive grounds, and a lazy river bigger than I have seen in most water parks I have visited. We arrived after a flawless flight and only 10 minutes to clear US customs and immigration, sweeping up this huge magestic driveway to be greeted by an army of bellhops and people eager to be at our beck and call. The reception of the hotel is set around a giant open plan "Atrium" area about 4 storeys high - a feature that apparantly is being introduced into Marriott resorts world wide. This provides a central meeting place for families, businessmen, and drinkers. It looks out onto an expansive lawn and lake called The Sage Lawn where we saw people playing ball games and later in the week special meals being served to conference delegates. Lining the lawn is the outside Vista Bar where they light the Firepits as soon as the sun goes down and these fires become the focal point for the evening live entertainment. Our standard room was very big - the king sized bed suitably covered in various layers of pillows, throws, wraps and other decorations. The bathroom had a walk in shower and spa bath and all the usual smelly stuff which they replaced twice everyday. There was a gigantic flat screen TV with all the usual pay for extra services. Great balcony patio with views over the desert and mountains. The swimming pool area was very impressive. 4 huge swimming pools (with a 5th available in the spa in a more private and tree lined location), and the lazy river. The latter was so relaxing - simple grab a huge rubber ring, sit back and be carried round a landscaped lap every 15 minutes or so. This was a good place for topping up the sun tan as well. We arrived on Easter Sunday and the resort was mobbed with families. On the first day the swimming pool area was very busy and I did have a fear that we had made a mistake (most Caribbean resorts have a very quiet relaxed air about them). But on the second day the families disappeared and the business conference delegates arrived so the swimming pool areas became very empty. The only thing I didn't like about the swimming pool area was the piped music - simply because it was intrusive. However they did have an extensive collection of 80s music and I heard songs like "Safety Dance" by Men Without Hats for the first time since the.....well since the 80s. The resort features some very impressive restaurants. Blue Sage - where you have a typical US breakfast and for the rest of the day typical US fare of burgers, steaks and ribs. Not the best place and the focal point for families but good value for breakfast. Roys - a Hawaiian Fusion restaurant with a great wine list which soon became our favourite. Sitting outside in their garden with torches burning and with the nearby firepits warming the air was a lovely setting. The Five Spice Fillet Steak melted like butter when cut and the rib starter was mouth watering. After dinner you can retire to lounge chairs around the firepit and finish of your bottle of red wine. Meritus Steak House - this was at the Golf Club and had an impressive range of steaks from NY Strip to their signature dish which is a smoked rib-eye steak - this was delicious - never had smoked beef before and it was a pleasant change from the normal way a steak gets cooked. Good squid and chicken here as well. Their terrace over looks the desert botantical garden and again is a lovely venue for an evening of food and wine. Tuscany - this is their signature restaurant and features gormet Italian fare. Another terrace garden, this time over looking a lake and "The Isle of Capri" which that night was being used for a conference dinner. The Spa - the restaurant here does fitness breakfasts and health conscious lunches. The spa itself is well equiped with a fitness studio for Yoga and Thai Chi, treatment rooms and a large swimming pool surrounded by palm trees and cabannas that you can hire out for a more relaxing day. Try the hot stone massage - quite deep and penetrating (oo - er!), and try walking on rubbery legs afterwards. Splash - is a poolside restaurant serving burgers and sandwiches. The turkey BLT was fabulous with waffle fries. Finally - not really a restaurant - but there was also a Starbucks and this had the longest queues. The yanks love their morning Starbucks don't they? We did breakfast - basically a grande and a muffin here several mornings. The grounds of the hotel were spotlessly clean, and liberally landscaped with waterfalls, lakes, flowers and cactuses. There were rabbits on the lawns and even mallard ducks swimming in the pools. And the coyotes came to the Golf course greens every evening. One night I even saw a barn owl swooping down over the roof of the golf club. Service everywhere was impeccable. Each bar and restaurant has plenty of waiting staff, people to pour more wine, people to clean up the plates and sometimes simply to have a chat - so it seemed. We took a day trip to the Grand Canyon which I am not even going to try and describe. It is one thing that only the eyes can appreciate. Photos and videos do not do the place justice. And we spent a morning riding horses in the desert. My first time on a horse and I enjoyed every minute of it - but boy was I sore the following day!! Any critisisms? Only one. The Hotel was very inconsistent with its turn down service. I find this at most hotels that offer it - including Ritz Carlton. If they are going to service the room for a second time during the day then they should be consistent. Some nights they only cleaned the bathroom, some they turned the bed down, put slippers by the bed, put a chocolate on the pillow and put on a soothing CD, other nights nothing at all. Anyway it resulted in a $100 credit when I made the comments. So I would whole heartedly recommend this place. We would go back definitely and as a winter holiday it gave us everything we have ever had in the Caribbean apart from the sea - but with one major major advantage. It is a dry arid climate so there are no biting insects. So for the first time in 10 years I didn't have to smother nuclear strength Deet Aftershave all over my body to stop a concerted mosquito attack.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: paper11
Reviews.Content: We just got back from this resort and we are talking about going again already. The resort was Beautiful and the staff was Wonderful. I don't think that I have stayed at another hotel that has had better all around customer service. Nearly every person we talked to, whether it was at different restaurants, outside, at the front desk etc. seemed genuinely happy and more than willing to answer any questions we had. Many members of the staff seemed to go out of there way to help. From the moment we got there, the staff outside were Very friendly. The first thing we did was eat lunch at an outside cafe and the waiter we had was Very nice. Later we had dinner and sat outside on the patio and listened to live music and our waitress was extremely nice and helpful. Another day, we went to the kid's play room that they have and the young woman there was one of the friendliest people I have ever met. Another day, we didn't get our roomed cleaned and someone came by to make sure we didn't need anything. We didn't, but it was nice that someone came by to ask. Another night, we had dinner at Roy's restaurant and the service was Excellent. We have a little one who has a few food restrictions due to allergies and they went out of their way to find her a dessert that she could eat (that came free with her meal) even after we told them it wasn't a big deal. Our little one loved the dessert! When we booked our vacation it came with a credit and room upgrade. The front desk was great at helping to make sure that we actually got these. The room was Great! We had a huge tub and stand up shower and a private balcony that we could sit on and listen to the live music each night. GREAT!!! We loved that. The entire resort was clean and the interior decorating throughout was beautiful. I appreciated all the of the details and decor everywhere. In your room you are also given a, "What's going on today" sheet that tells you everything you can participate in which is really nice. If I had to point out a few things that were not positive, there aren't many. There are many birds that fly around so there is a good number of bird droppings by the pool area and at least on the balcony that we had. But, you can walk around these. It doesn't take away at how beautiful the resort is and at how great the landscaping is. It's really beautiful. Although there is a lazy river, which is great fun and relaxing, if you have someone with you that cannot swim or isn't a strong swimmer, I wouldn't let them out of your sight. My husband, literally helped save a woman from drowning. She went up and down in and out of the water a couple times splashing around and when we realized she needed help, she had just went under water again and didn't resurface for many seconds with one hand sticking out of the water until my husband jumped in from the other side and got to her and pulled her out of the water. There was a lifeguard nearby, but I think she must not have seen her. Also, I think there are spots that the lifeguards cannot see and although the water isn't deep, it's moving and for someone who cannot swim well, it's easy to panic and slip which is what I think happened to this woman. Thankfully, she is ok. Also, I did have a couple drinks by the pool that were a little spendy that were not very good that I didn't finish, but then my husband and I both ordered a couple smoothies that we were delicious. Almost every staff member was friendly and we loved our vacation. We are talking about perhaps going to stay there again sometime!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: Danni0005
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Beds comfy, service wonderful, food great. Wish the pool scene was better.....but if you have kids it is great. Very expensive but worth it. Far away from everything. $60 cab ride to airport. You need a car if you want to go anywhere. But luxurious, pretty, relaxing, and fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great Spring Getaway”
Reviews.Author: sgordonosu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights the first week of April. We had a fantastic time. We arrived at night and the hotel was beautifully lit. Upon entry the staff was very friendly and helpful. Walking to our room we were a little nervous as we had to walk to the back of the hotel and down the stairs. When we got into our room we were pleasantly surprised. The room was definitely one of the nicer rooms we have been in. Everything was very clean and updated. Our room had a small patio area that overlooked a water with a fountain. My husband is in sales and stays in hotel rooms across the country every week. He was impressed with the both the room and bathroom. The grounds of the hotel are spectacular. We found something new to explore every day we were there. We didn't find the pools to be too crowded. There are a variety of locations to sit at and enjoy the pools and waterfalls. We found the lazy river a nice place to sit near since it kept people moving by and not constantly splashing or yelling right in your face. There were also other locations through out the pool area that were quiet and relaxing just to sit and listen to the water falls. My husband is a Gold member and we had access to the spa fitness facility. Which was also very nice with ellipticals and tread mills with tv's attached as well as a variety of free weights and machines. The Desert Ridge mall is with in walking distance and offers a variety of great places to eat and shop. We at at Roy's one night which was fantastic. We had a lunch a few times at the pool and the staff was very accommodating. We had a great time seeing the wild life too. We made friends with a duck, got to see a nest of great horned owls at the spa and saw a variety of birds and bunnies. I was a bit nervous after reading some of the reviews. I do have to say some of them are a bit critical. My husband stays at various hotels across the U.S. every week. And he was very impressed with the grounds, room and service here. He pointed out that rarely does he find a hotel that has free internet access, few that have rooms that are as nice as these, and very few that have bathrooms as nice as this. Yes there are kids here and people enjoying their vacations, if that bothers you there are plenty of spaces around the 4 pools, hot tubs, lawns or spa that provide privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent All Around!”
Reviews.Author: The_Devil
Reviews.Content: I must be living in another dimension than some of these reviewers because my experience at the Marriott was outstanding - and I was just one of the "sheep" attending a conference there! My thought upon arrival was that perhaps since I was only there for the conference that service provided to me would be sub-par but that was not the case. The staff, at all times, were friendly and helpful - even the young men working the valet service (although it is my understanding that they are contracted by the hotel). Upon check-in, my request for a king bed was immediately satisfied, despite the two large conferences going on there that week. My room overlooked the "Isle of Capri." The grounds were immaculate. On occasion I did see some trash but with all of the kids about, that is to be expected. On the subject of the grounds, I have uploaded some photos I took while there. If you are into birding, you'll see several species that have taken up residence at the resort, including Verdin, Gambel's quail, Cactus wren, Kildeer and Curve-billed thrashers, along with the usual Mourning doves, House sparrows, Mallards and Great-tailed grackles. I didn't expect to see rabbits on the grounds (I'm from the east coast) but they were everywhere and allowed me to get close enough for some nice pictures. The children at the resort loved seeing the "bunny rabbits." The room was very clean and I was pleased to discover a 37" flat-screen TV upon arrival. There was also a user-programmable safe and a mini-fridge. The mini-fridge was split in two down the middle, with the left side locked (where the booze, etc. was located) and the right side unlocked. A key to the fridge was offered at check-in. The bed was VERY comfortable and the A/C unit cooled the room down quickly when asked of it. The bathroom had a marble counter and included a tub and a glass-enclosed shower, at opposite ends of the room. Hot water was almost immediate, at any time. I did not eat at the hotel restaurant since food was provided at the conference. Whoever catered the event did a fantastic job, with the helpful, friendly staff and delicious food. (I only add this to my review in case the hotel was somehow connected with the catering.) Smoking is not permitted in any of the rooms but ashtrays are provided upon request for balcony use. For those interested in shopping at the nearby Desert Ridge Mall, the hotel provides a free shuttle service, with departures every 30 minutes from the hotel entrance. There is an Albertson's grocery store at the mall (with an attached liquor section) as well as a CVS and Target, for any of your needs. Overall, my stay was outstanding and I would certainly recommend the JW Marriott, without hesitation. I would take the negative reviews of this hotel with a grain of salt - and are probably written by people who would find something to complain about while staying with Her Majesty the Queen in Buckingham Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Sud, subpar”
Reviews.Author: stpaulites
Reviews.Content: This resort has a good website "sell", but is in no way a four star. A group of us went for a girls weekend and were extremely diappointed. We all travel quite a bit and have stayed in great spots. This is not one of them. The service was non-existant at the pools, the restaurants, the front desk and the lounge. If you are going to charge $15 for a martini, you had better have a waitress in the lounge that appears within, oh, say, less than 20 minutes and doesn't have attitude (just as an example). Our room was nothing special, the pools were overcrowded and filled with partiers and kids. Not our idea of a $400+/night resort.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott, you can do MUCH better”
Reviews.Author: CTSirTravelsAlot
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a 7 night stay (4/12-19) using Marriot Rewards points. This is my second stay at this hotel, last was 2 years ago for 3 nights. First, let me say I am a Gold Member of the Rewards program and am a loyal patron. That being said, I was dissapointed not to be treated like one. One week before check-in I requested a room overlooking the Desert Botanical Garden. I did this knowing that the rooms facing the pool are quite loud at times. I was told I had an "upgraded view room". Upon check-in I was given a room with "two over-sized Queens" according to the front desk. Queens?? These are full beds and I am with my wife of nearly 15 years on vacation. Possibly we could have a King bed? Oh yes, and the room is on the 2nd floor overlooking...the pool. I called front desk immediately to let them know this was not satisfactory. They took my cell number and told me they would call when they had another room available. The time marched on until about 3:30. At this point, I was concerned they would have filled their rooms. I went to the front desk and found they only had 2 rooms left in the hotel. Unreal. They were a King on ground floor (I always request high floors, but apparently having that information in your Elite reservation status is just for one's own personal information) and another double/double room overlooking the Botanical Garden. I took the double/double begrudgingly as it least it had a decent view. By the way, no offer to help move my luggage...nice touch. Room we finally setlled in was standard for the resort. Nice view of mountains, botanical garden and....720 people from Bacardi on two mornings having breakfast. Now I dont begrudge the hotel for making money on corporate events, but they need a better system to make those on vacation not feel inconvenienced by these events. My inconvenience came at 3:30 AM on my 2nd night there when the staff started setting up the buffets, etc. Having come to AZ for the weather, I had my sliding glass door open. Ahhhh, the relaxing sounds of golf carts backing up (beep, beep, beeep) and rattling dishes, clanking glasses. Now, every day you get a sheet in your room with activities for the resort. Basically, this doesn't change form day to day. My suggestion? Put the events and location of events on their as a "heads-up" to the vacationing resort guests so they know if they should keep their door shut so as not to be awoken at 3:30 AM. Another thought, work it out with the corporation to give those in rooms overlooking their event a small gift. It would go a long way. Lastly, let's talk about litter. The grounds are mainly immaculate. This ends in the common areas outside, especially at the pools (SPA pool is worth the money). I know there are a huge number of people that traffic these areas, but the resort doesn't seem to know this. They need many more staff to clean up througout the day. Cups, straws, etc were everywhere. Part of the blame lay on the guests. Some of whom didn't make any effort to clean up after themselves. On the other hand, I shouldn't be swimming in a pool with empty cups at the bottom (at least 1 every day I was there). Also, as I was walking back to my room after a day at the pool and I noticed something striking. There was a sugar packet on the lawn as well as a piece of plastic. I saw 2 Marriott employees, one was dressed as a manager. I thought this will be interesting to see if they stop to pick up this trash. The answer? They walked right by. Marriott, train your employees to have pride in the resort surroundings. This is unacceptable. One last piece of advice: get some new chaise lounges out at the main pool. A number of them look like you got them from a garage sale. People are paying over $500 a night at this time of year for chairs like this? The lounges at the Spa should be standard for this kind of high-end resort.

Reviews.Title: “Get A Discount or try elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: wamu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW Marriott for three nights in April - it is a fairly new site and you could definately tell. The hotel and grounds seem impressive when you pull up to the place, but we found the rooms to be fairly average with nothing special to really speak of. There are three swimming pools and a "lazy" river you can float around in, which my four year old enjoyed - at first. The problem with this hotel is with the employees - most of the employees we came into contact with were standoffish and rude. An employee working at the top of the waterslide at the pool was verbally abusive to the kids - letting some go down the slide and telling others to "take a break." Although my son met the height requirements, she scolded him for being up there without me (I was waiting at the bottom of the slide in the pool for him.) This upset him and he refused to go on the slide again with "the mean lady" working there. I talked to the manager of the pool area and he said he would address it. The overall feel of the employees there was cold and, well, just plain rude. We were able to get a cheap rate - $125 per night - so we didn't feel to taken - but if you have to pay $300 or $400 for this place, look around somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fair Resort”
Reviews.Author: matcait
Reviews.Content: My wife and 3 kids stayed at this resort during spring break and were not impressed. We've stayed at numerous resorts all over the US and Phoenix and this would rate in the middle at best. The rooms were not clean and the room service was always late and suboptimal. The food in the resort was fair atbest and expensive. Roy's restuarant was good but it was the only restuarant that was worth the price of the meal. The swimming pools could have been cleaner and the poolside service was VERY POOR!!! The margarita's were terrible with soggy salt on the edge of the glass and the bartender at the pool was rude! Also, the concierge was rude and not helpful.... The room rates were very high for this type of service. I would not stay here again... CD

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location in the Sonoran Desert”
Reviews.Author: lilyofcolorado
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the most recent reviews I must say the one from New York made me laugh. I have learned from my travels never to judge a book by the cover some of the wealthiest people in Scottsdale dress like gardners and drive " american" cars! Here is my take on the JW Marriott. Great location but will not travel in March it is Spring Break and no matter where you travel whether beach or ski there will be plenty of kids about. I was suprised no one mentioned the vacation club time shares. Do not show interest when traveling past the time share desks because I did and not only had 3 separate voicemail messages on my room phone but also had a flyer put on my door so unless you are truly interested in their 90 min presentation steer clear. This hotel is located across from Desert Ridge Marketplace one of the cleanest outside shopping malls I have visited, it is not high end stores but has most everything moderate and they do provide a shuttle pick up from Desert Ridge. The rooms are some of the cleanest and the housekeeping staff very friendly. The pools were crowded due to the month of travel but there are several and they do clear out at 5:00 pm and since it is still very nice outside that is a great time for adults to attend. The restaurants are priced average for a hotel in this category. The room service prices are steep for breakfast so we went across to Mimi's or Paradise Bakery. Be prepared to walk alot, if you like to be near the pool or golf please ask to be near those areas. The nightly turndown service provides a schedule of activities for the next day, this is the first time I have seen a Segway tour offered. Overall a very pretty setting, quiet and very clean rooms. free parking, paid laundry room. As long as you like yellow and gold tones you will not be disappointed. Lots to do but you will pay for almost everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Desert Ridge!”
Reviews.Author: Surgie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were guests at the Marriott Desert Ridge from Mar. 24-29. Since we had an early morning flight, we had requested early check-in in advance. We knew it might or might not be available but we were happy to learn on arrival that our room was ready and it was only a little past 9:00 a.m. We had also requested a high floor in advance and we were given a room on the 5th floor (top floor) that overlooked the lagoon, golf course and mountains in the distance - very quiet and relaxing on the balcony. The room was spacious and nicely decorated. I have read other reviews complaining about the size of the room. We had a "regular" king room and there was a desk and chair, loveseat, coffee table, armoire and still plenty of room. I peeked in a room with 2 queens (or doubles) and it looked a little more cramped. So if a king bed suits your needs, you will find it more spacious. The bathroom was huge - separate tub and shower and large vanity. The staff went out of their way to be friendly and accommodating. The concierge made three dinner reservations for us, gave advice on activities we might enjoy, and printed out our boarding passes on the day of our check-out . Breakfast at the Blue Sage was great - good food and fast service - we ate outdoors each morning. We did not eat any other meals at the hotel so can't comment on that. Even though the hotel was full, the only place that seemed crowded was at the pool. It was somewhat of a chore to find a chair each day. Lots of chair-saving going on, even though the hotel says this is against their policy. However, the beverage service at the pool was fine. I forgot my pool wrist bracelet twice but this was not a problem - I had my room key and was not asked to go back to get the bracelet. I appreciate the staff's diligence in keeping outsiders out of the pool in order to keep it available for guests - this is common practice at other nice resorts. The spa was a real treat! It was expensive but in line with what other spas charge. I think when you travel at spring break, it takes a good attitude to have a great time and enjoy your vacation. Meeting people from different backgrounds is part of what makes travel so interesting if you're open-minded enough to appreciate it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ELSUSHI921
Reviews.Content: Its a pretty hotel with lovely rooms not 5 star but clean and well kept up. We were disappointed in the crowd, it was not the usual JW crowd, it was sort of a MidWest tatto crowd, not the usual preppy golf crowd. We were out there for a wedding but soend 5 days just relaxing and enjoying the sun, only it was awful sitting at the pool. The pool was more of a "lazy rivier" disneyesque feel. The lounge chairs were horrible, they had no pads on them and there was no one to set up the chairs and lay out towels for us. People were slobs throwing empty drink cups all over the place. We felt the service was so so, no one is too friendly out there. We ended up sitting on the cushy patio chairs alot more and we also paid the extra $35.00 per day per person to sit at the spa pool which had a very different crowd, more east coast and no tattos and people were dressed better and had Gucci's and LV bags. Normally we go to the Phoenician but it was over booked, and we planned this last minute. It was just a so so feeling and we spent about $400 per night and we felt it was like a fancy Days Inn. The pool area was just packed with people and you felt really squeezed in and not as if you were at a top resort. We won;t go back there again, the corwd was really not what we expected and the people were wild at the pool and no one watched their children all that well. The waitresses were slow and not friendly, the front desk crew were excellent. Wish I had better things to say.

Reviews.Title: “Great Curb Appeal; Guest Room Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Charla
Reviews.Content: Everything about the public areas of this hotel screams "class" and "perfection." The drive up to the hotel is breathtaking; the lobby is expansive and elegant. The grounds are perfectly manicured. The people are delightful and guest-focused. Yes, this looks like a hotel that would charge me $315 a night on a conference rate. My guest room, however, was more like the Bates Motel. There were stretchmarks and rips in the carpet. The dark furniture was of a style that defies classification - and much of it was badly chipped. Although the bathroom was gigantic, there was less than an inch of clearance between the toilet seat and the glass shower door - a strange place to skimp on space, if you ask me! The best /worst part, however, was that for my entire three-day stay, and despite attempts to ask for a repair, the bedside lamp never worked and was never replaced. (Oh, and it was really, really ugly too!) I ended up moving the floor lamp over next to the bed so I could read. It was annoying to pay so much for so little of what really, really matters! (The bed was fine. The plumbing was fine. The TV, although not a flat screen, was OK. Starbuck's and a Kinko's are both right in the hotel.) I wish I could tell you that this place was planning to renovate my room, but there's no indication that this isn't Business as Usual. So, although you'll pay what you have to, if you want to stay at this hotel, be warned that what you see out front may not be what you get when you get inside.

Reviews.Title: “Best Experienced If You Come For The Outdoors”
Reviews.Author: TessaTB
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our vacation here and we had a great time using the pool facilities. The pool area is about the most impressive I've seen at a hotel. We had a blast, it's great if you have kids. Although it would be nice if they had an adult pool - dealing with all those children running around was annoying from time to time but we still had fun. They have an awesome golf course too. The hotel itself is very new money - a little bit gaudy and too done but impressive nonetheless. The entire resort is very pretty but also has the feeling of Orlando, FL because nothing looks natural. They had quite a few restaurants in different price ranges. We ate at Roy's twice and had a great time. The ambiance in there seemed the most fun, especially with the tiki torches. The room itself was disappointing for the amount of money you pay. It seems like they focused a lot on the outdoors and not so much in the rooms, they were pretty standard hotel rooms. It was nice to have a balcony though. We enjoyed the lounge area on the ground floor-they had live music every night we stayed which was great. They have fire pits all over the hotel grounds to sit around and warm up on cooler nights. Overall it was a fun stay but not quite worth all the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a conference”
Reviews.Author: chunkMD
Reviews.Content: I stayed here March 13-16 for a conference. The room I stayed in was huge with a king bed and a pull out sofa. The bathroom was as big as some hotel rooms that I have stayed at in the past with a seperate shower and nice sized tub. Had a nice sized balcony with 2 chairs and a small table. My view would have been of the pool except for the 2 palm trees that were blocking my view. If you had never seen a palm tree before, it would have been a great view. In the evening, outside of the Vista Lounge, a guitar player (or 2) did some nice folksy songs. I could actually hear it in my room with the balcony door closed. Nice music though. Something that confused me when I got there...I had heard that there was a charge to use the health club. There are actually 2 health clubs....one by the lazy river...that is open 24/7, and no charge. It's fair, but had everything I needed, so I used it. The other one (for which you pay) was in the Spa...it looked much nicer, but I didn't feel the need to have to use my money to go there. Food at the conference was very good. Used the carryout from the restaurant...?Blue Sage...that was great for bfast. Lots of great places to just sit and enjoy the scenery. Very peaceful and quiet when I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Wow...talk about luxury!”
Reviews.Author: saturncmc
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a business meeting at this hotel. The hotel is gorgeous and the rooms are spectacular. Every room has a spacious balcony and the views are great. All rooms have seperate shower stalls, coffee makers and safes and the rooms are immaculate. The meeting rooms are spacious and the staff is so accommodating. The food in the restaurants is delicious, especially at Roy's Hawaiian Fusion. I did not have time to enjoy the pool, but it looked wonderful and there is actually a 'lazy river' that you can use a tube to float around in. All in all, it was a great time and I would probably come to this hotel for vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Something missing”
Reviews.Author: Theaxman
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the J.W. Marriott I was impressed by the entrance and beauty of the building and landscaping. My room was ready and check in was quick and easy. It is a walk to everywhere. The room was smaller than I expected. Is there a special on throw pillows. The bathroom was very appealing. However, a 29 in TV, you're kidding me. This is a resort, I don't even have 29 in tvs at home. There was no DVD player in the room which I would have expected. The rooms were also a little noisy for my taste. The grounds and facilities are stunning with the exception of the health club, which is mediocre. Why is it that Resort and Spas usually have poor health clubs? Maybe the belief is "you're here to be lazy, if you want to sweat, go to Bally's" The equipment was in bad condition and it just wasn't a good facility. The health club requires you to walk outside to get there (bad move). The pools were beautiful with a lazy river and walking path along side. The hotel is pretty isolated, but it is located in a relatively nice area with a huge shopping complex and strip mall within walking distance. We always ate dinner offsite at one of the restaurants, so I didn't have a chance to eat at the Resort. My wife said the Spa was first class and thought the prices were reasonable. There is also a golf course on the grounds (it's Phoenix). I would stay here again, but it probably wouldn't be my first choice in the Phoenix area. I've stayed in much better rooms for less money and better looking places. My wife and I went for a convention and spent a couple of extra days, but as soon we were leaving, another convention was moving in. Maybe that had to do with the coldness of the place. That may be what's missing.

Reviews.Title: “Lived Up to High Expectations”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedWarrior
Reviews.Content: We were here for a 4 day weekend (President's Day) and had a great time! The rooms are large and the bathrooms spacious with nice amenities. The hotel offers a variety of recreational activites-spa, golf, tennis, pool, variety of restaurants. If that's not enough, a very large shopping center is across the road and free hotel shuttle transportation is provided. We used the golf and spa facilites as well as the pool area and found all to be great. There are 4 restaurants. The 3 we ate in were all excellent. All the staff members we came in contact with were polite and attentive. After reading some other reviews, our main concern prior to our visit was whether the hotel is relaxing or a "convention hotel" with a rude and noisy "expense account crowd" dominating. During our visit several groups had meetings but none seemed to interfer with the guests who were just there to relax. Although it's a short outside walk outside to get to the health club and self parking is a 3-5 minute walk from the hotel, Phoenix weather is good most of the time so neither should be a serious issue. Overall, our visit was an experience we look forward to having again in the future! [A large, separate exibition/convention hall is under construction and looks like it will be ready in summer or fall 2008. We trust that Marriott will ensure that convention business doesn't overwhelm the hotel and interfer with the guests paying their own way who expect to have access to the facilities at their convenience without being subjected to noise and overcrowding (if you think it might be a problem it might be wise to call and see what they have booked at the time you plan to be there ).]

Reviews.Title: “Classy Place”
Reviews.Author: Gracie27
Reviews.Content: We went out to Phoenix for a girls spa trip from 2/15 through 2/18-just a quick weekend getaway. This hotel was wonderful-the grounds are beautiful, the staff is so helpful, the spa was one of the nicest I have ever been to, and the food was excellent. I will say they definetely focus on their conventions and it is a great resort for golfers...if you are looking to experience downtown Phoenix, I wouldn't recommend this place but for a nice, relaxing trip, convention, or golf outing, its perfect. We spent a lot of time across the street at the Desert Ridge Marketplace, eating and shopping and the Resort offers a complimentary shuttle service back and forth as well. Our room was on the top floor overlooking the front of the hotel-it was the perfect size for the three of us. And honestly the only complaint i have was that during the evening you could hear the "lobby" band playing from our room because the main hotel is set up like an atrium so many rooms overlook the lobby and noise carries, but we just put the tv on and went to sleep and it stopped at a decent hour, so it really wasn't a pain. The hotel was beautiful, I loved how they have the fruited water all over the place and they gave you a free starbucks coffee coupon every morning. They had nature walks along the trails and the fitness center was very nice (no one was really there). Besides the spa cafe, we did not eat at any of the restaurants in the hotel so I cannot comment on them. I would love to come back to this resort when its a little warmer and I can really enjoy the pool. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Institutional, Great Service, But Convention Oriented Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScipioAfricanus
Reviews.Content: This is a huge, institutional convention resort. This is not a cozy place. It's huge and impersonal. The service was some of the best I've experienced in recent memory. The service was, in fact, so persistent it was actually annoying at times. For instance, we would recieve a call on our voice mail after every time room service was delivered, or extra towels were delivered, or after we asked for an extra pillow. While we appreciate their concern, it gets old after a week, multiple times a day. There was only 1 bar in the whole hotel, other than in the restaurants. There were conventions there when we stayed and the bar/lobby area was packed and unusable. Very disappointing and annoying for such a HUGE hotel. The bathtub in our room was unable to modulate the hot and cold water (it would either be scalding or freezing, not in between). We had engineering in there 2 times, which upon the 2nd time, they offered us a new room. It was our last day so we declined, but there was cerainly no offer to reduce the bill. We are from the Phoenix area and there are a lot of other great places to stay that have much better ambiance and faciities. The service was great but it couldn't save the cold, institutional feel of this convention oriented hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply unexceptional”
Reviews.Author: dukektown
Reviews.Content: Never having previously stayed at a J.W. Marriott, I truly looked forward to my visit at the Desert Ridge property. Unfortunately, the overall experience could best be described as “unimpressive”. Arriving at the J.W. Marriott Desert Ridge, I found the expansive entrance to be very fitting of a quality property. Check-in was fairly quick and efficient even though I showed up about two hours before their scheduled check-in time. It was possible that I might have been a little lucky since the person ahead of me was telling his friend that he was not able to check-in yet because his room was not ready. My room was on the 5th of 6 floors which did fulfill my request for a “high floor” from my online reservation. The room was nicely appointed although the room itself seemed a little small based on my expectations. The king-size bed had an ample supply of pillows and included two side tables with lamps. The room also had a small loveseat with coffee table as well as a small work desk. The armoire had an approximately 29 inch conventional television as well as a mini-bar which required a key to access the contents. The bathroom had a nice amount of marble and was visually appealing. Basically, there were no major problems with my stay, however, there were numerous minor ones that left me unimpressed. To start with, my shower was apparently missing some silicone caulking near its base which produced about a 4 foot puddle by the time I was done with my shower. The next day while getting ready for a meeting, there was no hot water available. I called down to the front desk and was informed that a pipe burst earlier and that there would not be any hot water for an hour. I certainly understand that pipes can burst, but that did not help me get ready for my meeting! The health club is quite mediocre by most current standards. There are around ten elliptical/treadmill machines. The equipment itself looked a little worn out. While working out in the morning, there were no special items placed in the room such as apples or bottles of water. The fitness center itself is about 100 yards from the closest point to the hotel building and requires you to walk outside to get there. I found that a little irritating since it was only around 40 degrees F each morning when I went to workout. The pools appeared quite nice and included a lazy river system. Unfortunately, the weather was just a little too cold to enjoy it! Another minor irritation is that I found the noise insulation in my room to be mediocre at best. Every evening from 6-10 PM a duo would be playing music on the ground floor of the atrium. Well, that basically negated any ability to get a good night’s sleep before 10 PM as my door and walls would vibrate to the music even though I was on the 5th floor! I probably should have requested a room change, but I guess I just did not care enough (it was reminiscent of the noise in my room at college). The upkeep of my room was a little variable as well. One day the maid failed to replace the plastic bag in the ice bucket. Another day, she forgot to dispose of the garbage in one of the garbage cans. The maid service itself was performed as late as 4 PM on one of the days which I think is a little too late. The hotel is located in a relatively nice area with a huge shopping complex within walking distance. One of the subtle downsides of the hotel is that it seems much more geared for conventioneers than vacationers. Everywhere you turn there seems to be a person with their nametag attached to a lanyard around their neck. I did not eat at any of the restaurants but did enjoy several of the catered meals, presumably prepared by the J.W, at my conference. Other minor issues included the toiletries which were marked as “Made in China”. I found that a little surprising considering most “nicer” hotels/resorts certainly try to make exclusive toiletries for their guests. Also, there was no DVD player in the room which would have been nice. I wrestled on whether giving this J.W. Marriott three, or four stars. I ended up with four as a compromise that is was not great but not average either. I doubt I would bring my family here for a vacation, but would not mind it for a convention. There just was nothing particularly exception about the property to truly warrant a higher rating.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For Christmas”
Reviews.Author: daisyhead21
Reviews.Content: We took a family vacation to this resort for the Christmas holiday (2 parents & 4 grown kids in our 20's). When we arrived we were warmly greeted by doormen & bellhops. The entrance was incredible & very welcoming. I am a self-described hotel snob and I was pleasantly surprised by how wonderful the resort was. The rooms were very clean & restocked with towels twice daily (morning & turn-down service). It was quite expansive, but just enough to feel like you had your own space. There were many little nooks where you could curl up with a book or take a nap in the sun & no one would know or care that you were there. The lobby had a nice bar & plenty of couches & tables to play card games on well into the night. There was live music every night - my only complaint is that they should have played later than 10 PM! I would recommend the Starbucks or Blue Sage Marketplace for breakfast. Although you are still going to pay $2 for a cookie, they are the only "munchie" place in the hotel. If you like healthy food eat at the Spa Bistro. It is open to everyone even if you don't use the spa. The food was very good & quite refreshing - - $9 for a "healthy" hamburger, not bad. We did eat at the Blue Sage restaurant for dinner & was not too happy with the service. All the other restaurants in the hotel were a bit out of our price range. I would recommend the Desert Ridge Marketplace across the street (nice walk, or catch the shuttle every 1/2 hour from the hotel). Although, it may look like a mall, there are not that many shops, but there are plenty of restaurants! We at at the Yard House. If you like beers, they have 84 on tap!!! They even put on our Packers for one of the football games! All in all, this would be my 1st pick of hotels if I was ever back in Phoenix. Contrary to some of the reviews on here (that had me a bit nervous before I went), this hotel is not business/conference centered. Yes, they have wonderful facilities for these events, but outside of that, it is all vacation & relaxation. If you go - have fun & check out the sunrises over the mountains - breath-taking!

Reviews.Title: “Would return again!”
Reviews.Author: joparke
Reviews.Content: Phoenix, Az is one of the best places in the USA I have been to for relaxation, site seeing and adventure. I found the hotel location ideal and the staff extremely friendly and ready to assist, with genuine concerns. The reception desk staff was very friendly and quick, the room service was timely, valet parking staff was quick and pleasant and queries on my bill was handled professionally and without hassle. The Spa is just about the best thing at this hotel. It is a must visit for all. I had the ultimate package and my four different therapists were all great (Ask for Daniel from Sweden to do your massage). Lunch at the spa bistro was healthy but tasty (a very good combo) - do try the crab timbale and organic roasted chicken. I do not complain about prices for in-room dining or at the restaurants at hotels, because we all know they are more than usual, so there is no need to complain. There are several options around if someone does not want to eat there. My only comment is although the service at the Meritage Steakhouse (at the golf club) was good, the food wasn’t the best (it was good but certainly not in the region of the cost) try instead Capital Grille - Scottsdale or Ruth's Chris Steak House - Phoenix. I would certainly go back again and I am considering a timeshare here. Do check the usual internet sites for good package deals and/or call the hotel directly. My only complaint was that houskeeping did not replace all the items used e.g. shower cap, cotton etc. however, that was not a big issue for me.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this resort!”
Reviews.Author: poopsyhop
Reviews.Content: We cannot say enough about this resort. it was quite cold while we were there so we did not use all that it offers but the outside jacuzzi is great. The room was spacious with a very nice bathroom. Very deep tub which I like. We ate at Roy's which was fantastic. Try the lobster dumplings and the trio for the entree. I had take out from Sage which was pretty good as well. we did not have a chance to try the Italian. We also had room service which was very good. We took a day trip to Sedona which I would highly recommend. It is absolutely beautiful and charming there. The sunset by the airport is a breathtaking. It is a must do if you go. It takes about an hour and half to get there from the resort. The husband golfed at the Palmer course at Wildfire and he enjoyed it very much. The after 1 p.m. $85 rate was a real bargain. We also took advantage of the spa. The steam room was the best I have seen. Also enjoyed lunch around the very quiet spa pool. A wonderful day! We ventured to Camelback and the Phoenician but we found Desert Ridge to be newer, fresher and just had more Wow effect. We have no complaints about our time here and we'll definitley go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Setting”
Reviews.Author: RNY
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Ridge for one night in early December. It is a beautiful, well maintained resort. We weren't able to use the pools or tour the grounds because we were there during a two day heavy rain event (1.5 inches) - unusual for the desert setting. The resort is huge. The map that guests are given is one dimensional for a multi-dimensional facility. We've used maps to travel extensively but this map wasn't helpful. Even the desk clerk was confused by it and indicated the wrong wing for our room location. Since it was pouring outside we decided to use the fitness center but we never found it. The map didn't indicate how to access it and three staff members (two in suits and one in a uniform) that we asked didn't know either. One suited staff person finally told us how to get there but it was down a walkway outsde the hotel - in the pouring rain. It seemed really odd that there was no way to access the fitness center from inside the building. Adjacent to the resort is a Marriott time share facility which looks very nice. At the J.W. there are people trying to sell you a time share tour but they aren't pushy about it. The time shares have access to the J.W. restaurants and pools, although they have their own, so it could be a pleasant place to spend a week. We ate at the Tuscany Restaurant. The service and the food were excellent. The ambiance was very pleasant. It's an upscale restaurant geared toward adults. I wouldn't bring children to it. As usual at Marriott resorts, it was pricey but not outrageous and worth it for a special treat. Even with a few glitches the J.W. was a beautiful resort. If you want a big resort with lots of outdoor activities (and you think the weather will cooperate during your visit) this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice.”
Reviews.Author: goanna
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice resort. The rooms are clean and well appointed, the staff very curteous, and the outdoor surroundings are beautiful and serene. I tagged along with my husband while he attended conference meetings. It was a little too cool to swim, but the pool is gorgeous and appears to be well kept. There are lots of pleasant spots where you can sit and relax with a book and a snack. The walking/running paths are great! I attended a watercolor workshop that the hotel offers.. Wow, what a great experience. The watercolorist was a great teacher and wonderful artist! I heard from other guests that the costs of the spa treatments was a little steep. But, hey, when you are on vacation.. I ate at the breakfast buffet one morning and I didn't think it was worth the $$. It was good, but I have had much better breakfast buffets for much less. There are a lot of nice places to eat off property for breakfast.... Overall, I think it's a very nice place to stay. I would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Midnite13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Desert Ridge in mid-November. Upon arrival, we checked in and were given a room on the 6th floor overlooking the botanical gardens, golf course and distant mountains. There was a small table and two chairs on the balcony. The room was clean and we had plenty of towels for our use. The shower stall tiles were a bit slippery and uneven. The beds were comfy and we had our choice of four pillows, two each of foam and feather. The ice machine was down the hall in an enclosed area and the free laundy (including detergent) was on the 4th floor. The only suggestion I would have is a screen for the sliding glass door. Coming from New England, I would have loved to keep the screen door closed and let the desert breeze in during the night. Staff in both the shops and restaurants were accommodating and gracious. The buffet breakfast is very expensive but there is a good variety. Lunch was busy but not a long wait - about 20 minutes. I put my name in coming back from the pool and went up to the room to change. When I came back, my table was waiting. Note there is a mall around the corner from this property and the hotel offers a free shuttle bus. There are restaurants, grocery store and a CVS there. Stock up on snacks and soda at these stores. We bought a case of water at CVS for the cost of a bottle at the Marriott. The grounds are beautiful and the lazy river was relaxing. I didn't have time to try the other pools but there were only a few people in one of the four other pools. The lobby area throughout the day and night was very busy and the the downstairs lobby bar area was very noisy in the evening. As mentioned in previous reviews, this hotel caters to a lot of meetings and conventions. However, every staff member greeted us with a smile. The concierge gave us great maps - better than Hertz. There is an onsite Hertz rental car service at the hotel which we used. Book ahead of time and be prepared to wait to get your car - it was about 30-40 minutes for us to get the keys for the vehicle. Would I stay there again - maybe. Nothing wrong with this hotel but I've stayed at other properties in Phoenix/Scottsdale which I felt had better amenities for about the same cost.

Reviews.Title: “Desert Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Impsdlight
Reviews.Content: Loved it! This was one of the best resorts I've ever stayed at. The rooms are wonderfull, but the views are breathtaking. I especially enjoyed all of the water features scattered around the property. There is enough to do that you could stay on the property your entire trip. The local area has lots of attractions nearby. Everything from hiking to shopping to gambling. We had great cocktails and sushi at Roy's, even if they are a little pricey. I would highly reccomend this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly & Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: By_His_Grace
Reviews.Content: We were there for a professional meeting. We were impressed by the friendliness of the helpful staff throughout the hotel that provided us with a very enjoyable stay. We didn't have time to take part in any of the resort activities so we can't comment on them.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: chantiebelle
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely suite with for our family (including two young children) just after Thanksgiving. The grounds and facilities are absolutely beautiful and well maintained. The bedding was about the most comfortable I've ever had at a hotel, with feather pillows & duvets on the beds (and the murphy bed in the living room!). All food outlets provided outstanding food and service. Restaurants reviewed separately, although we visited all restaurants in the hotel, plus room service (which was fairly quick and yummy also). Lots of organized activities over a holiday weekend. Our six and three year old girls participated in a morning storytime with a sweet "Mother Goose" storyteller, complete with balloon animals and sweet treats. Really a highlight of our stay. Even though we stayed during the first "cold" (under 70 degree) weekend of the year, we enjoyed the pool. It was gorgeous, and the kids really enjoyed all of the wildlife that came to enjoy the environment too (bunnies, roadrunners, quail). Spa was wonderful too. Had a pretty average reflexology treatment, and a wonderful massage as part of a pretty nice (but short on lavender) Lavender body treatment. It was too bad that I could hear cars honking outside the treament room. Otherwise a lovely experience. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Category Killer”
Reviews.Author: gahlisary
Reviews.Content: Came out to Desert Ridge with my dad for a week of R&R, golf, biking, exploring, relaxing, etc... Have to say this is a wonderful resort. Beautiful facade, lobby, hallways, guestrooms and the wonderfully comfortable Marriott Revive bed. Overall place has a very upscale, stylish, new look and feeling. Have to say though that the location may be a minus. This is the extreme far north of Phoenix and about 30 mins from Camelback Road, downtown Scottsdale, and downtown Phoenix. It's more of an escape. Played the Faldo course at Wildfire which was wonderful and rented bikes from the hotel and biked up north to Cave Creek and than around some of the suburban neighborhoods. Two of the restaurants, Blue Sage and the Marketplace were closed for renovation when we where there, but I did enjoy some drinks and appetizers at Vista Lounge in the lobby. A+ place. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: spterry
Reviews.Content: We stayed @ the Desert Ridge from 10/29-11/2/07 & had a wonderful time. We have fallen in love with AZ & love it! We were treated with great respect & tremendous concern the entire time we were at Desert Ridge. The food was great! It is pricey, but part of it was convenience. It was great to order a burger by the pool & have it delivered. We wanted to treat ourselves & we certainly received it. Lots of Pros~nice room, great service, onsite free washer/dryer (don't have to pack as much!) & lots of activities. I did the early morning walk @ the Spa, was very invigorating & fun. Not the desert walk as anticipated but fun. The Spa was great, pricey, but no more than any other Resort Spa. There is oncare childcare but I would not take children here, this is a resort for adults to enjoy, very peaceful. Cons~The only complaint was a problem with connecting with the internet. It is NOT FREE, but was free @ the SpringHill Suites that I stayed at the night before???? It also worked @ S.H.Suites! It did not work in my room @ D.R., IBAHN reps indicated it was my computer that needed an updated form of software. But it work on IBAHN at the S.H. Suites & not on IBAHN @ Desert Ridge. The D.R. has many conventions/meetings. I think a real negative is the internet issue. You can't have the number of people in the hotel for business or otherwise & have internet problems. I also had "additional charges" on my bill. Because of this website, I checked my bill half way thru my stay & again the night before. I immediately contacted the desk & had the charges removed (phone calls, internet service, see above). Don't let this keep you from going to one of the most wonderful vacations I have ever had!!! The Desert Ridge is great!!! I would return in a heartbeat!!! Eat @ Roy's!! Put your feet up & enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun in Arizona”
Reviews.Author: nancyb19
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a wonderful atmosphere. The staff was friendly and helpful. The landscaping was magnificent and very peaceful. I enjoyed the overall experance. I also played a game of tennis durning my stay. It was a little over priced, but the courts where nice. The room was very cool. it had everything I needed except a fridge but it was brought to me when I asked. The pool was very nice. The lazy river was a nice touch and very relaxing. The only down side to the pool was it never got over 5' deep. Restaurant was okay.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel and spa”
Reviews.Author: Simbathebigpoodle
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is great. The rooms are nice and large. The spa is really wonderful! I spent a week at this hotel for a convention. Their convention staff is A+++ It can be a bit expensive to eat at the hotel, but you can go across the street for a short walk to an outdoor mall area with several restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel/resort”
Reviews.Author: richr000
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with first class restaurants and recreation. There is a large shopping area right across the street (including an "In and Out Burger" when you have had enough of first class dining at the hotel!!! The swimming pool area is very nice, even features a lazy river. No free high speed Internet is my only criticism about Marriott properties. There's a Starbucks in the hotel, what more could you want. I hope to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not best for young children”
Reviews.Author: nylads2
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful resort and we enjoyed time there. However, with kids 6 and 4 we never felt comfortable. The furniture in the room had sharp corners and plenty of places to pinch little fingers. There were a number of people drinking a bit too much by the lazy river late in the afternoon as well. We ended up moving to the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak where we had been the previous year and that's where we'll go from now on.

Reviews.Title: “SPA is A+...Hotel is C+”
Reviews.Author: Venturagal
Reviews.Content: Ok. I am going to try to give some traveler some tips that will be helpful. We were flying in from out of state and needed an early check in. The hotel had agreed to this prior. We arrived at the hotel at 10 am (yes..i know...early). So, the room was not ready and we were fine with this. We checked our bag in and went to the pool. The pool was not anything great. The service was below average and we finally went to the bar to get our own drinks and food. AFter that, we never saw a waitperson again (or one that would actually do something). AFter flying and laying at the pool, i checked back in with the front desk at 1 (no room), 2 (no room), etc...finally my BF was mad and talked to the manager. Apparentely my boyfriend had booked a suite and the last peope had checked out late. We downgraded to a normal room just to check in. That kind of sucked for us looking for a much needed vacation. I found there to be tons of Marriott employees who walk around and smile and act helpful...but they are NOT helpful. It is like a bunch of robots walking around with fake shells. We ordered room service that night b/c we were exhausated and needed rest. The food came in a reasonable amount of time and the staff was fine. 20% gratutity was already added to our bill so we did not feel the need to tip her twice (i know we all have different opinions on this). The staff person left our room and CALLED us, asking why we had not tipped her?? Can you imagine?? We also did not receive housecleaning during our stay which i think is a nice hotel faux pas. Here is my big tip. Go to the adjacent spa. It is the best that i have ever been to. The staff are wonderful and the deep tissue massages are to die for (ask for susana). AFter the massage, you have access to the relaxing sauna, jacuzzi, etc and it is so relaxing. The spa has it's own pool away from the hotel that is A+. Very small, cushioned chairs, excellent food/beverage service,etc. Go the spa, get a treatment and stay there! Forever. Go to Spa pool and do not look back at the crummy Marriott pool. This hotel is designed for familes and for business travelers. There are conferences going on everywhere and there is no room for just the vacationer. It is a stressful feeling and everyone is walking around with conference badges. I was not impressed by anything but the spa. However, Roy's restaurant in the hotel is good and i would eat there again. I later learned that my BF was going to propose that trip but due to all of the problems has decided to wait for a better time. I hope that tells you all something.

Reviews.Title: “what lovely views.....lacks a little for the family vacationers!!”
Reviews.Author: 5luvcaribe
Reviews.Content: Our family of five recently visited the JW for a few days upon going to our destination in Sedona. Although, the hotel is beautifully landscaped and the views are magnificent this one lacks in service and is not very family oriented. Believe the reviews when people say this is geared more towards the business travelers with alot of conferences going on. It made it hard to feel relaxed with all those corporate badges and people always doing business. The hotel definitely caters to this and these people get the better service. They being the business people also look at you like what are you doing bringing your small children here to vacation? What made a difference in our stay was that they do have a nice lazy river for children with a slide and my boys also enjoyed the basketball nets at the other pools. Also, we ate at Roy's on our final night and they truly were wonderful! Kudos to their staff and their food was excellent. Thank you Roy's for letting us end the trip on a remarkable note! Be aware also that this is supposed to be a JW and the linens are not the best. Although, the room was clean the linens were awful (most of the towels were not very white but dingy gray and the bed sheets were worn with even little tears). We went to the breakfast at Blue Sage one morning...I was very irritated that the table was not clean and that the chairs were not wiped . The booster seat they gave my daughter was disgusting also. I hate to be picky but you can get this at an IHOP......and this is a JW! Do yourself a favor and if you are a family try the Camelback they are so much more service oriented and it has a much better feel for families. We have stayed at alot of Marriott's top resorts and also Ritz's and we were a little disappointed with this one. We will definitely go back to the Camelback with our next travels to the Phoenix/Scottsdale area and by the way, if your travels take you to Sedona don't hesitate to stay at the Enchantment /Mii Spa Resort this is truly a fantastic resort and you will be amazed at the views!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent once again”
Reviews.Author: kayleigh_k
Reviews.Content: Never fails to deliver each time I have stayed. Apart from some building work - my stay was faultless. The service was excellent - a little bit slow around the pool at the weekend - had to wait a full 90 mins between offers to get me a drink (ended up going to the bar myself). Rooms were as clean and very comfy - putting white bed clothes on the bed always gives me confidence. They have removed the PC's from the rooms which I really liked - please bring them back - they allowed cheap and easy access to the net - the price charged by Fedex (40c per min) was high in my view. The three pools is an excellent idea - the kids tend to gather around the big one - leaving the other two a bit quieter for those wanting to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Great, with one important exception...”
Reviews.Author: feelnopain
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a professional and conference and generally enjoyed the experience. Rooms were nice, comfortable, with spacious bathrooms and I suspect there isn't a bad view in the place. Pool area was fantastic and not at all crowded. On site dining was excellent, although the lobby bar was absurdly overpriced. The conference facilities and food presentations were also excellent. The only issue was in service, particularly the disconnect between a remarkably responsive front desk and an apathetic housekeeping staff. The room got cleaned, but the attention to detail that you would expect at a resort of this calibe (or lower) was lacking. When I checked in, the clock on my nightstand was missing and one of the bedsheets was torn -- not anything to ruin the trip, but certainly annoying when you arrive late at night after a delayed flight and have to wait for the front desk to send up an alarm clock so you don't sleep through an early morning meeting.
