Throughout the stay, little details were always missed like removing the used towels but not replacing them or forgetting to empty the ice bucket. I admit that this are minor, but if you want to claim to be a five-star resort were guest can relax and unwind, they shouldn't have to deal with these annoyances.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful facility and overall experience!”
Reviews.Author: Gus_Sanchez
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the JW Desert Ridge Spa and Resort. The hotel is magnificent! The on-premises "lazy river" was on par with anything you'd find at a commercial water park (except much better - just a short walk from your hotel room). The service was really good. The only reason I hesitated in a 5-star rating is that we had a few housekeeping issues (conditioner vs. hand lotion). Unfortunately, the cleaning crew put a bottle of hand lotion in the shower and my wife used a glob of it on her hair! We had a few calls with management but they followed up and we resolved the issue amicably. Then, the next day, we had a few more, minor issues with towels, etc.. Again, we spoke with management and resolved the issue. - I'm not usually a nitpicker or complainer, but these little things, when added up, can be quite annoying. Anyway, that's the only reason I held off on the 5-stars. Otherwise, the staff was extremely friendly, pleasant and helpful. I used the "Vacation Planner" services, ahead of my stay, for booking a Grand Canyon tour with DeTours.Com. Which, by the way, was an awesome experience! Highly recommended! A bit more pricey (for a family of 4) than renting a car and going about it yourself, but, believe me, it's a bit of a haul, and you won't come anywhere close to the entertainment and learning value of going with an experienced guide. In our case, that was "Bernie". He was great. We were also convinced to take the Maverick helicopter tour over/inside the canyon. That was an additional $232 per head and not an expense I had planned - but, again, highly recommended! - Anyway, the free vacation planning service offered by the resort was great! Use it! I also used the "matching" services of the Tennis Center, to find either other guests or local/community residents for a game. They found me a great partner from the community. Unfortunately, for me, I had to stop playing after the first set. The Pheonix sun was simply too much to be reckoned with (and this was at 8am)! Though I was keeping hydrated, I felt I was simply overheating. Didn't want to risk having to leave the resort in an ambulance ;-) I think evening play would have been a better choice (or at least doubles, where you don't have to work as hard). As you may have read in other posts, the food was kind of pricey. But, the phrase "you get what you pay for" does apply. The $12 Cobb salad could easily serve 3-4 people. The $10 Kokopelli Colada was extremely tasty and plentiful. I had breakfast at the Blue Sage restaurant on my first day and took advantage of the $21 buffet. Everything was absolutely delicious! Other days, we simply bought bagels or breakfast pasteries at either Starbucks (on premises) or the little counter outside Blue Sage. That wasn't so bad (pricey). I did not have dinner at any of the hotel restaurants, but, my friend (who was attending a trade show there) did have dinner at Roy's with a client. He absolutely LOVED his dinner there and highly recommends the restaurant. Finally, having read other readers' posts, I went ahead and booked a limo for our trip to/from the airport. As opposed to using SuperShuttle at $20/head ($80 in my case for a family of 4), I conducted an Internet search and chose "First Class Executive Limo" due to their (Barry's) quick and personal response. The experience was excellent! My kids were impressed with the driver holding up our name as we arrived at the airport (which, by the way, was about 90 minutes later than planned). The driver, Mary, was very friendly and patient. The car was a 2007 Town Car - spotlessly clean and absolutely beautiful! Barry kept all my charges on the credit card, including gratuity, and I didn't have to deal with having correct change, etc. It certainly was a "first class" experience at an almost 20% savings in cost! What can I say. This was, absolutely, the best facility in which I've stayed/vacationed. I don't normally like to vacation in the same spots (variety is the spice of life) but, believe you me, if I come back to the Phoenix/Scottsdale/Sedona area, I would absolutely return to the JW Desert Ridge! If anyone has any questions feel free to write me. Happy trails!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Dancer30
Reviews.Content: From the moment we entered the lobby, we were greeted and made to feel special. Our Room overlooked the Golf Course, was very clean, spacious bathroom with nice products. Evening maid service turned down the bedding and selected romantic music on the radio at at the side of the bed. Nice touch. The pools were superb, lazy river a great treat. Plenty of towels and Iced water at the side of the pools. We loved the vita lounge in the evenings with live entertainment, patio with mist to keep you cool in the heat- very hot. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff. We ate in Blue Sage and Roys very nice. Free shuttle from the lobby to take you over to the Desert Ridge Marketplace with plenty of restaurants and shops. We loved this resort and will definately go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic beds, good food”
Reviews.Author: DCKathy
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel. Service was terrific. The beds are wonderful: very soft featherbeds that I could just sink into and not want to leave. The food at Roys was very good, especially the Disassembled Banana Pie dessert. It's a little far from downtown, but it's right next to a mall, which expands the food options to some more basic, less expensive places, like BJ's and an Asian Bistro. There's also a lovely wave pool with innertubes for floating. It's a very big place; so there's lots of walking to get from one side to another. I'd love to come back and see the spa and try that. My only complaint is that a hotel of this size should have more than two computers in the business center, which was run by FedEx Kinko's. At 40 cents a minute, surely they'd recover the cost in a month. While the gift shop is terrific, I think they can expand the business center a little into the gift shop and add a computer or two. It's very frustrating to have to wait to get on a computer when a big convention is going on.

Reviews.Title: “Check Your Bill”
Reviews.Author: Glenn39
Reviews.Content: Nice grounds, enjoyable stay, but you MUST check your bill before leaving the hotel. I was on a package which gave me $100 in resort credit (food, golf, tennis...) and when I went to check out on the hotel's video checkout, the credit was not there. I called the front desk, and the agent REFUSED to credit my account. I was told that I must personally go to the front desk and ask for the credit; otherwise I would not be receiving it. I felt like I was a victim of fraud. I was entitled to the credit. I talked to two different people about this, and the response was the same. Apparently this hotel wants its guests to beg for what they are entitled to. Marriott needs to change its policy. Also, if Marriott wants its JW brand to be considered top-of-the-line, it should deliver newspapers to the rooms on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag...”
Reviews.Author: BBAZTempe
Reviews.Content: We like to take 'local' trips every year, and we enjoy water parks. We normally stay at the Pointe South Mountain. As they are going through a remodel, we decided to stay somewhere new. We selected the JW Desert Ridge Marriott, as it has a lazy river attraction (which we really enjoy). The trip had highs and lows. Highs: * quick check in * VERY friendly and customer oriented staff - EVERYONE on the property was helpful and friendly. Probably the best customer orientated staff I have ever seen * Excellent on site food. The Blue Sage was great for dinner, and the breakfast buffet, while pricey at $21, offered some of the best tasting food we have had. * At your service. This 24 hour line offered quick support on our needs - no room directory in the room, getting internet access, correcting some errors in our bill, issues with our pay per view TV. * Plenty of pool chairs with pitchers of ice water everywhere Lows: * Pay per view movies didn't work. Engineer spent over 1 1/2 hours to try to fix the first night, but couldn't get it fixed until the next day. * Lazy river - closed the first day due to a storm. Once opened, it was nice, but not as nice as the Pointe. Mixed: * The room was 'ok'. Nothing special * The heavenly beds got mixed reviews. As my husband is big, my stepdaughter and I shared one bed, while he had the other. He said it was the best hotel bed he EVER slept in. We hated it! We both woke with stiff necks and backs. * A bit more pricey than some of the other local resorts While we had a good time, I'm not sure we would return. The water features were good, but not comparable to the Pointe South Mountain.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: beachiemom
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this resort! I stayed here w/my two daughters (ages 11 and 12) and my husband. It is beautiful! The service was wonderful, the pools were great, especially the "lazy river"! Service and food were very good. The room was very comfortable and our view was incredible! I wish we could have stayed longer. I would definitely return! Location was very convenient to shopping and entertainment right down the road!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful property, service is mediocre”
Reviews.Author: Betsy099
Reviews.Content: Our family, which includes my husband and me, a 17 yr-old daughter and 13-year old son, stayed at the J.W. Desert Ridge on our way home from the Grand Canyon to relax for one night before our flight home. We chose this hotel because of the numerous pools on the property. Unfortunately, when we arrived the pool was closed due to weather (some wind and a slightly dark sky) The pool later opened but the lazy river and all outside services remained closed. We were disappointed in that there was no casual restaurant on the property. We settled for Blue Sage, which was serving a a greek buffet. The food was good, but we were looking for a sandwich menu and did not want to leave the property for dinner. After dinner we sat at an outdoor sitting/bar area, but were never approached by a waiter, so we left. The lobby and pool area are very spacious and beautiful. Rooms and bathrooms are newly decorated and comfortable. The beds were very soft and made-up with warm, heavy comforters--not a good choice when the temperature is 115 outside! The hotel caters to weddings and conventions. We enjoyed our one-night stay, but were disappointed in the service.

Reviews.Title: “A nice Marriott!”
Reviews.Author: mel.w
Reviews.Content: We have recently stayed at this hotel- first time visitors to this particular Marriott -and found it most impressive. One thing that immediately struck - this is a LARGE hotel- much more so that suggested by websites etc. Whilst we were there - mid June - it was busy throughout, and seemed to have a mixture of business and leisure guests, although it was obvious that it is heavily used and promoted for business users. Rooms were very pleasant - all had balconies - and nicely decorated, if just a little lacking in table/ storage space -no drawers of any consequence, and one large table. A minor matter that caused no inconvienience tho. The bed was superb - extremely comfortable. Bathroom amenities/ turndown service/ housekeeping all of high standard. The pool areas, as discussed within this forum, are without doubt, the highlight of the property. No problems in finding lounger space- even tho the hotel was full. We only ate at tthe Blue Sage for breakfast, and had no complaints there. As seems to be common with a lot of Marriott properties, there is the usual "time-share" / condo sell, with representatives and desks evident - even messages left on the phone to "come down and see us" ! As stated - this is a large hotel, as a consequence, lots of car parking space required - be aware, it is a good 5-10 minute walk from parking the car to getting in the hotel, although there were some eager valets available should you wish. Overall- I was more than happy to have chosen Desert Ridge, with no substantial complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Review from a Convention Attendee”
Reviews.Author: SDTraveler1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for a Convention (size: 600 people). Pay the $25 to valet park your car...the free parking lot is quite a hike in the heat. The hotel appears to be less than 5 years old, up to date, and well-appointed. The lobby is beautiful with water fountians that add much-needed moisture to the dry desert air. I loved the complimentary ice water and iced tea in the lobby - it was great after arriving from the heat outside. Check in was easy and the front desk staff were pleasant. All requests made via phone to the "Marriott at Your Service" desk were met promptly and accurately. (I requested additional face cloths and hangers). The "Marriott at Your Service" staff made follow-up calls to my room to ensure my requests had been adequately satisfied - a nice touch! My room had 2 beds because a King room was not available at the time I made my reservation. I moved to a King room for the last night of my stay. The King room is the same size as the double, but with more room to move around in due to there being one less bed. Both of my rooms faced out towards the "Lazy River" and pool, but the windows/walls were thick enough that I couldn't hear noise from those enjoying themselves outside. The bathroom was stocked with nice "upgraded" Artifact toilietries, not the usual Marriott items. The bathroom was pretty, but strange in that it had a small, glass-enclosed stand-up shower with separate bathtub. This was a meaningful detail to me because it is next to impossible to shave your legs in the shower...no place to put your foot up. The bathroom also had a strange absence of towel bars. My least favorite thing about the room was the fact that the carpet left my bare feet dirty, even though it looked clean. Yuck! The convention rooms were nice and it was fabulous to have a Starbucks on the property. I didn't get a chance to enjoy the Lazy River, but I heard lots of good things about it. My biggest complaint about this property was that it was very understaffed at a time when there were more than 3 conventions going on at the same time, especially in the evenings. For example, there was only one cocktail server working in the lobby lounge (at times there were more than 50 guests in the lounge) in the evenings and she nastily told everyone who arrived to "get in line at the bar". The line at the bar was so long that it took a minimum of 25 minutes to get a drink. The hotel has a complimentary shuttle that runs every 30 minutes to the shopping center across the street. In the 110+ degree heat, we were glad we didn't have to walk over. I ate lunch at the Blue Sage (very good chicken quesadilla prepared the "traditional" way our server suggested, not the strange inside-out way described on the menu). We also had brunch at the Blue Sage on Sunday. The brunch buffet was a zoo, so we ordered off the menu. When our items took more than a 20 minutes to arrive, our server suggested that we get some fruit from the buffet to enjoy until our entrees arrived. This hotel has the potential to be a 4 star hotel, if they improve the consistency of their service.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelivable”
Reviews.Author: MelTheBee
Reviews.Content: This place deserves the 5 star rating more than any other. It was gorgeous, immaculate. The staff were almost a little scary in how attentive they were (only because I'm not used to good service I guess). We came with a company function so maybe I'd be a bit more critical if I had to pay the $500 per night. There's really not much to critisize. The pool scene was amazing. We did so much floating down the lazy river pool in those inner tubes with drinks in our hands, it was paradise!!! The room was gorgeous. Overall, I was impressed with everything about this hotel. The location isn't very central though if you plan on being able to get around quickly. Other than that, it was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “great resort for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: ajh169
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several resorts in the Phoneix area, but I think this one is my new favorite. The lobby is spacious and inviting--the perfect place to share a conversation or a drink, or relax and read on a couch. All of the staff were kind and generous, and the rooms were clean and decent sized with balconies and bright and spacious bathrooms. The rooms were pretty quiet, and the beds were comfortable. The conference facilities were very nice, as was the pool, lazy river, and spa. I think I like the spa facilities at the Phonecian better, but the services here at the Revive spa were superior. All of the food was good (especially Roy's and room service), but it was difficult to get vegetarian fare, and service at the Blue Sage restaurant was hit or miss. Still, I had a great stay and plan on returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Conference Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alexk50
Reviews.Content: Stayed June 24 to June 27 for a conference. The rooms were large and clean. All had a balcony. The service was great except for Blue Sage where the service was horrible, not one order was correct. The common areas were beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything but Roy's”
Reviews.Author: Summer1982
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the the hotel last week June 14 to the 19th. Everything was perfect with the hotel service - everything that you expect from a JW. Our conciege , Kelcey, made every dinner and spa reservation for us helping us out tremendously. I had even ordered a cheese platter to be delievered after we checked into our room and it was delievered as promised. The pool staff was great and kept the guests cool with iced towels and popcicles. The main pool and lazy river were crowded with children but the middle lap pool was empty and the water was kept very cool. As for the restaurants- Tuscany was by far the best. The service there was first class and our every need was attended. Our server Claudio was very knowledgeable and friendly. The head server Bajham was so nice and made great conversation and helped us create the perfect meal with his reccommendations. On Fathers day we had made a reservations at Roys. We arrived 20 minutes early for our 730 reservations and saw that there were empty tables on the patio. I went inside to speak to the manager, Myles, and asked if there was any chance to eat outside and I was told we needed to make a reservation in advance for the patio. I told him that we are platinum members of marriott and our concierge had not informed us that we needed to do so. Myles said to me-" I dont care who you are. Your status means nothing here. We just pay rent to Marriott" We were so offended that we left and headed back to Tuscany. We walked into Tuscany and they knew our name, welcomed us back, and set up a table outside for us. We were sat in five minutes with no reservations. I would definately reccommend this hotel...but stay away from Roys.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: terravisum
Reviews.Content: Arriving around 11AM way before the check-in time, I was patiently waited by the bellboy while the cab driver struggled with my credit card. My suitcase was quickly taken and I was shown to the front-desk where my room key was given to me. The check-in agent goes to great length to give me details to the special offers for the Marriott Rewards Guest members. I checked into my double beds room as there was no King bed room available. The checked-in agent did offer me a King bed room if I was willing to wait for a while but I was too tired and just wanted a room to rest. I called the in-room dining and it was delivered within 20 minutes to my room. I was impressed and the burger was pretty good too. The double beds makes the room a bit tighter than it should be. The bed was quite comfortable and on the soft side. The walk-in bathroom with separate bathtub and shower that can fit two persons with room to spare. The amenities are not the standard Marriott fares but under the Archive name, pretty decent quality too. The hotel is on a huge land with 2 golf courses, a few pools to cool off that Arizona heat. There is a nice mall, Desert Ridge that is in front of the hotel premises although it is a nice 10 minutes walk to get there. There are a few decent restaurants on-site with good price for a hotel restaurant. The only exception that I would say is the Tuscany restaurant. It does not worth the money. There are a real Starbucks in the hotel lobby not the usual Marriott's Starbucks kiosk but an actual Starbucks. I was pretty impressed by the level of service of the JW Marriott. It is certainly above the usual service standard of the U.S. hotels that I have stayed. I once dropped my Starbucks latter in the lobby, entirely my fault, but the manager brought me to the Starbucks and ask the barristas there make me a new one without charge. This is the first U.S. hotel that I would consider giving a 5 stars for service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property Caters to Conventions/Special Events”
Reviews.Author: LaCoop
Reviews.Content: We shared this Spring Vacation with another couple, both having experienced the JW Marriott Camelback Inn and Renesaience in Scottsdale in the past 2 years. After reviewing this property online, and knowing Marriott's trademark of exceptional service we were looking forward to our 5 day stay at this fairly new property. Both couples stayed in Standard King rooms at $549 per night. Upon Thursday afternoon check in, our room was on the 3rd floor, directly above the main driveway/valet enterence. With this rate, the noise and traffic which included 3 buses were a surprise. The bellboy was assuring us these were the last bus arrivals for the day. As he spoke, 2 more could be seen approaching. Our request for another room was not immediately remedied, but an hour later we were told we could move, but we would be very far from each other. We still agreed after realizing the distance was most extreme! There are 950 rooms here so we were off to Egypt on our own, no offer of assistance. We laughed this off as glad to have the opportunity to be removed from the driveway noise and fumes. Later we met our friends in the huge and most beautiful lobby and waited forever on the patio to be acknowledged and served drinks. We decided to move inside and found a spot near the bar so our husbands could serve us rather than die on the vine. The people watching was fabulous tho- Obviously lots going on. A reception was queing up before entering their poolside designation. We noticed an entire outdoor common area had been roped off- and this was the beginning of how things were going to go - removing pool areas, lawn areas, patio areas for convention meals, receptions, MLB club members and special events. The "vacationer's" space got smaller and smaller as the weekend proceeded. All the pool's furniture filled up in the early morning either with bodies or "saved" with books and towels. Poolside service was very stressed, and there were long waits to order- and to receive orders. We watched as other guests lost patience and learned that the management had no time for regular duties as they followed up with personal apologies. I have no idea why they were so short-staffed, as the complex is designed to serve the masses. Perhaps that is the downfall, as the staff did not seem to enjoy or handle their positions under stress and there is no excuse for runnng it understaffed. We dined at Tuscany, it was fabulous and here the staff knew how to treat and please their guests and allowed us to feel like we were in Europe where it is impolite to hurry the guest along or present an unrequested check. This was our favorite meal of the entire trip! Roy's was a great environment, on patio outside. The food was also good but you will have to pay to get any amount of it, salads and accompaniments are separate. Their location is more visual to the "hotel masses" and here we knew that our table was "scheduled" for another reservation behind us. Reservations are a must, suggest later dining to avoid being rushed. The onsite Starbuck's had huge lines all mornings and usually ran out of breakfast items and popular ingredients before we got up. The hotel was full the entire time we were there, not just the weekend. We went to the spa on 2 different days: peds and manis on one visit, maggages the other. Never have we paid more for salon services, but were happy to have the use of the spa included which isn't always the norm for pedi/mani services. The massages were excellent but construction was underway next to the pool, tractors and alot of dirt and dust aloft along with the noise. There are many spas in the Phoenix area and this one dosen't come close to the atmosphere or relaxation available at JW Marriott's Camelback Inn - there is where you will find spa bliss! Our husbands golfed on site - very expensive for the quality - they are used to the Trune courses in Arizona and there is no comparrison except in fees. We were certainly paying enough and know what the resort experience should be. After a few days of not being treated as JW Marriott guest's reputation holds, we managed to get rooms in JW's nearby "real resort" Camelback Inn. This property is much older and smaller - but if you are expecting service and an relaxing atmosphere you will be treated as the most important guest that you deserve to be and would expect when staying at a resort. The Desert Ridge is a Convention Complex. All the amenities are a huge bonus and a great addition to the convention experience, resulting in positive reviews from the business traveler, and a huge dissappointment to the vacationeer! I shouldn't close without mentioning the middle of the night fire drill. The continued blaring sirens emptied bathrobed guests into hallways. I felt horrible for the parents of wailing children but the worst of it was that there was no communication. Remember, our rooms were at the farthest point, Egypt, and it was a hike with and without use of elevators towards the lobby. Since this turned out to be a false alarm it was unfortunate that staff did not send runners or use the PA system to explain the situation. They did record and deliver a phone message hours later that blamed the incident on a guest, suggesting that he was drunk in the bar and pulled down on an alarm. I don't like to quote over used phrases, but when we left the Desert Ridge I said to my friend, "Been here, Done that, Won't be back."

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: StarBellySneetch
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, we noticed that the parking lot was located kind of far away, but decided to just deal with it and make the long treck to our room. It was probably smart of us to do this, because we noticed that the valet people act like vultures if you park your car even for just a minute in front of the lobby entrance. They come over to your car right away and pester you to use the valet service. We ended up doing this one night after returning from dinner, and it was a big mistake. They charge close to $25 a day for valet service, not including tip; and the valet guys (there were two of them when we pulled up) were all over us for tips, I found that to be kind of annoying. Other than the valet though, I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Everything was really clean, and the hotel grounds were really nice. The room itself was great. The pool area was nice, and I enjoyed the lazy river. I also liked that they had a starbucks on site. My only other complaint besides the valet, would be that I noticed there were a lot of people staying there for business. This bothered me, because when I go on vacation, I don't want to look at people walking around in business attire, talking to each other about business stuff; the whole reason why I'm on vacation is to escape that kind of atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this resort”
Reviews.Author: slettva
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May for a conference and were very pleased with the resort. The spa was great, the golf course was fantastic, and the staff were some of the friendliest we have ever met. The room was spacious and had a separate shower and tub and all the rooms have balconies. Our room overlooked the pool area, which contains several different pools and a lazy river. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Memorial Day Worth Remebering”
Reviews.Author: averagefamilyguy
Reviews.Content: We had a good time here. Most of the positive reivews below are true The staff was friendly and would usually greet you or make eye contact with you if you passed by them. The hotel was well staffed during our stay over the Memorial Day Wkend. Everything was clean - very clean. The pools were great and not too crowded. There were ample activities for the kids and adults alike. We had an easy time getting a table at Roy's and the Breakfast buffett. Pool service was also very good and well staffed. We got our drinks and food FAST. The bad? Well, our 2 year old almost fell through the balcony even as we supervised. We were 5 stories up. There was enough open space between our balcony and the room next to us to allow him to slip through. I mentioned this to the hotel staff and was told they would make management aware. Be sure to check your balcony if you had kids. This 1/2 hour from downtown Phoenix and closer to the Scottsdale area. Easy drive to Talisen West. We'd consider going back. .

Reviews.Title: “Best Christmas gift ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Burg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from this JW as a Christmas gift we had given ourselves. We enjoyed this place so much, we hope to return again in August with our kids. We booked an executive suite package that included the "Cloud Room." Since we did not bring our teenagers on this trip, our daily visits to the Cloud Room were greatly appreciated as it was a holiday weekend and there was no shortage of children of every age here. Everyone was especially helpful here. We thoroughly enjoyed getting ideas and tips from Elizabeth, Concierge at the Cloud room and reviewing our day's events with Sharon in the evening. These two women helped make our weekend exceptional. The most appreciated advice was to use the spa pool since no children were allowed. We enjoyed everything about this weekend: the room, the service, the food, etc. We ate at the steakhouse and our only wish was that they would have offered smaller portions. We hope to receive the same gift next year.

Reviews.Title: “Superb stay at the JW Marriott Desert Ridge”
Reviews.Author: Mike89
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a great Memorial weekend getaway. On every level this hotel scored an "A" in my opinion. I was immediately impressed by the quick check in and friendly staff. For instance upon entering my room I noticed a problem with the a/c. No worries, the staff quickly found me another room, sent up a bellman to move my luggage and to deliver my new keys all within 10 minutes. Oh and the room we got had an amazing view of the pool and golf courses. The staff also did a lot of little things you typically don't see at resorts these days. For example at the pool, employees handed out pitchers of ice water, iced towels, freeze pops, etc, etc. Hmmm, I didn't receive any ot these things on a recent stay at the Ritz Carlton in Maui! The concierge was knowledgeable, accessible and very accommodating. The rooms were always spotless and tended to multiple times per day. The bathrooms were what you would expect a 4plus star hotel to have.The balcony was clean and spacious enough to stretch out a bit. The ability to print your boarding pass in the lobby....huge plus. Starbucks on site need I say more? The golf courses although a little brown from the weather still top notch. If I were to have one complaint it would be the lack of an adult only pool. There are 5 pools on site and all of them were filled with screaming kids. Unless you're by one of the fountains you won't receive a lot of quiet time. Overall a fabulous experience...

Reviews.Title: “Girlfriend getaway weekend”
Reviews.Author: TaraBB
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 days at this property and after reading the rest of the reviews both before and after I went, they are all pretty true on what is good/bad. 6 mos. ago we stayed at the JW on Capri, Italy and it was head and shoulders above this JW in Scottsdale. Scottsdale rooms werent as dreamy and staff was not as polished...RUDE concierge lady that name begins with a C...staff waiting around too obviously for tips, and check-in and spa staff not very professional. Speaking of spa, I'm used to spa prices and everything was a smidge overpriced....even for a fancy resort....after the20% mandatory tip, a pedicure is $105??? wow, $10 per toe. Scrub and wrap combo was a good bang for the buck but massage seemed to be given by a newbie....Same with Roy's- I have eaten at 2 diff. Roy's locations and this staff was not up to par at all...food was excellent as always though. It seemed much of staff might have been college students on break for the summer or ?? Huge convention while we were there but not bothersome at all. Pools were awesome and lazy river was nice even for adults.... While we were expecting it to be HOT in May, it was 102....pitchers of ice water by the pool and lobby were nice ...cement and stone by the pool scorching your bare feet- not nice. Pluses of the property is that the food at ALL of the restaurants on site was wonderful-we tried them all. Room service, too. Mini bar prices were actually fairly reasonable for a property like this. Live music and patio area were perfect and drink prices were average. It was a nice relaxing weekend for a decent price (for room)and almost everything went well, but if youre paying for the details to be taken care of at a fancy schmancy place like this, you want all the i's to be dotted and t's to be crossed....service just needs more "polishing".

Reviews.Title: “Unreal Experience”
Reviews.Author: NaptownTraveler
Reviews.Content: You know that commercial where the weary business traveler goes to check in and the first thing the front desk does is say, "I'm sorry, it appears we have overbooked your room. We have another room it is on a different floor," and the exhausted and exasperated guy says, "Fine," and the next scene is him walking into the type of suite in "Ocean's Twelve"? You know the kind of suite you picture Julia Roberts getting? Weeeeellllll.... That's not exactly what happened to us. Okay, that's exactly what happened. We got the most pimped out suite I had ever seen! We really did not expect much because we had gotten a time share presentation invitation from Northwest WorldPerks. My wife and I were considering a timeshare, and maybe a temporary relocation to the PHX area for a year (while a friend rented our house from us, our jobs are in demand anywhere in the US, and thus our friend indirectly pays for PHX apartment), so we were intrigued, but we did not expect much for $75/night. Well it turned out after our "Great AZ Road Trip," which I chronicled under my review of the Comfort Inn Camp Verde, I was actually prepared to pay big $$$ for an upgrade. After all it was our third anniversary and I wanted to live how the other half does, at least for a few days. Well did not have to shell out for the upgrade thanks to the large Honeywell conference that took about 99.4 percent of the hotel and bumped me into a suite. Now this was no ordinary suite... Noooooo. We walk into gleaming marble foyer, with the most detailed closet with ample drawer space and plush robes. On the left is the bathroom with: Double vanity; Everything you could think to need in little baskets underneath on the shelves; A completely marble tub and seperate marble shower big enough for two and surrounded by glass; Seperate powder room with a phone in it!!!!; And marble that goes 3/4 up all the walls. Go past the bathroom and into the room (that was at least two regular Marriott suites in one) and there was: A huge TV with a nice interactive menu hidden in the TV armoire; Two bookshelves with actual books I would want to read (of course JW Marriott's book was there as well); Two leather "Lazy boy" chairs; Leather couch: Solid wood desk with a computer and internet; Large dining/board room table with eight chairs; Large wet bar (about double the size of most hotel wet bars); Mini-fridge (always how you get in my book of favorites): Safe; And king-size Murphy Bed with memory foam mattress with soft white linens. The wife and I laughed ourselves silly for about two hours and called everyone we knew. Mind you we're on vacation and people are wondering why were calling them so late (PHX was three hours behind at that time because it was Indpls's first year on EDT.) Then we got scared that they might make us move, but that never happened. They probably wouldn't but we left our do not disturb sign out 24/7 just in case. I experienced nothing but first class service while there, but then again, I wasn't really trying to get much other than a tan and tall drink. Ate in the steak restaurant once and service was above average. Expensive pool side drinks, but convenient and very tasty... er, effective! Time share presentation was very pleasant until they told me that unless I write a check for $X,0000 right then, I'd have to finance through them to buy... and the interest is 14.9%! Are you kidding me?!?! I could've bought it at 0.9% on my MC right then, but they don't take plastic. Dumb. Killed it right there and we were going to buy one. He did give us a $100 Marriott certificate though - applied it to a free steak dinner in one of their five restaurants! I had a very good filet, but it's not Sullivans. Scenery is 2nd to none. Our room overlooked a courtyard full of wonderful vegetation. My wife enjoyed here morning strolls before it got above 90 degrees. If I was an advid golfer there is no way I would miss a few rounds out here. Especially since you can sometimes get the Jack Rabbits to go after your partners ball. The only way this place would be better is if it was in Sedona, but you wouldn't want this place there because it would make Sedona too commercialized. The hotel was full of people bt did not feel crowded. The main guests with the deep pockets were Honeywell, but unlike some of the other reviews, I did not feel ignored. Housekeeping to valet, to regular attendants were courteous and acknowledged me before I had even made eye contact sometimes. The gentlman working at FedEx Kinkos was gracious enough to waive the internet fee because I was just on for literally two minutes. I think it would cost him more in his time to ring up 78 cents. Parking is a nice walk across some HOT blacktop, but I will take 115 degree heat over Indiana winter anyday. Water is something that is sold everywhere here so you're thirst is not far from relief but make sure that you are drinking water BEFORE you are thirsty. A smart tip is to go the grocery store in the shopping area across from the resort and just get a twenty four case of water. You will even appreciate warm water when it's 115 Farenheit. Pools are exceptional, but get towels early or bring your own. When I was there they were asking for hotel keys for towels, which is smart because there seemed to be some locals there who probably are not paying for these amenities. The place is so large there is not much that staff could do to keep them out. Did not utilize the spa, but definitely considered it seriously. Did a lot of exploring of PHX. Old Town Scottsdale is great. They are still building around Scottsdale and the free bus service is great, especially if you want to find a free place to park and then ride around town to several points including Scottsdale's amazing mall! The only other place I though to compare is the mall near Waikiki, but Scottsdale's mall was indoors and Hawaii's mall outdoors. Lot's of great mom and pop restaurants in Old Town Scottsdale. Wanted to try them all! Overall, I had the most enchanting experience in PHX and the JW Marriott was the crowning jewel. I hope to go back several times over my lifetime. Maybe one day I will retire there at the ripe old age of 51. Hmmm... Early retirement plan...Maybe I could be Ocean's Thirteenth - Doh! Too late.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!”
Reviews.Author: akamommy2
Reviews.Content: This resort was AMAZING!!! I have never seen anything like it. Of course, this was my first resort experience, but still, I can imagine that it is one of the best. The rooms were very clean. We had a beautiful balcony that overlooked beautiful scenery. Overall, it was a romantic and fun experience!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: albison23
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort. Snotty, rude staff. Check in: Rude staff. Requested king bed twice. Did not receive. Husband put my name on the reservation to arrive on my own, was not on reservation, had to wait for him to arrive over an hour later. Guest parking FAR away, valet = $20 a day. Room: Nice room, it seemed as if someone was ALWAYS vacuuming outside our door! Comfy beds, upgraded linens, NICE bathroom amenities. Room service available 24 hrs a day (I believe) Grounds: much of the pool was closed, but what was open was heated (we were there in the winter, so that was a nice option) Decorated tastefully for Christmas. Event: Went for my husbands yearly work party (1,000+ people!) Event was great, staff for the event was great. Open bar staff was very nice. After event ended, resort had pay bars open in the lounge which kept guests happy. Of course, everything was overpriced, but that is to be expected : ) Check out: Same rude lady. Charged us incorrectly. Gave us someone else's bill. Not apologetic. So rude, I would NOT return to this resort. Close to Desert Ridge shopping and resturants, but area is too big and roads could not handle the traffic. Not walking distrance to anything. Overall, beautiful resort, rude snotty people. Would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the JW Marriott”
Reviews.Author: want2getaway
Reviews.Content: We loved our 3 day stay at the this Resort. It is a lovely property, very large and spread out. The rooms were large, very clean and the bathroom was well appointed. No problems with the service but nothing outstanding to report either. We had room service for breakfast each morning. The breakfasts were wonderful in taste and presentation and service was good. Lunches at the restaurant on site as well as the cafe in the spa were both enjoyable. We both had massages at the spa and they were very nice. Since this is such a large property we liked that we had many choices of seating during the day. One day we enjoyed the afternoon by the smaller pool area behind the spa, very quiet and adult oriented, another day we sat poolside by the main pool, very busy but nice and another day we sat reading by the restaurant outside the lobby area. The lazy river would be enjoyed by my kids if we return to this property. The only down side would be if you are looking for personal service, this is such a large resort and property that it loses that personal touch of other 5 star resorts like a Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons. We did not leave the resort but understood from others that it is a drive to get anywhere. Overall, I would recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Desert Ridge- Convention Hell”
Reviews.Author: traveler3311
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted to treat our senior in high school with a special experience for Spring Break so we booked rooms at the JW Desert Ridge for post Easter. We had been there before so we thought we knew what to expect. The biggest problem we had was the hotel was overrun with convention folks. Hot tubs,pool decks,all day set ups were what we experienced for 2 of the 4 days we were there. Rooms are nothing special and neither is service or food at the pool. Slow and expensive would be fair to say. When I expressed this feedback to a senior manager of the property I was told that they cater to business travelers not family travel..The comments were not in line with the caring environment of the empolyees who work hard to be nice. I was left to feel that I was not important to the overall success of the operation. This is direct conflict with Mr Marriott's book and philosophies and I found that odd enough that I had to express it in this format. We wont go back to this property and I was planning to but a time share across the street for 2 week in prime time..but no reason to now that I know they focus their efforts in a way that I am not comfortable with. I am not naive to think business travel is not important to any hotel's livlehood...but if I want to be around drunk conventioners when I am with my family..I would book a lessor expensive place.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: tiger12896
Reviews.Content: I took my girlfriend there for our three year anniversary, and also to propose to her. I only made the reservation two weeks in advance, and the website told me that only double bed rooms were available, and early check-in was unlikely (we're in the Phoenix area, so I had hoped to show up early to enjoy the pools). I went up to the resort a week before, and talked to someone at the front desk, telling them that it was a special occasion, and while they couldn't gurantee anything, they said I ought to be able to get a king bed. When we showed up, not only did we get a king bed amd early check-in, we got one of the nicest views from our balcony. The pool area is awesome, with excellent drinks. We had lunch and the following mornings breakfast at Blue Sage, with dinner that night at Tuscany. They also knew it was a special occasion, and they couldn't have been nicer, seating us at a fantasic table by the water and fountains, and giving us a complementary dessert (the dinner was awesome as well). Overall, we had a fantastic experience, and we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “The Godd, The Bad & The Ugly”
Reviews.Author: stad
Reviews.Content: Stayed for almost a week in April. If you have small kids-DO NOT STAY AT THIS PROPERTY! Page down to the Bad & Ugly for more details. The Good: beautiful landcape scenery, outdoor speakers w/ soothing music playing everywhere, tranquil water features, attractively designed rooms/suites, complimentary laundry facility. Tuscany Restaurant and great live music( 2 guys in their 40's)Complimentary mountain bikes. Allison at Tennis Center is a gem! Fitzroy, and red hair German waitress at Blue Sage are super nice as well. Lots of pools. The Bad: Black mold & mildew in every corner and grout line of the adjoining room's shower. Filthy bathroom floor covered in hairs upon checkin. Housekeeping overall was lax for such a $$$resort. Stopped into the "Revive Spa" the 1st day to make an appt. for a $125.00 skin scrub for next morning. Made the mistake of taking one of my kids w/ me to make the appt. All of a sudden a man was standing over my child and I, motioning for us to leave. We had been in the spa reception area for all of 5 minutes!!! We were in the process of walking toward the door anyway. I wound up cancelling b/c I knew after being treated so rudely, I would not be able to "revive" there. Finally, the UGLY-and I mean UGLY: Beside shelling out a $$$$ money for the suite and joining room, we also decided to shell out even more for a passcard to the "CLOUD ROOM". They offered snacks, lite meals, drinks, web access, open bar. However, they just instituted a no kids allowed rule. That meant either parent having to go solo to the "CLOUD " while 8 yr old sat outside to help w/the carry out food; the other parent stayed in room w/other 2 kids. Never got to enjoy the view, or ambiance as advertised. Despite this, we understood and used our divide and conquer plan as mentioned above and were fine with it. Then there was the issue of me trying to take my totally asleep 2 yr old into the "CLOUD" room b/c my spouse w/other 2 kids were at the pool. I figured it would be ok since I was doing a quick snack run. I didn't think it was safe to leave her alone outside in the hall. Asleep toddler and I were 6 feet into the "Cloud" Room when "on duty " Cloud concierge person stopped me and tried to shoo me out b/c according to her, kids aren't allowed (though it is a family resort) and it's not fair to the other guests who can't bring their kids in. She spoke rather loudly, repeating herself and embarrassing me in front of the other 6-8 guests who were in there. Naturally I reacted and told her that it was ridiculous that I paid extra $$$ for the CLOUD Room, and that I couldn't stop in for 2 minutes to grab a few things to bring back to our rooms. Not once did she offer to stand outside the Cloud room and watch my baby for the 2 minutes it would have taken. As I was leaving she got infront of me pushing the Cloud Room door wide open, for all the guests to see-more humiliation for me, and said "I'm a momma too". I turned to her w/ baby in stroller and said " That's not the point " but I didnt get to finish what I was saying to her, b/c one of the male guests came charging to the door and told me I was making a scene. Of course all he could see was upsetment on my face responding to her, and not the continued snipping she was doing to me. I am 5'7", and the Cloud Concierge person was easily 5' 9" , and the guy who charged at me was atleast 6'5" tall. It was intimidating and scary to have these taller people standing over me in such an aggressive manner. And they did this to me w/ my toddler by my side. I wound up in tears at the front desk as my 8 yr & 6 yr old children walked up w/ their dad. It was awful. I didn't want to leave our suite and room after that, it ruined the last day & half of my trip. It also upset my kids to see me crying. In conclusion: If you have children younger than teen years, you are not welcome at this resort, no matter how much money you spend. P.S. The on duty manager Mr. Donough? comped us for dinner that night.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous Marriot”
Reviews.Author: cinder1997
Reviews.Content: This hotel/resort is all luxury. The grounds and public areas of this resort are beautiful. The hotel offers a daily list of activites that the you can take part in some being free of charge and some at a small fee. For example they offered a desert walk with a desert plant expert. Across from the resort is a very nice complex of stores and resautarants to enjoy for those of you not wanting to eat or spend all of your time at the resort. The rooms are nicely decorated, but the bathrooms are gorgeous. Bathrooms offer a seperate shower and bath area, all marble tile, and our huge in size. Each room has a balcony and in room cofffee or tea. Parking is either valet or free self park. The pool area is exceptional and offers a lazy river area. There were many families with children staying at this resort. All in all this is a beautiful and comfortable place to stay with out being too "stuck up". We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific resort”
Reviews.Author: cgbroderick
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott is an impressive resort -- my family stayed there for four days over spring break. Though it draws a big crowd of business travelers and vacationing families and hosts lots of conferences and events, the hotel and grounds do not feel crowded because of the size and layout. The one exception -- the lazy river pool was packed when we were there. The property has five pools though so you have alternatives and our kids loved all of the pools. Highlights: It's a beautifully designed resort with a mammoth lobby; the grounds are meticulously maintained; the pool complex is a paradise for kids; the professional and courteous staff; the service; the kids programs; the restaurants, particularly Roy's. Tradeoffs: The cost is high, so if you aren't on an expense account, you need to find deals. The location is many miles north of downtown and most Phoenix-Scottsdale sites, although the 101 and 51 freeways help. You have to have a car to stay here unless you are willing to pay the high tab of cabs and exec cars. My wife and I are not golfers and we didn't do the spa, so we have no opinion on the Desert Ridge course or the spa. We would recommend this resort and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Top Shelf”
Reviews.Author: mevangelista
Reviews.Content: This hotel's accomodations and ameniteis were awesome, as was the service, scenery and most of the food. The staff had it all working. Customer service at its best. Played both courses, all good. Friends ate at the steakhouse on property and said it ws excellent. Also ate at the Italian restaurant on property and it was OK and expensive. Breakfast buffett is expansive and expensive. Be prepared to have money fly out of your wallet for everything, but this is a high end, luxary resort in the desert and that is to be expected. The resort is big, 400 plus rooms so know that before you go. Also, it is located way out in n/e Phoenix on the border of north Scottsdale. Everything in this area is spread out. If you don't have a rental car, be prepared for a car service or taxi ride to Old Town Scottsdale costing between 50 and 60 dollars one way, plus tip. There are great bars and restaurants between the resort and downtown Scottsdale. Both Devil's Martini Bars were great. Dos Gringos was casual and fun and for a high end steakhouse (really high end), but absolutely fabulous for the food, decor and bar and people scene, try Drinkwater's City Hall Steakhouse in Old Town. From there you can walk to just about all the other bars and nighclubs. It was all good. Personally, I would have liked my resort to be about half the size of this one and half the distance to Old Town Scottsdale, but I was part of a golf group and it was not my call. But this place is all good, with great service. Definately 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Property with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: thedcdiva
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend at the Desert Ridge. The hotel is magnificent and the service matched it. Although we do not play golf, we found plenty to do on the vast property. Although it is extremely large, it was not hard to find a peaceful spot. We stayed in a standard room overlooking the main pool and patio. There was constant activity on the patio, but it was never noisy or bothersome. The rooms were spacious, well appointed and just plain pretty. All have a balcony, and a bath with a seperate tub and shower. The pool is really a pool complex, with several different pools and hot tub. Although the hotel was fully booked, the pool never really seemed crowded. The Spa is enourmous and seemed extremely busy, but that did not take away from the experience in any way. The treatments, were expensive but wonderfully relaxing. The restaurants we tried were quite good. We ate most often at Blue Sage, which had a great breakfast menu including a impressive looking buffet that we did not get around to trying. We also tried the Meritage Steak house which offered wonderful food and ambiance, but at a steep price. But for dinner, we usually ventured out to nearby Scottsdale. Overall, a wonderful spot and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: SFO2004
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the JW Marriott Desert Ridge for a conference. I was there for 3 nights. The hotel is very nice! The common areas were nicely decorated and there were plenty of seating areas. The rooms were well appointed. The beds are very comfortable and the bathrooms were a great size, with separate tubs and marble shower stalls. I only wish the tub was a soaking tub! There was also a nice balcony with a table and chairs, overlooking the putting green and some outside seating. One of the best things about this hotel is the service! Everyone was very professional and very courteous. Even under the pressure of serving that many people (over 1000) lunch at the same time, the service staff always came through with a smile. The shuttle to the mall across the street was very helpful. The only problem I had with service was with a young girl at the front desk. She didn't seem to know what she was doing and wasn't very courteous. The other cons are that the hotel is huge and caters to conferences. Since that is what I was here for, it didn't bother me. But, I did notice vacationers trying to get through the crowds, and I don't think I would like that if I were on vacation. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Desert Ridge/Phoenix trip”
Reviews.Author: PennStater84
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a conference at this resort (which I understand was sold the week after we left!) and was very impressed with the service, staff, and appearance. This hotel isn't near downtown so be aware there's nothing in walking distance that I could see. It was also about a 20 minute and $55 taxi ride from the airport. It was unseasonably cold during our stay (wouldn't you know - we were trying to escape the cold!) so even though the pools and lazy river were heated, they were closed because of the temps. They appeared to be well-maintained and the landscaping with markers naming the plants and trees was just beautiful. The front desk staff and all hotel staff we encountered were very pleasant and helpful. The concierge staff even created driving directions for us from point A to point B to point C and back to the hotel when we told them our tourist-y plan for my 1 free day!! We rented a car from the on-site Hertz place. We enjoyed the Frank Lloyd Wright camp tour, (Talieson West), old towne Scottsdale and Rawhide - the re-created old West town complete with fake shoot-outs. Hokey- yes, a little, but great fun and great photo opps! Looked like a movie scene. My husband and teen daughter had a great time on the Detours guided van tour to the Grand Canyon which also stopped at Sedona and a reservation and included lunch for $130. The concierge encouraged that tour group because of the cushier seats for the long drive up and back (4.5 hrs each way). There wer others that were cheaper, but I'm glad we booked this one - they got a great guide. My daughter was spouting off facts and info about plants, geology, etc for days afterwards. The hotel's free shuttle to the nearby Desert Ridge Marketplace ran every half hour or less and was very handy, since otherwise you'd need a car to get anywhere. (or go broke on taxis to get downtown) We ate most of our meals over there, since they had California Pizza Kitchen, TGI Fridays and other non-chain but similar places and the restaurants at the hotel looked expensive for our tastes. The hotel also provides internet service (not wireless in the rooms though) plus free local and long distance calls for 9.95 plus taxes a day. We enjoyed the live musicians each night in the lower lobby/bar area - very classy to a teenager and even her mom!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: JALDenver
Reviews.Content: Despite the coldest weekend in 16 years, we had a FABULOUS time at the JW Desert Ridge and barely realized that it was raining and even SNOWING in AZ! The JW did a wonderful job with service and addressing every need we had, and we were impressed from the valet attendant to the bellman to the room service! The grounds were beautiful and well maintained, and there were significant challenges given the temperature changes there. Truly a wonderful experience and would recommend this resort to anyone...that I like!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: cjjjbugs
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days while attending a conference. It is a beautiful resort with great dining. Our room was huge and beautifully decorated. They staff was very accommodating. Marriott consistently delivers.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort and staff!”
Reviews.Author: visitingrob
Reviews.Content: This resort is amazing. It is huge, new, clean and pretty lavish. Every person on staff was very friendly and helpful. My room was kept clean for me not only every morning but also for turn down service. I had a room overlooking the front of the hotel - very nice view of the palm trees out front and the mountains in the distance. The sunsets were beautiful from the balcony. The pool area is immense! Something for everyone from a lazy river to small pools to large pool to a 15 person hot tub. Everywhere was running, bubbling, gurgling water. Very beautiful and relaxing. I fell asleep in my lounge chair after an hour of swimming! I had the pleasure of eating at both Roy's and Blue Sage restaurants on the property. Definitely not cheap but very delicious. We also ate at Splash, a little cafe style place right in the middle of the pools offering just burgers, sandwiches, etc. I paid about $11 for an Angus burger and fries but it beat leaving the pools in the middle of the day. I never did find two other restaurants... this place is huge! You can also take a free shuttle to the nearby strip malls (very nice) to do some shopping and eating. I hated to leave and hope I can make it back again as I never made it to the mountains, which I really wanted to do. But it was just so hard to leave the pools!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Okay Resort”
Reviews.Author: kls_katidid
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this resort for 3 nights, Oct 8-10. The staff at this place were really great. Very kind and attentive and willing to do whatever it took to make our stay enjoyable. There was a woman who was checking in when we were checking in and it turned out she was at the wrong JW in Phoenix, so the front desk attendant arranged to have one of the resort's town cars take her to the correct hotel so she didn't have to pay for yet another taxi. That's what I call great service! We picked this hotel for three reasons: 1 - lazy river/pool complex; 2 - spa (for me); 3 - golf (for hubby). If we were attending a conference, I might have given this resort a higher rating, but as a leisure hotel, it is only okay (especially given the high price). 1. The lazy river/pool was great, but a little on the cool side and always dirty with bugs and debris swirling right around the loop with you. Pool bar/cafe food was what I've come to expect from pool bar food - expensive and mediocre. 2. The spa environment was wonderful. The facilities were beautiful, peaceful and serene and the staff was okay. The massage I received was probably the worst I've ever had, and at $150 for 50 minutes, I was hugely disappointed. 3. I'm not a golfer, but my husband was pretty disappointed with the course he played (there are two and one was closed - unfortnately I can't remember which one he played). I guess it's the wrong time of year for golf in PHX, but still, for the price he expected a lot better. Our room was nice; bedding was heavenly. Shower pressure was terrible and so I called the front desk. Within an hour, maintenance had come, removed the old shower head, located and installed a new one and the pressure was much better. There was a cockroach in our room the first morning, but it was clearly on its last leg and was the only bug of any kind we encountered in our ground floor room. We didn't eat any meals at the resort (except lunch at pool bar). There is a great mall right across the street with tons of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Love the JW Marriott”
Reviews.Author: ladybug5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just love this property. The room is large, bright and just extremely comfortable with a couch to sit on and patio to see the surrounding area. The bathroom is great with a bath and shower and the service is wonderful. They have several pools including a lazy river . While staying at the hotel I received a call that my dog was in the hospital causing us to check out at 6 PM on a Saturday to return to Southern California. I expected to pay the full rate for the day and the hotel gave me a day rate of $80. I will never stay anywhere else on my stays to Phoenix in the future. Congratulations JW Marriott, a hotel that really does care about their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, Rejuvenating and Refreshing”
Reviews.Author: leondrataylor
Reviews.Content: I always stay at Marriott's because of their consistency. I am rarely disappointed and this time was no acception. We stayed for three days but our main intention was to visit the Grand Canyon for a day. When I got to the hotel I could have easily forgotten about the Grand Canyon but my husband had his heart set on it. The drive was under 4 hours and both scenic as well as pleasant. However, I wouldn't do it again. Back to the hotel. The lazy river was my favorite. The grounds are beautiful and the staff courteous. We ate at the hotel only once at the Blue Sage and it was for breakfast. No big deal seeing as it's hard to screw that up. We ate and shopped in Scottsdale mostly. I barely had time to lounge at the pool but we're going back because we bought three nights at the timeshare across the street although we would prefer to stay at the hotel again. They do not have a conceirge but they did upgrade me to a pool view. The hotel is in a good location with a shopping plaza, a grocery store, pharmacy and eateries across the street. I would like to visit the JW in Scottsdale since they have all private villas. I would recommend this hotel for families although there weren't many when we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort----Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: sammi33
Reviews.Content: Great place!!....beautiful.....we went for a spa weekend with a bunch of girls and had a great time...no promblems with the AC or the rooms....we had a great view of the pools and felt like we were in paradise....the staff was really helpful and polite...even the staff in the restaurants was polite and the service was great....very accomadating to changes in menu and providing things that were not there....they got us chocolate souffle when it was not even on the menu!!!...how great is that...loved it..

Reviews.Title: “Time Share Offer”
Reviews.Author: lori a
Reviews.Content: We went there on a Time Share offer of $75/night, 4 nights, 5 days. We booked and paid for a one bedroom villa back in May of 2006. Keeping in mind that we would have to endure a 90minute sales presentation in order to get such a deal. Our friends booked in November 2006 with the same offer, or they were lead to believe so. When we arrived at the Canyon Villas our friends were told their "hotel room" was at the hotel and not a villa as ours was. We were all greatly disappionted and let the manager Adam know so. We had shared a rental car which we kept at the villa and everytime we wanted to go see them at the hotel (JW Marriott Desert Ridge) we had to valet park which was costly. I must say that the time share sales presentation of 90 minutes was the least painful one of its type we have been through. However, they killed the sale upon our arrival. The resort was beautiful as it is only 4 years old.they guys golfed the Palmer course and we ladys purchased services at the spa, used the spa pool (no children allowed) which was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: dawggirl
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very nice, attention to details in every way. I got a beautiful room overlooking the pool and outdoor lounging area but the first night the party going on down below, coupled with the neighbors (on both sides) made sleeping hard. I asked at the desk the next morning and they moved me to an exact room overlooking the entry facing west where I was able to sit on the balcony and enjoy spectacular sunsets. No noisy neighbors. Every staff person I've met - whether at the front desk, concierge, pool, restaurants, housekeeing, etc. has been exceptional. As a Marriott elite member, I got a few extra goodies such as entrance to the Spa fitness center for free. Free refridgerator on request also. The pool area is huge and easy to find a quiet place if that's your thing. Plenty of areas for families with kids too. Even the lazy river is cool. I had a spa day which was nice - the spa is wonderful; however my massage therapist acted like she could care less. Otherwise, everything else has been PRIMO!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a Marriott, but your money can go further”
Reviews.Author: rwc2theworld
Reviews.Content: So you're looking for a resort in Phoenix, right? While the JW Marriott is nice, your money can go much further in this valley of the sun. Overall, the Marriott looks good, but when you did under the surface, there's not a lot there. The spaces are big but without much character. Some of the rooms are probably very nice, but mine (for $200 per night) looked out on a concrete wall. Unbelievable, yes? Believe it. At all costs, avoid odd-numbered rooms in the 3500 wing. They all look out at the same wall. No sun. No view. Very disappointing. And then there was someone else's hair in the sink. Also very disappointing for a top end resort. Finally, the room decor doesn't really fit with the desert theme. It's more of a french colonial thing going on. For a great experience, I'd recommend the Phoenician.

Reviews.Title: “Subtle changes made reduced the atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: casey-cleo
Reviews.Content: Last year we had a family vacation at this hotel and enjoyed it so much we decided to go back again this year. We arrived on 8/21 and stayed for about a week. The hotel is top notch. The grounds are well maintained, and the pools are in great shape. (Our favorite is the Lazy River.) Unfortunately, we noticed some things that were changed from last year that we did not anticipate. For example, last year at the pools, there was a childrens menu with lunch items that were reasonably priced. This year, the children's menu was gone, and all lunch possibilities were much higher priced. (This is a real problem for a family of 5.) I really don't want to spend $60 - $70 a day for lunch. I didn't see the snow cone machine either ! Another BIG problem for my wife and I was to try to find a good cup of coffee somewhere at the hotel. Unfortunately, the only coffee was Starbucks. (And we really hate Starbucks !) This coffee is too strong, and way over priced. Anyway...despite the above issues, we still managed to have an enjoyable time, but it is questionable if we will go back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Pasiando
Reviews.Content: Wanting to get away for Labor Day weekend. We decided to stay at the Desert Ridge. Myself, my husband along with our 6 year old son, 14 and 16 year old girls and their 15 year old girlfriend. We loved it. The pools were amazing, the kids had a wonderful time. Security to enter the pool was closely monitored with special wrist bands. Food service by the pool was excellent. We enjoy our lunched by the poolside. My husband and I went to the spa for a couples massage, the spa was top of the line. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Girls Weekend”
Reviews.Author: adrianatj
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent time! I got a little worried after reading all the air conditioning problems, but we had not one problem. Everything was GREAT! We had a room overlooking the lazy river. It was so nice to look at all the beautiful scenery. This was our first visit to Arizona and this resort left everyone saying that they would like to come back again. We were there on the weekend of Sept.8 and I heard somone say that the resort was full, but it wasn't crowded at all. One of the girls had a massage and said that it was wonderful. I really enjoyed the mall right across the street, they had Target, Kohl's, Hollister, Aeropostale, lots of other clothing stores, plus tons of places to eat. If you just want a weekend to relax there is plenty to do between just the resort and the mall.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: dje
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this "resort" for 2 days in August. Coincidentally before our stay, USA Today published an article about how great the pool area was. Perhaps this set expectations too high, as this resort was a huge disappointment. On the plus side, the grounds and overall property and design were very nice. Rooms has a garden, floral design and bathroom was huge with a nice shower. There is a nice computer system for rent in each room, and you could use it to efficiently make requests to the front desk or housekeeping (this part of the system was free). Property is also located next to Desert Ridge mall where you can find a bunch of shopping, restaurants, Target, etc. However, the resort experience left alot to be desired. The key item, as mentioned in other posts, is a faulty air conditioning system. The hallways smelled damp and musky. While the room A/C was better, it never cooled sufficiently or removed the humidity levels. Further, the pool area was awful. This could have been a result of this weekend being the most busy in the season (heard through another guest as claimed by their staff), but there were no seats, used food plates everywhere. It didn't quite live up to their Top 10 billing in USA Today. Hoping these guys will clean up their act and make this worth of the J.W. Marriott brand.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great experience, but some issues...”
Reviews.Author: wahooaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed for Labor Day weekend. Overall we had a great time, but there were some issues. We had a nice room... the beds were very comfortable, the bathroom was nice and had a separate shower, and there was a balcony with a small table and two chairs. However, although it was a step above the average room, it wasn't a very large or luxurious. The room service was reasonably priced and delivered quickly, which we liked, and had a kids menu for $6.50. The spa was incredible... my husband and I each had a massage there, and stayed for a few hours to lounge by the blissfully quiet, uncrowded spa pool and use the other services such as the steambath, jacuzzi, etc. The first issue was that the hallways were really hot and muggy. It seemed like they didn't air condition the hallways. It was a bit of a walk to get to our room, and by the time you got there you were sweaty and uncomfortable. The second issue is that they charged $20 a night for valet overnight parking. I can see that in a city, but we are talking the middle of the desert here. When we drove up to the main entrance, they asked us if we wanted to valet, and we said yes, and if we would be parking overnight, and we said yes (since we wouldn't be leaving the resort), but they didn't mention the $20 charge (until we saw it on the bill, LOL!) The third issue has to do with the pools. They advertise the pools as their big attraction during the summer. And while they were nice, they were REALLY crowded. All the chairs were taken (or at least they seemed to be taken, since there were towels on them), but no one seemed to actually be using them. If you asked a server how to get a chair, they said to get there early and put a towel on it, doh! We ended up just leaving our beach bag and clothes next to a bush every day we were there. Then, in order to get into the pool, you don't just need a key card, you need a one of those plastic bracelets that you clip on and it won't come off unless you cut it. I understand that it is to keep out non-guests, but they are uncomfortable if you have to wear them for 3 days (especially our 3 year old, who kept pulling on it). We cut ours off overnight, and when we asked for new ones at the front desk the next morning, they gave us a hard time about it. When we put them on the next time, we put them on ourselves so they were loose and we could pull them off. Don't let the front desk people put them on for you... they put them on REALLY tight. Then, if you want a pool towel, you have to give your room number (shouldn't the little bracelet be enough?). Its not like you can steal the towels, since there is a guard at the pool gate who makes you take them off from around your waist as you leave and put them in a hamper (not that we were trying to steal them, but our 3 year old was shivering and we wanted to just carry him to the room wrapped in the towel... and just leave the towel there for the housekeeping staff.) I was really worried the rest of the trip that they would charge me for the pool towels, since I checked them out one place with my room number, and returned them to the hamper on the way out. Then there is the lazy river, which is a ton of fun, IF you can get a tube. There is a limited number of tubes floating in the river, and you have to wait for one to become vacant to get one (the only thing you don't have to prove you are a guest to do, LOL!). However, people were hogging them, taking them back to their towel-draped chairs, using two to float instead of just one. It took about a half hour to find a tube for our 7 year old daughter to use to float. The kids also enjoyed the water slide, where they thankfully had a guard at the water slide line, so that there wasn't cutting/pushing/shoving. Also, the service at the pool left a lot to be desired. If you want service, you need to be at a chair and put up your flag, but there aren't enough chairs for the all the guests. My husband kept trying to wave down servers, then finally gave up and went to the restaurant and got us some drinks (not that it was a huge hardship, but it would be nice to be able to get cold drinks when it is over 100 degrees outside). Lastly, at one point they ran out of towels for about 30 minutes. You have to go to this centrally located ramada to get pool towels. On our last day I went with my daughter, soaking wet, to get some towels. They had run out. The attendant kept saying towels were coming, but they never came. At one point an official looking person came by to make sure the attendant REALLY meant there were no towels, and checked all the empty towel shelves to make sure they were REALLY empty, and then disappeared. After a long wait, we just gave up and walked back to our room wet. I think we would have enjoyed our stay more if it wasn't a holiday (Labor Day) and it wasn't so crowded, but the management should be able to anticipate when the hotel is full and plan accordingly (enough towels, enough servers, etc.) Also, they need to put some kind of system in place to ensure that people don't hog chairs and tubes.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay at the JW”
Reviews.Author: jmuemos
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the JW Desert Ridge from August 27-31 with 6 other members of my company while attending an event they were hosting. It was a wonderful stay. This hotel is gorgeous. Beautiful lobby that has fountains, great views, marble everywhere, and free ice water and tea for you to sip when you arrive. The rooms were very spacious (I had a great view of the pool from my balcony) and the bathrooms were awesome - glass and marble shower, separate tub, big sink with lots of nice amenities, plush robe, etc. The beds were SO comfortable - I loved the soft duvet.
