The staff was friendly and always willing to accomodate. The grounds outside are beautiful - I highly recommend getting up early and taking a walk on some of the paths. The pools were a lot of fun! The lazy river - so relaxing! And even though this is a huge hotel - I never felt like it was that crowded! We were there for a conference - even that was done well. They have several large, very nice ballrooms and it's a great place for an event. The food that was served for our lunches and breakfast were great. As a company one night we at at Roy's and it was delicous! I also had lunch at one of their other restaurants, Blue Sage, and it was good as well. The one thing I missed out on was the spa - maybe next time! I'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely be back! A gorgeous resort!!”
Reviews.Author: QCTrailrider
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked a Girlfriend's Getaway Spa Package for $289, which includes one night in a standard room, two 50 minute spa treatments (any ones you want), 2 Cosmopolitan drinks, 2 Starbuck's coffees, turndown service w/ 2 magazines, and a disposable camera. We changed it at the last minute to a regular Spa Getaway, which was almost the same package, but instead of the Cosmos, magazines, camera, and Starbuck's, we got 2 free breakfasts at Blue Sage, and paid $269. The resort is huge and very beautiful, with lush landscaping, gardens, water everywhere, lots of walking paths, several pools with a lazy river, and splash pad for the little kids. The spa is incredible, and mere descriptive terms do not do it justice. It must be experienced to be believed. It has a wonderful health food cafe that looks out onto a beautiful private lap pool lined with palm trees and private cabanas. There was never anyone using the pool, it seemed, and that was where we chose to spend the entirety of our second day. More on that later. Check-in was a breeze, and we got a ground floor room with double beds that overlooked a large portion of water and the Isle Of Capris. Very nice view. We were initially concerned about mosquitoes because of the proximity to water, but during our stay we didn't see one bug. The room was very nice, and the bathroom was large and well done. The only things I would change would be for the beds to be upgraded to Queen size, and I hated the sheets. They were very scratchy, and I expected that the hotel would have had softer linens. I have a very hard time sleeping in uncomfortable sheets, but the bed itself was very comfortable and had lots of pillows. The other issue I had was the way the A/C was set up. The vent was a large vertical space on the corner of one wall and only hit one bed, so one of us was hot all night and the other froze. I was glad for the big down comforter on the bed. We stayed Sunday to Monday, and on Sunday the pool was absolutely packed, but we had no trouble finding two chaises together. As soon as we even set down our bags a pool valet came up to us and gave us towels. As we sat down another pool valet appeared and gave us a pitcher of absolutely lovely filtered or bottled ice water, I'm not sure which. This was very good, because if any of you have tried drinking Phoenix tap water, it's really bad. But then we didn't see another server the entire time we were there, and we would have ordered something from the pool bar. The other review is correct in saying that some of the crowd definitely was being overserved alcohol and got pretty loud and obnoxious. We also saw one guy who was pretty raucous spill his entire drink into the lazy river. I was not impressed that you have to pay extra to get a raft to float around the lazy river, though there seemed to always be a few floating around that you could appropriate when someone left the pool. We didn't spend time at the other pools except to walk around and see what they were like, and they were nice, if set a bit close together. I loved the splash pad for the little kids which consisted of a big area with 6 deck jets aimed at the middle, and about 1/4 inch of water on the pad. No chance of drowning there! The restaurants are very expensive, though there were several to choose from with quite a bit of variety, we chose to eat at the nearby shopping center which had many more reasonably priced options. We did have our free Blue Sage breakfast, which was nothing to write home about, and arrived almost cold. We did have the option of the breakfast buffet, but we ordered off the menu. The servers will push the blue corn pancakes and say they are to die for. We thought they were pretty gross. The spa treatments were well done, and the staff was very professional. There is a required 20% tip added on to each treatment that is payable before the service, which is nice because you don't have to bother trying to carry cash around in your robe. The amenities in the spa were wonderful, and they offer everything. The layout is a teensy bit confusing and even though I spent 2 days there I still kept getting lost. On a side note, anywhere you go and anywhere you sit you will have something beautiful to look at. The hotel takes their theme of earth-water-wind-fire very seriously and incorporates into every aspect of the grounds and decor. It is just beautiful there, and I will stay longer next time and take more advantage of what the resort has to offer. Moving on, parking is $18 or 20 a day through valet. I recommend self parking, which is a little bit of a hike, but the walk to the front door is spectacular all along the way, and with everything to see it makes the walk go quickly. The valet staff is hugely helpful and friendly, and very quick to do anything you ask. The bell staff was equally nice and eager to please, as were the front desk staff, which was evident on the day we checked out. Being Elite Members of Marriott is supposed to entitle you to perks, which really don't mean that much, but the one we looked forward to was the free access to the spa for each day of our stay. We had access included anyway the first day because of the spa treatments, but we wanted to spend the day after we checked out enjoying the spa as well. We called a couple of times before we arrived to makes sure this was the case, and they said that it was. They also invited us to arrive early before check-in and use the pool and whatever else we wanted even before we were to be able to get into our room. Wow! Anyway, we checked out and went to the spa only to be told that we could use the gym, but to get a locker and robe, and to use the pool woud be a $25 charge. No way! We went back to the front desk, explained the situation, and after a minute the girl came back and told us to go enjoy our day at the spa, it was all taken care of. We found out later that the spa had charged our $50 fee to the front desk, and the hotel comped it to us. The spa told us that that was a source of contention between the hotel and the spa, and guests were usually misinformed of spa policy. What? Either way, we camped out at the pool for most of the day, we were the only two people there, and we were waited on by the servers exclusively. It was incredibly relaxing and quiet. The pool wasn't heated though, and I was too chicken to get in all the way; it was cold! Everything was great, and I will go back with my family and enjoy the hotel fully. The only other thing I have to say that is even a little bit negative is that it seemed that a lot of the staff was non-English speaking, as in mostly Russian, and we had a very hard time getting our questions answered. It was very difficult communicating with many staffers there, and if you wanted anything done or had pertinent questions you had to go to someone fairly high up on the hotel food chain, where they all spoke English. All in all I give this hotel an A-; we loved it! To break it down pricewise, we basically paid for our spa treatments, and got the room, the breakfasts, and the extra day at the spa for free. $269 total, with the spa treatments and tips being worth that, the room would have been another $115 or so, the breakfast came out to $45 including tip, the extra day at the spa, $50. Great deal, so I highly recommend taking adantage of the Summer rates; you will never know it's 110 degrees out if you are in the pool or getting a massage!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Paaltjes
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights after an extensive trip through South West USA. We only wanted to relax. This hotel is big, but we did not really noticed this because all the public areas are big too. The pool area is fantastic with room enough for everybody and a wide variety of pools. Food in the various restaurants was up to standard but not exeptional. Breakfast service was a little slow, but a lot of inexperience staff was on duty. I think the hotel is using college students in summer. We were not in a hurry so it did not matter too much, but some other guest got angry about this. The room was very nice. I always like to seperate shower. It is a nice touch to have a computer in the room. $10 for 24 hours internet access is a reasonable charge. The beds in Marriott are always superb. We enjoyed our stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: Somer78
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I spent one night at The Desert Ridge Marriott for my birthday. The rooms are clean, the drinks are refreshing, the lazy river is kid infested, and the service is slow. We waited 40 minutes to receive our pre dinner cocktails and appetizers in the downstairs bar area and had to ask twice to receive our drinks. Our waiter at Roy's was very nice but inexperienced. He told us that he couldn't tell the difference between a $30 bottle of wine and a $200 bottle. We were then told that lobster was not on the menu. Roy's is a seafood restaurant. The following morning at breakfast we asked three times for orange juice but the breakfast was amazing. We are very easy to please when we travel but it just seemed like the resort was inconsistant with it's service. Everyone seemed inexperienced and unwilling to please their guests. The ambiance is extremely appealing but lacking customer service.

Reviews.Title: “The best resort ever!”
Reviews.Author: luvgoodtravel
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite resort of all time! We are frequent Marriott stay-ers and this is my favorite. We love the big, wow hotels and this is one of them. The pools are great, love the lazy river and the restaurants are great as well. We always travel during Spring Break and, although it is more crowded, it is still a wonderful experience. The food at Roy's is great and this time we were there, we ate at the steakhouse at the golf course and it was great. OK, here is the best about this place-THE CLOUD CLUB. It is like a concierge lounge, you pay extra $150 a day and you get access, full breakfast in the cloud club, waters, sodas, snacks all day, internet access and a printer, open bar from 5:00pm-10:00pm, appetizers, desserts and the best service ever. We LOVE Sharon and Liz in the cloud club, they are the reason we go back to this place. It is my favorite vacation hotel, Phoenix I could take or leave but this place is great!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this resort!”
Reviews.Author: jsilva12
Reviews.Content: We stayed in mid August to celebrate our 10th anniversary. We were a little concerned based on some of the reviews. But we found the hotel exceeded our expectations as soon as we stepped into the beautiful lobby with its stunning fountains. First, we received an excellent mountain/pool view on the top floor, with a double bed and PC ($9.95 a day) as we had requested. Being August we pretty much had the pool area to ourselves. Our boys (ages 4 to 7) enjoyed the lazy river, mini water slide, and the other 3 pools. The staff was excellent and courteous. The food and drinks were pricey (like most hotel food) but good at the pool area, Blue Sage, and room service. My wife enjoyed the Spa and had no complaints about the service. It was very hot but we broke out the times in the pool to just 2 hours at a time (before 11 am or after 5 pm was best) before going back in the AC or Phoenix destination (AZ Science museum and Mesa Southwest Museum were both excellent diversions that the kids, as well as parents, really loved). We also went to the Phoenix Zoo during a cloudy day and although small, it was nice. We will be going back next year as this resort had something for everyone, especially the pool area. See attachments.

Reviews.Title: “Desert Stuff”
Reviews.Author: aeia
Reviews.Content: Well, first I'd like to start by saying that GUYS YOU ARE STAYING IN THE DESERT. THE DESERT IS HOT IN THE SUMMER. A couple days ago we reached 117 degrees! 83 degrees vs. 117. Find a cooler Travel destination if you don't like the heat. I love the heat, I am an Arizona native and I live in North Scottsdale. I go to this hotel to chill out. Honestly, I would never stay here. The gift shop staff is appalling, they used the term (--) right in front of me to refer to a co-worker who'd gone to the bathroom. But they are not affiliated with this resort. The staff of the resort itself is inexplicably friendly. I walk by in my jeans, Im not a guest, lookin all ripped up and grungy, cause I can, and they all nod and ask how I am. I admit when I was wearing my work clothes (A very very very nice ensemble.. and expensive) I was treated SLIGHTLY more friendly. That was barely though. I wouldnt stay here overnight because it's very hotel- like. I would think it should be more RESORT-like. There are hundreds of rooms crammed on top of one another. But they have free Lemonade in the lobby!!!! And a LAZY RIVER! So if you guys want to cool off hop in the lazy river and grab a glass of Lemonade. It's FREE. It's lovely, but no better than most houses Ive lived in and my friends live in. So I wouldnt stay there but the friendliness of the staff and the fact it's a great place to hang out makes it worth stopping by. Remember, guys, this is ARIZONA. You are next to DESERT RIDGE IN PHOENIX. Youll see SCORPIONS AND RATTLESNAKES. Why? Cause it's THE DESERT. Also Id like to say the best part is that there are tons of animals all over all the time, we saw baby ducks and tons of jackrabbits walking around and they arent too shy to humans either so nature lovers!

Reviews.Title: “There are great things about this place and not so great things”
Reviews.Author: VaBelle35
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about this hotel. I was traveling for business as a single woman, but with a group of people from work and a family member. My company paid for everything during my stay. The room was large, clean and the bed was incredibly comfortable. I was not overwhelmed by the spa or salon and they don't have their act together coordinating services between them. The massage I had was just okay, nothing to sing about. The food provided for the convention was usually dry and not exciting, but that may have more to do with the choices made by the organizers than the hotel. I could not get my room cold no matter how low I turned the thermostat. It sat on 62 the entire time and I still was too hot to blow dry my hair. As some reveiws have stated, the hallways are hot and muggy. On some days some hallways were and on other days none of them were. The FedEx office had no a/c on my last day there and it was unbearable in there. I highly recommend using their Sony Picture Developer as I developed my digital photos and the Sony machine really does a fantastic job. The service at the hotel is outstanding, I was always satisfied with how they handled problems (several small things like the made threw out my newspaper before I had read it and I need a box to ship things home). The hotel did not coordinate my car to the airport, but I was still able to get one. They say to reserve it 24 hours in advance but also re-confirm it a couple of hours before (says my driver). I never did go outside, too oppressively hot. I have to agree with the restaurant recommendations, thumbs up to Blue Sage (my #1 choice) and Roys and thumbs down to the steakhouse. I never had the time to try the Italian place as it is closed 2 nights a week.

Reviews.Title: “We checked out three days early”
Reviews.Author: bunky48
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel often, staying at 5 star and 4 star hotels and resorts. We checked into the JW Marriott Desert Ridge on July 19, 2006 for four nights. We are NOT picky, demanding guests. When we arrived in our room it was very warm inside, but were assured it would cool down with the a/c turned on high. By 10 p.m. that evening there had been no progress and a technician arrived. Verdict : cannot be fixed. Temperature outside stll over 100 degrees. Not a problem at this point since we realize mechanical things do breakdown. Upon our request for a new room, the staff exhibited a complete lack of sensitivity to the problem, treated us in a rude manner and showed a complete lack of curtesy. In fact the first comment by the front desk was "what do you want me to do about it?", then " you will have to deal with it". Although we were eventually moved to a different room, the a/c in this facility leaves something to be desired during the peak summer months. At no time did any Marriott person offer any apology for our inconvenience or show any sense of caring. When all systems function correctly it is easy to run the ship. When problems arise, the true test of quality service starts. In this situation Marriott Desert Ridge failed. As a side comment, be sure before you stay here that you want a mega complex with all the associated large crowds, noise and a very crowded pool area with no cabanas and very few umbrellas. The main pool area has approximately twenty five lounge chairs lined up side by side and four to five rows deep. A real "meat market" set up. Also, large business groups are present with all their drawbacks to the casual visitors experience. We checked out after one night and went to the Four Seasons, Scottsdale where we thoroughly enjoyed our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Muggy rooms in the summertime”
Reviews.Author: PHX_Travel
Reviews.Content: My husband had a lengthy conference at the JW Marriot Desert Ridge the end of July. While the lobby and grounds were beautiful, the hotel has major problems with its air conditioning. We were assigned a beautiful suite overlooking the pool, and we could not get the room temperature below 83 degrees. The hotel's engineering department admitted that the rooms at the end of the halls are also at the end of their cooling "loop" and do not get adequate cooling. In addition, our lovely bathroom that was big enough to have a dance floor in it, had no vents or air conditioning supply. It was unbearable. We literally kept the door open with fans blowing the slightly cooler air from the hallway (which was still very warm) into the room. The hotel moved us to another room in the area....but same problem. We finally gave up our suite and moved to a standard room closer to the lobby and the air conditioning was at best, adequate (we kept our fan!). MANY of the conference rooms were too hot, and other rooms seemed to be cool then hot, as if the hotel was moving its inadequate cooling capabilities around. The pool areas are nice, and service was ok...beyond the seemingly unfixable air conditioning problem. If you're thinking of booking a conference/meeting at this property in the summer, my advice is don't do it. If you're just wanting to take the family for a night or two, ask for a "centrally located room" and it will probably be ok.

Reviews.Title: “A Marriott on steroids”
Reviews.Author: BaronVonH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel because of a business conference, not so much by choice, and I think we would have chosen elsewhere, if not for the business conference. The rate was quite high for the off-season, considering the level of service and the quality of the room. Maybe if I was a golfer I would have been more excited, but this resort is out on the edge of town, a 20-30 minute drive from the nightlife of Scottsdale. The hotel is big, and I think that may be part of the problem. It's very dificult to provide top service to over a thousand guests. House cleaning was quite slow and the halls seemed to be filled with maids carts all the time. We had numerous problems getting internet connections (should be better at a nearly new hotel), and the staff weren't much help. Wireless and high-speed in the room were two separate charges, for each computer. In fairness, the hotel did remove most of our Internet charges. There are several food options, quite acceptable and reasonably priced, given that this is an expensive resort. The pools are very nice, and they are generously staffed with attendants. The pool area seemed to be the most service-oriented part of the hotel. Many other folks were "going through the motions" or a little rough around the edges. This is not a Ritz-Carlton. This a very nice property, and families will enjoy a trip to this resort more than a trip to Las Vegas. But the place didn't feel that special, and I think I would have preferred to stay at one of the more established resorts closer in to the center of Scottsdale (most of which are the same price or less expensive.)

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed...”
Reviews.Author: ArtiesBear
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a weekend getaway at the JW Marriott Desert Ridge. We’re Phoenix residents, but like to check out the local hotels and spas. This was our first visit to this property. We have stayed at other JW Marriott properties and were impressed. Not so with this property. The lobby and grounds are beautiful. The staff and service were mostly unremarkable. Probably the biggest drawback was the room. Rather than the usual luxurious JW standard, it was more like “JW meets Courtyard by Marriott.” If you want luxury, this is not the resort for you. There was nothing elegant about the room. It was simply standard. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean, but beyond that, we were not impressed. Further, the hallways leading to the guestrooms were hot and muggy. It was as if they were trying to conserve electricity by keeping the AC set at an uncomfortably high temperature. In addition, the hallways had an odd odor that we likened to dry cleaning fluid. We visited the spa on Saturday, enjoying two treatments each. The treatments themselves were fine, but the spa lacks the luxury of its competitors in this resort category. The wet areas are minimal, and overall, the spa accommodations are only so-so. We did enjoy the spa pool, which is much less crowded than the other pools at the resort. It was quiet and relaxing, with the exception of an inconsiderate guest yapping continuously on her cell phone. The Spa Bistro served tasty food with efficient, courteous service. We dined at Roy’s, where the service was exceptional and the food on par with other Roy’s locations. I will return to this Roy's location. However, I will not stay at this property again. Given a choice, I would book the Camelback Inn, which has a sumptuous spa and guest accommodations that offer what I expect from a JW Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Five Days of Relaxation and Pampering!!!”
Reviews.Author: shopselina
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on business with my husband. Well where do I start? Upon driving in to the resort you are struck with the immeadiate immensity of the hotel. It is truly a "resort" in scale. Checking in was a bit hectic, there were a gaggle of luggage boys under the carport busily attending to peoples luggage. Getting in and over to the checkin desk was a bit harried but I think it was a busy day. They said they were at full capacity. We arrived early (around 1pm) and they had a lovely room available already. When we walked into our standard room we were surprised to see our bed covered in red rose petals. It was beauitiful. I dont know if this is standard practice for them or not, alot of other guests I spoke to did not recieve this but it was a nice touch.The bathroom was gorgeous, It was so large! It had a nice deep tub for baths and a seperate all-glass shower. The tile in the bathrooms is gorgeous but VERY slippery when wet. I think its a law-suit waiting to happen. The pools are beautiful, that is where I spent the majority of my time, while my husband was on business. There are many private corners,shady spots and umbrellas to stake out if you want to be alone. The service by the pool was unexpected. They will bring you drinks and a limited menu poolside. The food was great, noone I was with, was ever dissapointed in there choices. The salads could feed a small family, and at $12-14 each they should. Heres a tip: They offer a smaller managable half-size salad for $6-8 each that is still enough to fill up even a large appetite. But they wont tell you they offer this smaller size, we just found out by accident. Food and drink service poolside was a little on the slow side but the young people that were working the pool in 100+degree heat deserved a medal for that alone. Housekeeping was a bit slow, some days I would be out of my room 8 or 9 hours and come back and housekeeping was just finishing or had not gotten to my room yet. My only complaint about this goregeous place was the selection of places to eat. There is NOWHERE to just grab a low-cost meal. Even the cafe that is poolside charged $12 for a cheesburger, $12-14 for salads, and $10-12 for average drinks.(Everyone was raving about there Pina Coladas w/toasted coconut in all fareness) The restaurants I'm sure were fabulous, I only ate in the 2 that were the most affordable. You can also have drinks and a small food menu out on the large patio in the back of the hotel. ( I recommend the "Chicken Wonton-Tostada's" they were unreal....Yumm!!!) They have large upholstered furniture outside on the back patio, where you can sit and feel like your on your living room couch being served dinner. I wished I would have aten there a bit more it was so relaxing. All and all there is not much I can say bad about this place, between the mountain veiws, the gorgeous pools, the mostly prompt and couteous service, beautiful rooms, and good food it was a fantastic week. I would highly reccomend it to anyone visiting Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Kindergarten on crack”
Reviews.Author: Huneymooners
Reviews.Content: A very nice sprawling resort, however, I think every single kid under the age of 12 in all of Arizona was there!! Go the the Westin Kierland. That is where we stayed the 3rd and 4th nights of our golf trip, muuuuch better.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the hype - especially on July 4th Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Padinphx
Reviews.Content: Reading all of the reviews on this site, my wife and I decided to stay at the JW Marriott over the 4th July period, and I have to say the hype does not match the resort. OK, a nice, lavish, well decorated hotel it is, but there are many negatives. The Lazy River was not so much lazy as manic, and there were countless people smoking on rafts and drinking from brought in cans of beer - more like the Salt River than the lazy River. The hotel clearly does not splash out on air conditioning the common areas, a clear issue when it is 110 degrees. The drinks are overpriced, and the service was average - definitely nothing to amaze. I have travelled extensively throughout the world, and have never seen a valet service staffed entirely by 17 and 18 year old kids, nor been refused access to walk around the pool area as I did not have the designated wrist band on. If you are looking for a pampered, exceptionally serviced, secluded and relaxed stay, go to the Boulders in Carefree - a far superior resort, and over this weekend, $40 a night cheaper than the marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Sizzlin' Resort in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: JLFERG
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at this resort while attending a conference with a colleague. We were impressed with the rooms, their size and amenities. Beautiful bathrooms too. Great pools and lush grounds (around the desert foliage). But my favorite part of the resort was all of the little bunnies hopping around. There must be more than 100 of them. They are some of the smallest wild rabbits I have ever seen (and I have seen a lot of them). This resort also has some amazing birds--Great Blue Heron, Black (Midnight) Herons--things I didn't expect to see in the desert, but the manmade bodies of water at the resort seem to beckon them. I've been to a lot of conferences, and I must say that the resort catering company puts on a delicious spread--breakfast, lunch and snacks plus out-of-this world Starbucks coffee service, complete with shakers of cinnamon, chocolate and vanilla and liquid vanilla and caramel so you can make your own flavored lattes. Roy's restaurant lived up to the rest of the change providing fresh from the ocean seafood and topnotch drinks. Blue Sage offers a fitness omelet that was absolutely delicious and made me think I was far from eating health food. I like it so much, I ordered it two of the four days I was there. Blue Sage also makes great salads. Only their lunch menu is skimpy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: cm1661
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to the resort in a little less than a year and the second time was even better than the first which is hard to believe considering that the first visit was spectacular as well. From the time that you drive up to the door, the staff is waiting to greet you with a smile on their face and literally sprinting to open your car door for you and then sprinting to open the lobby door as well. Our room was on the lobby level which was very convenient and the room was not your average hotel room by any means. The 5 pools on site were amazing especially the Lazy River which although crowded was a joy to float around. We stayed for 4 nights and the Vista lounge is a perfect place to sit outside in the desert air and enjoy cocktails before and after dinner. The pool restaurant Just a Splash is a great place for lunch or a snack while you sit by the pool as well. This resort makes sure you do not have to leave and who would want to, finally, enough cant be said about the nature of the staff, every single one of them was friendly, accomodating and had a smile on their face and a comment of good morning etc. I am returning in a few months for hopefully another magical stay.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible place to relax - fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: tc999
Reviews.Content: I can see why this is the #1 rated resort in Phoenix. The pool and lazy rizer are awesome, very well done. Even got a neat little waterslide. The grounds are very clean, the rooms are comfortable. Although I was there for one day, I'm thinking of returning. Walking into the lobby, there's fresh water and ice tea which hit the spot when its 100 degrees out. Staff was very accomodating, although it took until about 5:30 to check into our room when they said 4pm. And they didn't call my cell to remind me as they said they would. Little annoyance. We locked in a $160 AAA rate and was well worth it. We ate lunch by the pool which was pretty tasty. The drinks at the pool are nice and strong, but of course, you will pay dearly for it. Hard to believe its a Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like celebrities”
Reviews.Author: weeniedog2000
Reviews.Content: I have been in the travel industry for almost 25 years, but was not familiar with this property. A friend from the PHX area told me about it, and now I'm ready to shout about it from the top of Camelback Mountain--"this is THE place to stay". I've been to a lot of nice places, but with all honesty, with this hotel we all felt like celebrities from the moment we stepped in the door. The employees are extremely professional and courteous. Everyone had a smile on their face, and was friendly and helpful. The hotel is beautiful, the grounds are gorgeous, and the rooms, while standard size, are very pretty and the bathroom was very spacious. We loved the pools, especially the Lazy River, and other touches including the poolside movies and the complimentary botanical walks with a local geologist. There was relaxing New Age type music playing in their botanical garden, and sometimes in their dining areas. It added to the natural setting, as did the baby bunnies, quail families, and hummingbirds that we saw on a regular basis. I would like to place golf there sometime--just not when it's 111 degrees outside. A wonderful hotel, in a nice setting. There is also a large shopping and entertainment complex nearby, so there is plenty to do. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “On Target”
Reviews.Author: RustyS2345
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the customer centric experience you would expect at a JW hotel! We checked my 82 year old mother into the JW at Desert Ridge in Phoenix for a two night stay during a family gathering because of a lack of space at my home....she ended up staying 5 nights. And why not....the hotel staff, especially in the restaurants, pampered her as though she was a VIP. From a stay of convenience, her experience at the JW became her special vacation. During her first visit to one of the casual breakfast restaurants, my mother ordered a bagel requesting that it be particularly soft, a requirement when you reach that age. The waitress ended up bringing her a warmed croissant noting that the bagels, while fresh, would present a challenge to chew. My mother loved the personalized attention but really appreciated the compassion. Our family took advantage of her stay to enjoy the incredible poolside facilities (water slide, lazy river float experience, tree shaded areas, etc.); my mother put on a bathing suit for the first time in 10-15 years. If you can motivate her into a bathing suit at 82 years old, you have passed the "that's incredible" threshold. Lastly, her mobility is somewhat limited necessitating a longer wait with the car at the front entrance; the greet staff was courteous, patient and understanding.

Reviews.Title: “OMG, What a Great Place”
Reviews.Author: travelfrmaz
Reviews.Content: I took the kids to Scottsdale to go shopping on Sunday and we decided at the last minute to go down the night before. We were able to get a room, a good deal in the summer too. When we arrived we were greated by the valet who took our car promptly and unloaded things for us. There were four of us in our party and the room was just a bit small but that was because the beds are small. But we were fine with that and even had a roll away brought up which was nice. We ate dinner at the golf club steak house. Nice but the service was slow a bit and they forgot a lot. It was quite expensive too and we kept feeling like we were being watched or something. You know the feeling, like everyone thinks that you dont belong there. But we ignored that and had a good meal. We swam that night in one of the pool and that was nice and relaxing. While we did that we could hear the live music playing in the patio area which made the moolight even more special. We did use roomservice for night snacks and that was prompt and good. That is 24 hours too. The bathroom was beautiful with a seperate shower and tub. Everything in marble and well stocked. The bath goodies that they give you are wonderful and we had to get some from the spa store to take home so we could have them there too. The beds are very very comfortable and I slept well. However, fitting two people on the bed if they arent children is quite hard. For two adults a King Bed would be best. In the morning we had breakfast at the Blue Sage Restr. on the grounds and that was wonderful and well priced. I will go back there over and over again to eat when we visit. The pool area is nice, however if you are going to swim at night be sure to take your own towel as there are none around the pool area that are clean. In the morning however you can find clean towels and a good place to sit around the lazy river or the pools. The service at the pools is great and prompt. We are going back at the end of the month because we loved it so much. They way that they have laid this property out is wonderful and they have decorated it beautifuly. This is the place that our family will go over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort”
Reviews.Author: BelieverMI
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a six day vacation at the Desert Ridge Resort in Phoenix, AZ. We stayed there on a great deal through the Marriott Vacation Club package. We paid only $75 per night (for the first 4 nights). We were required to take a 90 minute tour of the Canyon Villas (on the grounds of the JW) which were beautiful. The resort is beautiful. The rooms were very clean and organized. The pool area was wonderful. There were always chairs and towels. The staff serving the pool area was constantly serving pitchers of water (free). The shopping area across the street provided additional dining options as well as entertainment. We will visit this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Getaway... no need to leave the grounds!”
Reviews.Author: Travlin'Bug
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at this resort in Dec. '05, and it was a wonderful experience... the most luxurious resort we'd ever stayed in. The grounds are immaculate and the aroma is refreshing as you stroll past the herbal gardens. The many pools are incredible, and spread out enough that couples can find a quiet spot to enjoy the Arizona weather on one side of the resort while families are enjoying the the lazy river with the kids on the other side. The views of the mountains are spectacular, and my husband enjoyed the challenging golf course. The restaurants are excellent, many on site, and there is a Starbucks in one of many halls. While we were there, a handbell choir entertained with Christmas Carols one evening; a jazz band the following night. The outdoor fireplaces are a great place to relax in the evening & staffed to serve you if you'd like a coffee by the fire. The spa is equally wonderful and it has it's own private pool reserved for spa guests... a quiet place to relax. The rooms are luxurious and the beds very comfortable; the bathrooms are beautiful and spacious. You don't have to leave the resort for anything... a very pleasing & relaxing getaway. Yet, it is a great location if you choose to venture out & shop in Scottsdale or drive to the mountains... upscale shopping & restaurants are nearby. We will definitely return again, and maybe someday bring the kids to enjoy the pools. You won't be dissappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Getaway at Desert Ridge”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four day getaway at the Desert Ridge Resort in Phoenix, AZ. We were upgraded to a view room upon arrival and treated courteously by all the staff. You are left with the impression that the employees at the Desert Ridge enjoy their work at the resort. The Starbucks on site made for a wonderful start to our mornings. You could enjoy a weekend with someone special or with your family. The Desert Ridge has ample room to find peace and quiet as well as enjoyable family activities. The Lazy River was a highlight of our stay. There is a large shopping area less than a mile away with movie theaters and addional dining options. There were three of us staying at the resort and we all had treatments at the Revive Spa. Ask for Constance. The clay wrap was divine!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Marriot Resort”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoGolfNut
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the Easter weekend at the JW Marriot Desert Ridge Spa and Resort. This resort was absolutely fabulous. The outstanding service started the moment we arrived. It was amazing to arrive at 7:30am in morning from a flight, and have a room waiting for you. The staff was superb. Courteous, professional, and most of all, helpful. They went out of their way to ensure you had whatever you needed. The facility was superior. The pools and the lazy river raft ride were clean and inviting, especially after a round of golf on one of the two world class golf courses. The Wildfire Golf Club was truly worth the trip. We enjoyed both the Arnold Palmer and Nick Faldo courses so much that we played 18 holes on one day and 36 holes the next. The Pro Shop staff was always courteous and treated golfers to a memorable golf experience. Everything from cleaning and packing your clubs, to having your cart ready to go in the morning with your clubs already on board. We had a chance to sample all of the restaurants in the resort, all were very good. The Meritage Steak House, Roys, and the Blue Sage all served delicious food in a relaxed resort atmosphere. Especially nice was having a Starbucks right off the lobby of the hotel. More hotels should take note of that feature. Phoenix and the JW Marriot Desert Ridge Spa and Resort are definitely on all of our travel plans for the future.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise oasis in the desert”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The moment I pulled into the grounds of the hotel I was blown away by the size of the resort. Soon as I stepped out of the towncar that took us from the airport I was greeted by the wonderful resort staff who welcomed me to Phoenix. Then the bell staff took my luggage and then up to the room, along the way he was telling us about the area and what to and not do to in Phoenix. I planned a side trip to the Grand Canyon and he even told us the best way to get there. We had a standard room which was very nice for 2 people. Beautiful bathrooms are the norm. Bed is very confortable and easy to fall asleep on. We had a nice view of the grounds on our balcony and was nice just to sit out there and enjoy the weather and ambient sounds of the resort. The hotel restaurants are all great and the food is top notch. I highly recommend the butterfish at Roy's and the Salmon dish at the italian place there (forgot the name). When you get out to the main pool area (which there are a lot of different pools) you get to experience how nice the place really is. There are waterfalls, tons of desert flowers, cacti, etc to look at. There were plenty of chairs available and the area was not overly crowded at all. We were there on the weekend and you still can find a place to sit, even in the afternoon. You can sit anywhere and the staff will come by and take your food and drink order and you can eat right by the pool. The lazy river is great to get out of the hot sun and you can relax in there for hours on end just floating aournd. They even have a waterslide for the kids. I saw all different types of people, families, etc, so everyone is welcome here and kids are not a problem. They have 2 fitness centers, one where you have to pay $10 for that includes other spa services, and a free one, which I used and is better than your average hotel gym. They had 8 new treadmills, ellipitcals, free weight area, bikes, etc. Better weight machines are in the pay gym though. Golf courses are well maintained and very challenging. I do not play golf that much, but it was one of the nicest courses I have played. There are 2 and I played the Faldo one. They have a car rental place in the hotel so you can rent a car, like we did and drive to the Grand Canyon or other places. We were with a group of people who paid for our stay at the hotel, if not I am sure I could not afford the $300 plus a night. It is a bit pricy, but worth the trip. One of the nicest resorts I have ever stayed at!! The only small problem I had was there were a lot of birds flying around. Just watch your food so they do not start picking at it!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome resort, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: travelerMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Breathtaking surrounds, quiet, excellent attentive staff, but way too pricey unless you can get room for a reduced rate. Rooms are above average but not for the listed price. Pools and golf course excellent. Free laundromat & detergent a bonus. Convenient mall 15 min walk from resort with alternative meal choices. No convenient transport except by resort's towncar.

Reviews.Title: “Would returen in a heartbeat...”
Reviews.Author: Fe
Reviews.Content: Been here before...loved it! Returned once again...loved it even more and didn't even have time to experience everything. Pools were fantastic...splurge and tan out at the Spa pool for a more serene atmosphere. Although I didn't have a spa treatment, I did attend spin classes at the spa which were quite a workout...bring your SPD compatible cycling shoes...they have compatible spin bikes. The spa has a workout room that you can use for a nominal fee. A fee-less work-out room is also available but I found that to be quite crowded in the morning. Didn't have time to golf...I'll do that next time. I'll have a spa treatment next time. Room was comfortable and quiet. Beds like clouds. Large bathrooms with many amenities. Efficient housekeeping. Food...excellent, but pricey. Tuscany--lovely Italian with great waitstaff. Roy's-- hoppin' place with eclectic Asian. Meritage--a beef eaters paradise...ask for waiter Jose! Poolside bar--huge salads and entrees feed two. Even the food at the conference I was attending was good--mounds and mounds of fresh berries! Looking forward to my next visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Easter fun”
Reviews.Author: denvrgal
Reviews.Content: Went for a quick getaway Easter weekend with our 2 kids. Great resort, great weather, great fun. Our kids were in the pools all day, every day. They loved the lazy river, water slide and other pools. Pool food was decent and found prices here at the pool (for food & drink) acceptable. Ate most dinners at Dessert Ridge mall across the street (since our kids don't really appreciate fine dining) which consisted of Mimi Cafe, Rock Bottom Brewery, BJs Brewery (chicago style pizza), and On the Border. There are others too, but that's some of the choices. We did eat dinner one night at the resort at Tuscany (Easter dinner) - it was just ok. There were shortages on Sat & Sun of towels at the pool - for a long time on Saturday. Also, we had probelems not getting towels in our room from the cleaning service, and then when we did, the nightime service would take them away and not replace them. I feel this was an issolated incident though and not respresentative of the overall stay. Our kids participated in the free Easter activities, which were well organized. All in all, a great place & we would return. The only thing I would change, is we had 2 beds and they were doubles, not queens. I don't see why they can't fit queens instead, they have the room and adults traveling with their kids would be more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with the Desert Ridge”
Reviews.Author: AllieBrookie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited this hotel in early April for a weekend getaway for some sunshine. Our main purpose was to relax, and this hotel was perfect for that. We spent two days lounging by the pools, enjoying the lazy river (fun even for adults!) and the excellent pool-side drink and lunch service. We ate dinner at the resort two nights -- one night at Roy's and one night at the Meritage Steakhouse. Roy's was excellent and we'd highly recommend it, but we do not recommend the steakhouse. Service there was terrible and the steaks weren't that great either -- especially for the high prices. We loved the Starbucks that was on-site. It was so wonderful to have a leisurely morning, sipping our Starbucks on the store's patio and enjoying the beautiful desert botanical gardens. We found the hotel rooms to be of decent size. The bedding was wonderful and bathrooms were nice. Everything felt very new and was very clean. We wouldn't hesitate to return to this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced small rooms but beautiful hotel resort.”
Reviews.Author: pwrshift
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights April 7&8, 2006. The room was about the same size (12’w x 16’) as a Holiday Inn but the rate was $450 a night. Nicely furnished with the Revive bedding but 3 uncomfortably narrow chairs. There was no place to put anything in the double room and we were tripping over each other. Even the coffee maker was hidden away in the closet. The desk had an experimental computer on it you could use for $10 a day, so that took up even more room. Even the tub was tiny, but the separate shower was OK. This is a huge hotel with 950 rooms on only 5 floors, the largest in AZ they said, so it fans out like spokes on a wheel from the lobby in the hub. Getting a pool view means you are pretty much at the end of the spokes and a long walk from the lobby where the restaurants were. We got lost a couple of times finding the room, getting to the end of the wrong ‘spoke’ and had to go back and start all over again. Everything is first class and quite impressive. Staff friendly and happy to serve. We joined the Cloud Club – like a concierge room any guest can have for an extra $150 a night per room (max. 2 people) that includes complimentary drinks in the room from 4-10 pm each day including weekends, appetizers from 5-6 pm, dessert & cordials at 8 pm, and a chef prepared hot breakfast from 7-11 am. In addition they make dinner reservations for you, as well as for tennis, spa and golf. There is only one computer to log on with and no WIFI yet (although WIFI is available in the upper lobby). Cloud Club staff are very anxious to please and is a new project started Jan. 9, 2006. It is a large very comfortable room. So that took our daily rate to $600 before taxes. Dinner one night was at Tuscany restaurant on site. It was a beautiful Italian restaurant but the service is spotty. It was the first Italian restaurant where we had to ask for bread … then had to ask for butter. From the moment we ordered drinks the waiter wanted us to give him the order – after 4 requests if we were ready we told him we’d signal him when we wanted to order. We ordered Lobster Bisque (excellent) at $8 each, Rack of Lamb (excellent) for $26 and Veal Scaloppini (ordinary) for $24. The next night we ate at Roy’s and had their price fixed $33 meal. It was very good – the chocolate explosion excellent. We found Roy's service more acceptable but both restaurants would have you outta there in 20 minutes if they could. The grounds of this hotel are outstanding.. they even have a ‘lazy river’ where you can get on a tire and float around the entire thing in about 5 minutes. Other pools are plentiful and nice. After dinner drinks outside on the patio with live music at a fire pit is dreamy. People staying at the adjacent timeshare, Marriott Canyon Villas, have full use of the facilities of the hotel too. Valet parking is $20. Self park is free but a hike – they do have a shuttle for that.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest Starbucks we've ever visited”
Reviews.Author: NoRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: In heaven, you will wake up in the morning, take a shower in a fantastic bathroom adorned with beautiful marble, and then you'll get dressed (in shorts, I might add, because it's always sunny in heaven). Next you'll walk down a flight of stairs to your own, private, yes, I'm not kidding...Starbucks! We're not talking that "we proudly serve Starbucks coffee" ruse you've seen at other hotels. We're taking a bona fide, pleasantly staffed real Starbucks. Then it gets better. You take your coffee and go to the lobby and sit in one of those comfy chairs and just people watch. Or you might stroll through the grounds that were absolutely breathtaking. (If you think of a desert as scruffy cactus and sagebrush, this will turn you around.) Or you might just go watch the kids having the times of their lives floating down the Lazy River on their inner tubes. You might have a well-prepared, reasonably-priced meal outdoors. You might watch the Final Four in the lobby on special big-screen TVs they brought in for the occasion. Or you might just sit in the sun and blow off the spring training baseball games you thought you came to see. Now, a word about the rooms: We thought they were nicer than average, despite what you'll read on this site. Our room was lovely, with a great view of the gardens. More important, the people were lovely. Upon checking in at around 6 pm we were at first thrilled to find out about the Starbucks, and then disappointed to hear that it had just closed for the day. Standing there looking forlorn, a Marriott employee walked by and said "oh, did you want a Starbucks?" He then opened the door and asked the staff to make one more latte which they cheerfully did. When we reached in our wallet to pay, the Marriott employee smiled and said "this one's on us." Can you ask for better than that? So was there anything wrong at all with our stay at the J.W. Marriott? Yes. It ended too soon. P.S. - In the spirit of adventure we decided to check out the Hyatt Regency in Scottsdale for a couple of nights. An unfortunate decision on our part. Go read the reviews of that hotel and you'll recognize ours (quack!), and then make your reservation ONLY at the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “DO YOURSELF A FAVOR”
Reviews.Author: mikedoylestown
Reviews.Content: Well done Marriott. Wonderful three day stay. Great room. Dining outside. Superb staff (some interns from Germany were also exceptional) Beautiful grounds. Water? Everywhere. Pools, rivers, splashing fountains. Stunning at nite. Only downer was room ac did not work in winter. Loved it so much bought a timeshare.

Reviews.Title: “hang out in this beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: longtimeresident
Reviews.Content: If, like me, one of your hobbies is luxury hotels, you might like to see this one. The grounds and the public areas are georgeous. So many palm trees! We were there during the great weather in March, and the huge hotel lobby was open to the outside pool area, making it feel very spacious and inviting. You can sit around fire pits, near the pool, in the lobby, or back by the golf course. A great hotel for hanging out, and at these high spring prices, you want to and get your money's worth. The "lazy river" is perfect for kids. The spa is beautiful, and you can spend hours there just relaxing. Just across a street is an upscale shopping center with many restaurants and a grocery store, so it is great for families. The only thing I would not rave about are the rooms - the bathrooms are wonderful, but the rooms themselves are slightly above standard Marriott. But most have incredible views! I have stayed at many nice hotels and this is one of the most pleasant for just spending time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HockeyMomNJ
Reviews.Content: My husband & I spent 3 nights at his hotel for a business conference he was attending. The hotel is huge and very beautiful! The staff was very attentive although on the second day we did tell the front desk that our coffee maker wasn't working and also that we would like non-down pillows. Neither problem was ever taken care of to our satisfaction. Our room was clean and spacious - the bathroom was enormous! Had lunch one day at the poolside restaurant. Good casual food, reasonably priced. The spa was overpriced for what you got. We each booked massages. My husband was satisfied with his but I don't think I got the quality of massage that I've experienced elsewhere. There's a shuttle bus to take you to the resort condos or across the road to a nice shopping mall. Also a shuttle to take you to the airport. (Not one that you can take from the airport to the hotel, though.) Otherwise you need a car to get anywhere. Taxis turned out to be very expensive. Did not get to try out the lazy river or any of the pools since Phoenix was having unusually cold weather at the time. Overall we would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!”
Reviews.Author: Cynergy
Reviews.Content: I don't know when I've ever been this impressed with a hotel/resort. I now have a new gold standard for service. I can't say enough about the pristine facility, the attentive and knowledgeable staff or the quality of offerings. This is a beautiful resort - huge and well-kept with gorgeous grounds, several swimming pool areas and (according to my husband) two top-drawer golf courses. Our room was lovely although nothing outside a standard Marriott or Renaissance room, but the bathroom was stellar - big and well-appointed. Our room was in a back wing, facing the spa building and was extremely quiet and peaceful with the added bonus of great sunset views! Every staff member we came in contact with was very courteous and every one of our questions was answered without hesitation. I've never been treated so well. And I must say a word about the on-site restaurants, at least the three I experienced. Breakfast at Blue Sage was surprisingly good (go for a Mexican breakfast entree - delicious!), lunch at Meritage Steakhouse (on the patio) was delightful and dinner at Roy's was exceptional. This Roy's far surpassed the one on Maui, expecially the ambiance and service, which was enthusiastic and detailed. And I love having Starbucks at my disposal - in the morning and in the evening. And we were surprised at the reasonable dining prices, especially after just being in Las Vegas (where prices are outlandish). This resort has a lot to recommend it - and I do - - highly!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: amlamay
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure that the pp stayed at the same place as me!! This place was amazing. The service unbelievable. As soon as you got there valet was waiting checking in was flawless even though we were 6 hours before check-in time. The rooms were nice but nothing "so special" for the price. But they were definatly clean. We had our 8 month old son, they had a crib in our room and a pack and play for us to carry around with us. The pools were a dream. We popped up the Pack and Play put up an umbrella and all enjoyed the day. The pool was large but had several strips and smaller pools for privacy for those of us that are not excited about how we look in a bathing suit. The service at the pool was good and drinks were $9 but you could double the size for $13.50. So $6-7 per drink which really isn't bad for a pricey resort. The concierge was amazing. They recommend two different off the beaten path restaurants that were wonderful and full of character. There are little firepits throughout the resort. We mentioned while stand at the concierge desk it would be fun to make smore's. The girl working the counter started a furious search (9PM) for supplies for us. She called the executive chef at home and asked where to find marshmallows... we kept telling her don't do this we can go to the store! She kept insisting she would find them, after waiting a few minutes we told her we would go to our room and to call if she happened upon them. She told us earlier she was off at 9:30. At about 10 we had knock on our door. We opened it, she had went to the store, after her shift, and bought us stuff to make them!! My husband kept saying, Wow there are still people like that in the world? Our whole experience was delightful! Yes... it is pricey but if you're going to spend that much this resort is awesome!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: pmschneidau
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent two nights here for a short getaway to warm weather. My wife works for Marriott, and I stay in hotels over 150 nights a year, so we both have a good basis for comparing hotels to each other. First of all, the resort is beautiful. The gardens are immaculate and go beyond just being pretty. There is just something about a stylish building (that's only 6 stories tall) surrounded by ponds, fountains, pools, lawns, flowers, golf courses, and LOTS of palm trees. You could easily mistake this for a Hawaiian island setting. Our room was above average, overall. It was pretty big, with a large bathroom and bright walls, it was very clean, and there is a hint of some kind of flower perfume that is pleasant when you walk in. I was surprised that for $500 a night, though, that guests still have to pay $10 daily if they want internet access. You can stay at Courtyard by Marriott for under $100 w/ free internet. The pools were very warm at 86 degrees, and the Lazy River was nice and relaxing. There seems to be lots and lots of space for guests at the pools - hundreds of lounge chairs. The fitness center is great - all new equipment, including cardio w/ individual televisions, free weights, and machines. All of the hotel staff was very professional and pleasant. We ate at Roy's one night and off-property for all other meals. Roy's was nothing to write home about. We had eaten at the one in Pebble Beach, which was very good, but this one was about a 7 out of 10. We ordered the appetizer sampler platter, and everything was delicious, though pricey at $25. The entrees we ate were two of Roy's signature dishes - "macadamia nut encrusted mahi-mahi w/ lobster Cognac sauce" and soy-glazed butterfish. Both fish were cooked well and tasted good, but lacked depth of flavor. They was no explosion of flavors in the mouth. So, the meal was good, but not outstanding in my opinion. Service was very slow every step of the way, from taking our order, to getting a drink, to getting dessert (it took over 30 minutes even though we ordered the souffle with our dinner order, as recommended on the menu). They came around early on and gave us each 1 breadroll (yum!), but despite my requests for another roll, we never saw the bread guy again the entire night. There are plenty of places to eat near the hotel, if you don't want to go fancy all the time. We spent a whole day in Old Town Scottsdale. We highly recommend a sundae at The Sugar Bowl and authentic Mexican food at Los Olivos. So, I think the Marriott is a very nice hotel, but probably a bit pricey for the average traveler, espescially considering the cost of eating on-site.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I absolutely could not WAIT to leave this place. Granted I was there for a conference but still. The room was ok (but stains on carpet and ceiling) but very standard Marriott, nothing special AT ALL. The service was, with VERY few exceptions, absolutely terrible. Food was ok. Note that this hotel was built to take advantage of the HUGE conferences that take place in AZ around this time of year. Do not, and I repeat DO NOT, think about going there for a vacation. Horrible!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: flygirla
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 days for a conference. First of all, the hotel and grounds are absolutely beautiful. Four heated pools and a heated lazy river that was fabulous. The food at all the hotel restaurants were great except for the Meritage Steakhouse- I didn't care for my meal there. Be prepared for the prices, though. Everything is way overpriced, but since it's a resort I expected that. They have a private swimming area by the Spa and also a good restaurant there where they served healthy smoothies and salads. Also, the staff was super friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: hazlejo
Reviews.Content: Everything about this place, my wife and I loved. I'm not going to be able to be objective in this review because I can't think of a thing that wasn't outstanding. The grounds, the lobby and the rooms are beautiful. Everyone was friendly and accomodating. There's a wonderful smell that permiates the place. They play this soft ambient music throughout the botanical garden. Our room was located on that side of the building and the smell and sounds at night set the tone for some of the world's best sleeping conditions. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was so elegant and stylish, my wife took a picture of it. The pools are beautiful, the lazy river had as many adults as kids lazing round and round most of the day. So many places to just flop and be comfortable. I'm not able to comment on the spa or golf, as I didn't use these facilities but I can tell you they were both also very pleasant to just be around. If there wasn't so many other places in the world I want to see, I'd come back to this place every chance I could. I don't think I've ever had a more wonderful and relaxing week in my life (outside of Maui).

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: bdouty
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Desert Ridge from 12/27 to 1/01. We had picked it over the Biltmore based on reviews here. It met but did not exceed our expectations. Big hotel, nice facilities but starting to show wear after only three years. Pretty crowded and noisy (Fiesta Bowl attendees) - good for families but not for couples who want a romantic getaway. Rooms nice but nothing special - beds could be improved. Service above average overall, especially in Cloud Club (but you're paying extra so it should be better). My husband is a serious golfer and gives good marks to both courses. But as a first time visitor to Phoenix, I must say I don't know what the attraction is other than the weather. Wasn't overly impressed by anything I saw there. Took a day trip to Sedona - that was impressive, especially views at Enchantment resort(and that gets spotty reviews). Tuscany restaurant meal very enjoyable, but at the Meritage steakhouse they were just about throwing the food at us. And I just wish people would learn to dress in something other than jeans in nicer resort restaurants. Nice break from Minneapolis weather, but I don't know if I'd return. My husband will, but year-round golf is the attraction for him.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay JW Desert Ridge”
Reviews.Author: cheesecake92
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed with our family for Thanksgiving weekend at the JW Desert Ridge. We had a total of 3 rooms and chose to stay at the Cloud Club level, Executive Suite rooms. Glad we made that choice - the rooms were very comfortable, large & roomy, beautiful view of the mountains beyond, well maintained and housekeeping did a very good job. The Cloud Club level was excellent. They could not do enough for us and the Cloud Club level facility was the best! Breakfast was great - they offered something for everyone and if we did not see what we wanted - all we had to do was to ask and they accomodated us. Light tastings and drinks were available later in the day and coffee & dessert in the evenings. It worked out just perfectly for our family. The staff at the Cloud Club level was outstanding - Ken, Sharon, Laura -& everyone else were unbelievably friendly. The hotel has amazing pools and the grounds are beautiful and very well kept. The lazy river pool is great fun as is the water slide. One evening they had a western singer outside with a fire going and had the children make s'mores over the open fire - it was a real treat! The food at the different restaurants were very good as were the service. Many choices to please our whole group. The only meal that we did not enjoy was dinner at Roy's. The food was good, not great - but the service was a nightmare. We all enjoyed treatments at the great spa. A beautiful facility and very well run. I like to stay at top quality hotels & definitely consider this hotel to be on my list of top quality resorts. It was a great Thanksgiving family trip and I highly recommend the JW Marriott Desert Ridge.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service for wheel charis, really desapointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in October 2003 when I could walk and I rated this hotel as a great one. What a disappointment for me two years later, this October 2005, when I traveled with my wheelchair after a spinal column problem and cancer, and when the employees from the entrance were there just for getting the easy tip for collect car keys and drive away, but were not available INMEDIATLY (as it was two years ago) to help me and my wife with any help we need for take up my wheelchair or take it down with my shopping bags. This happened in 11 of 12 occasions during a 5 days stay when we came in and out of the hotel for shopping, mass, etc. Hotel is beautiful, but their staff wasn't there for me. I would never stay at this hotel again, and of course will never recommend it to any of my friends

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this resort. Our package included free breakfast which was wonderful. We had a choice between the buffet or menu items. I chose the buffet which consisted of made to order omelettes, pancakes, and waffles. There were also many other pre-prepared hot and cold items to choose from. The resort itself is beautiful and makes you feel like you're miles and miles away from home. There was live entertainment in the evenings so you could sit outside and enjoy it. Roy's restaurant is excellent. It is open for dinner only. I recommend the Blackened Ahi Tuna and the chocolate souffle. It was so good that we had dinner there two nights in a row. The pools were crowded during the day, but it was too hot for us to be by the pools during the day anyway. We used the hot tubs and pools at night which was nice since it was less crowded. The fitness center was great. I especially liked that it was open 24 hours and there weren't any hidden "resort fees" to use the fitness center. My favorite part was Revive Spa. The facility is absolutely gorgeous. Treatment includes full use of the facility which includes a fitness center, steam room, showers, jacuzzi, sauna, as well as a beautiful outdoor pool and spa. There is a cute little restaurant that you can have lunch at after your massage. We actually had lunch in our robes and slippers. There is also a relaxation room that you can enjoy before and after your treatment. I had a Swedish massage one time and a Hot Stone Massage another time. I was not impressed with the Hot Stone Massage. Mainly because my therapist took too much time to prepare the stones which took away from my massage time. Lastly, the room itself was nice, very clean and comfortable. We had a beautiful view of the golf course. This is an expensive hotel, but there are great seasonal packages. We have been to many resorts and this is one of my favorites. I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: dobie102977
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Phoenix and a stay at the JW. Still conflicted on my feelings regarding our stay. My husband was out there for a conference and it just happened that our anniversary was the day after the conference ended. So I flew out a few days after he did and we just extended our stay. Overall I enjoyed it. The grounds are breathtaking! The food is great and everyone is very friendly. I really liked the location because it was located between Phoenix and Scottsdale and close to the freeway. It made getting around very easy. The staff was very helpful and always had smiles on their faces. Like I've already said the grounds are amazing. I really can't say enough about that and it really made up for the bad things (I'll get to those). There is a patio just outside the lobby that has several tables and lounge chairs with firepits and it was always the place to be in the evening and early morning. I really enjoyed taking a book and just hanging out. The pools are very nice and never seemed crowded. Okay so here are the few negatives. The pools weren't heated and it wasn't very comfortable to swim. However, this was in November. Second, I called two weeks in advance and spoke with someone at the hotel. I explained that my husband was going to be there for the conference but that I would be flying in halfway through the week for our anniversary. I told her it would be great if we could get a room with a good view and a king sized bed. When my husband got there he was put in a room with doubles. He told the front desk I would be there in 3 days for our anniversary and could they move him as soon as a king came available. So when I arrived 3 days later he was still in the doubles. We slept in seperate beds because I am 5 months pregnant and there was NO way we could both squeeze into one of those little beds. Not ideal on a romantic getaway. The next day we called and again requested a king room. We were called back around noon and were told our new room was ready and a bellman was on his way up to move us. We loaded everything up and made the trek across the hotel to our new room. When we opened up the door it was another double but the view was amazing (pools). The bellman called the front desk and explained we were wanting a king and again said it was for our anniversary. He was told which room to take us to but it was on the 3rd floor and overlooked the front drive! Not exactly romantic but we opted for the king vs. the view. This was the biggest problem we had. I know the hotel was sold out because of conferences. However, it just seems to me that someone would've thought to put more of the single business travelers into the doubles and leave the king rooms for couples. Also, over the course of a week can you really tell me there wasn't a king room with a decent view that came available. Also, my husband is a preferred Marriott reward holder. So much for rewarding loyalty that week. We did make the best of it and really enjoyed ourselves. Overall it was nice. Just a few little annoying things that keep me from giving it an "Excellent". Not sure if we'd stay again. If we knew the room situation would be better we would. However, because of the volume of conferences that seems unlikely.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely grounds and great breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: PYKZTF
Reviews.Content: Spent two days at this resort. Very clean and grounds were lovely. Got the package one night that included a full breakfast. The second night got the spa package which again included a full breakfast plus two 50 minute spa treatments. Breakfast was anything on the menu and included a buffet which was pretty much anything you can imagine-freshly made omelets, pancakes, many breakfast meats, potatoes and delicious fruit, not to mention sweets etc! It was great. We eat so well that we were not hungry until dinner. Spa was nice, facial was ok. Used the spa pool which was a bit more private.Biggest complaint was the fact I was ignored for an hour at the pool when I wanted something to drink. Every waiter didn't come near the area I was in. So strange, but I finally got someone's attention and service was fine. The Desert Ridge Marketplace was across the street and we ate our dinners there. The meals at the resort were expensive and a bit more expansive than we really wanted to eat. Starbucks on premises which was a nice touch as I like their coffee. The room is nice, nothing out of this world but comfy bed and very clean. Ask for a pool side room as they are the best. Do not get a room around the Isle of Capri unless you want to look at the most lifeless view in the resort. No color, no interest. We will try another resort on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful family resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: kelmorris
Reviews.Content: Our family of five had a fantastic experience at the JW Marriott Desert Ridge. Even before we arrived i was impressed with the staff -- especially Cookie at the conciege desk. She was extremely helpful, kind and professional as she made recommendations and reservations for us for dinner as well as excursions. Check-in was a breeze - the porters were quick and helpful. Our room was very clean with a large bathroom. The kids loved the balcony which had beautiful desert views and overlooked a golf course. The grounds were beautifully maintained and the pools were a HUGE hit especially the lazy river! Since we have three young children we decided to use their valet service -- well worth the money as it quite a hike to the parking lots. The valets were always friendly and attentive. We ate poolside one afternoon and everything was fresh and delicious. We appreciated the chilled lemon water in the lobby which was so refreshing given the temperatures stayed around 112 degrees during our vacation. One excursion we went on was a desert tour via Hummer with Stellar Adventures. Our guide was fantastic - very knowledgeable about the indigenous plant and animal life and very friendly and helpful. Take time to go to DC Ranch - a planned community not far form the resort - great restaurants Eddie V's and San Felipe's Cantina. The Arizona Science Center was amazing -- we could have stayed all day. Wonderful, fun, educational and interactive activities for the kids (& adults)! As we headed to the airport, the kids were already asking when we could go back to the resort - always a good sign of a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, Nice pool, great restaurants”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a great resort resort. The only drawback is it's distance from Phoenix and Scottsdale. It has several restaurants with great food choices, including Roy's. I would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort!!”
Reviews.Author: JULES821
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely beautiful resort. I took a solo trip to the resort in July 2005 for some much needed rest and relaxation. The rooms are clean, pretty, and nicely sized. The pool area is spectacular with 3-4 pools and a lazy river. The spa was awesome! I had four spa treatments while staying at the resort and the service and ambiance of the spa was the best (I took advantage of a great "BUY 1, GET 1 FREE" summer spa service special). An added bonus is that there is a huge shopping/entertainment/dining complex directly across the street from the hotel. I highly recommend this resort to anyone looking for a nice vacation. Do not be deterred by the fact that this hotel hosts lots of conferences. The hotel is so massive that there is enough space for everyone -- conference attendees and pleasure travelers alike!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just came back from the JW Marriott last night on Sept 6th we were there for labor day weekend. This place is really beautiful considering 106 deg weather everyday. Then again who goes to Phoenix in Aug or Sept. Hahaha The resort is huge we got lost a few times trying to find our room. Everyone in the hotel meaning The Staff, were the most friendliest people I have ever met on a vacation. Service at the pools were very good too. The rooms were very nice with a very spacious bathroom and nice size deck. We were given a garden view first but they were very helpful in giving me a pool view with no hesitation. By the way you def dont need to rent a car there is a market place accross the street. 5 dollar cab ride. They have everything you need there, restaurants, shopping, drug store, target, malls everything. If you want to go a little further like 15 minutes or so there are some really elite restaurants. I forgot the name but it was seafood and very good, pricey but worth it. My only issue was that night we got there 2:45am some kids pulled the fire alarm waking the whole hotel. Living in NY and witnesing 911 we knew to get our stuff and get right down the steps and out. The whole hotel gathered outside front and back waiting for further instructions. It took like 25 minutes for them to shut the alarm which was annoying but it was just a false alarm.
